title: Nice and fine dining meet up
desc: We had the nice time last night. We catch up and meet up our friendly big brother. We celebrated my Mom’s birthday. So, once the associates knew, they made a surprise to my Mom with yummy tiramisu ruhmn cake in cup and raisin ice cream scoop. They also had option for vegetarian. Must try “impossible beef” burger. Highly recommend. All of the staff is skillful. Nice view with the quay and port view The pork chop, calamari are also nice. Definitely will come back

title: hotel lobby at 30th floor and higher floors on rooms
desc: I really like hotels that have their lobby half way up the building, which really gives great skyline views. Rooms are large and spacious, and a view of the harbor and ships even better. Only regret was that the infinity pool was under maintenance BUT they did have an arrangement with JW to use their pool and the Westin would provide transportation. Staff is extremely friendly and lobby very comfortable and original (met a friend for two hours)

title: Pretty good
desc: Large rooms, accomodated early check in, grand lobby and excellent buffet breakfast. Location pretty decent, couple of minutes to metro and easy to walk to gardens by bay or china town. Hawker style food court 2 minutes walk away. Lobby and bar have classy feel. Would have been nice to have been forewarned about pool closure. Items available for purchase in rooms are poisonously overpriced. $14 for 250ml water. Bedding very comfortable, bathroom excellent. Staff friendly. Would recommend.

title: Excellent service
desc: The service is excellent. The breakfast buffet is way overpriced ($53), it doesn't worth it. The cafe downstairs is very simple (isnt Starbucks) Location is very good, 3 blocks from the subway station.

title: Top Business Hotel
desc: I have been staying here quite a few nights and I have to say that I am very satisfied. The location is great if you have to work in the Financial Center, there is a Subway Station very close. Despite the fact that this hotel is rather large with 305 rooms, the staff is friendly and professional. I actually like that the rooms are quite modern, very clean and most of them have a great view. The quality of the food in the hotel is okay, I prefer less variety and more quality. The bar in the lobby is decent, it feels a bit cold (I don’t just mean the air con) and could use some more style. The pool is great, but could be a bit larger for swimming (currently under renovation) and the gym is well equipped and has a good view. Overall I am very satisfied and will stay here

title: Top notch business hotel in CBD
desc: Westin Singapore evokes the new hotel feel although it’s been a few years. Luxurious and comfortable heavenly bed awaits, and service from the team is very friendly and excellent; must say one of the better Westin in the region. Located right in CBD it’s an easy walk to marina bay sands. Gym is well equipped and their Westin run programme is excellent and worth to join for a quick tour of Singapore if you love running!

title: Review for Seasonal tastes, Westin Singapore
desc: Dinner buffet in Seasonal tastes, Westin Singapore, is amazing in food taste and service. Even though the price is expensive, it is worth to spend at there. If you through the "Chope" application, they have discount sometime. Recommended to go and try.

title: a nice dinning place
desc: Recently i went to this hotel for their one for one lobster buffet dinner. we got a seat near the window, the price is about $50 per pax (after the promo). the food serve was nice and they replenished the food quite fast. worth going if they are having a promotion.

title: Amazing Hotel! Relaxing experience
desc: I stayed at the Westin this month during my first trip to Singapore. The hotel is wonderful! The lobby is fresh, open and modern. The hotel is maintained very well and looks and feels new. Each staff person I encountered was friendly and polite. The front desk was welcoming! I was upgraded to a suite, which was a very large room with a large bathroom and sleeping area. The room itself was so comfortable and relaxing. The bed was comfortable and the air conditioning worked well. I ate lunch and dinner in the hotel at Seasonal Tastes and had breakfast in the Club Lounge. There was a good variety of food and I enjoyed that the lobby level of the hotel was midway in the building so you could enjoy the views while at the restaurant. Please take time to visit the pool. What a

title: A good hotel
desc: It is hard to fault this hotel, the staff are very helpful, the food is good the room large, the AC work maybe a bit too well, the view over the dock and harbour will keep you fascinated for hours. The only problem is the food and beverage prices are a little high especially over a weekend. but it not the right hotel for a holiday visit as it is in the centre of the financial area.

title: incredible views from infinity pool
desc: first time in Singapore for 3 days and I am so happy I choose this hotel. It was a short walk from the main attractions of shopping centres, marina bay sands and the Gardens. Very close to the subway and restaurants. The staff were very accommodating and even helped me to make the most of my short stay. They gave advice on what to see and when etc. My room was luxury and had everything I needed. The bath was amazing, the bed was extremely comfortable and the views looked over the city. The infinity pool had spectacular views and was very quiet.

title: Excellent in every respect
desc: This hotel has figured out how to exceed its guests’ expectations in every respect. The lounge near reception and the rooms have awesome views. The rooms are modern, clean, comfortable, and filled with amenities, including a big screen TV, and wi-fi. The bathroom fixtures were modern, efficient and very comfortable, especially the shower. The fitness facilities and pool were also extraordinary. The food in the dining facilities was excellent and so was staff. Nui, the Assistant Manger, and Kelvin were friendly, helpful and very professional, and the price was reasonable. The hotel is also located near the Downtown subway station for quick access to the entire city. I stayed two days and found the hotel and its staff excellent in every respect.

title: Just OK
desc: Generally, perfectly fine business hotel. Large room, good shower, comfy bed, OK service, decent selection at breakfast. I would have graded this 4, but I'm knocking a point off for the ridiculous number of LEDs and the non-dimmable clock in the bedroom which collectively were disruptive to sleep.

title: Seasonal Tastes - Good buffet in CBD area
desc: The food have lots of variety, sushi, fresh bread, local delight (Chicken rice, laska, soup noodle & etc), indian food, pasta, salad, dim sum, chinese food, meat loft, satay and dessert. I love their food.I was too full, I dont even have the chance to try their pasta. You will be spolit with their dessert too, ice cream sorbet, cakes, kueh, fruits chocolate fondue, blueberry chessecake and more...Another credits goes to their beautiful scenery. What a relaxing and satisfy lunch!!

title: one of my fave hotels
desc: ALWAYS a great stay. We love staying at this hotel. This stay was our 20th stay and we were given a fantastic upgrade to an amazing suite. The hotel had a pyjama party to raise awareness for their thread forward campaign. They send old bed sheets and other linens to be recycled, re-woven and turned into children’s pyjamas. A great idea. I was lucky enough to get an invite and also meet Lance the hotel manager and his lovely wife Michelle. I was a really nice evening and I felt quite special to get the invite. As always the rooms are immaculate, housekeeping don't miss anything here. The club lounge is a great bonus and the staff are all excellent. Patrick even remembered that my husband likes to have a G&T. The reception guys greet my husband by name before he has even

title: Top class
desc: After two weeks of a less than inspiring stay at anpother SPG member proprty (see other review) this comes as a breath of fresh air. Super friendly reception staff who make as feel we were really welcome as SPG platinum members. Also very quich and efficient in making a reservation to our favorite Peking Duck place and confirming it in writing in quick and efficient way, The location is great with rooms located on the high floors offering amazing harbour and city views with floor to ceiling windows inlcuding the bathroom. Very spacious room with state of the art amenities including Bose audio and Nespresso coffee machine. Bed was super comfy and helped recovering from the long trip. Very wide varitety of breakfast items. Too bad we are staying only for one night as it woujld

title: Excellent Corner Room & Magnificent Club Lounge
desc: My corner room was excellent, comfortable bed, Nespresso machine and spacious bathroom where I was able to keep an eye on the cruise ships coming and going. The room had a great telly to keep abreast of the Malaysian election aftermath and also watch the F1 ......I only wish more hotels in Singapore would show the English Premier League. The club lounge, where I thoroughly enjoyed the evening food and drinks as well as breakfast, was truly magnificent, a cut above many that I have frequented lately, both in terms of food quality and service. Lastly thanks to Ann on reception for helping me with several matters ......including recommending another Starwood property as the weekday rate here became too steep on account of an almost full house. Thank you!

title: Nice view and comfy room
desc: I got a room with a very nice view this time. I can clearly see sentosa from my room. It’s nearby the downtown mrt. The room is nice and comfy. Again, there are variety of restaurants within 10 mins walk by going through the mrt to the mall. I didn’t have a chance to try the food in the hotel as there are too many choices nearby. Overall, it’s a good experience to stay in Westin

title: Stellar service👍
desc: I would like to commend on the professional and helpful Duty Manager Rizal who had recommended me Seasonal Taste for Mother's day celebration. I'm impressed by the impeccable service provided by all staff from the moment i stepped into the lobby when I was greeted by them with serene and welcoming smile. I highly recommend Westin Singapore for the exceptional level of service not forgetting to mention it's breathtaking panoramic spectacular view it has got to offer to compliment the stylish and well furnished rooms scented with fragrances. Thanks to Rizal once again for the great recommendation,my mum was full of praises for the excellence choice made.One thing for sure, i'll definitely be back for more.Thumbs up! Eilliw

title: A Better Westin hotel
desc: After my last stay at Westin Beijing, I came to Singapore this week and was arranged to stay at Westin Singapore. It was not my first stay in this hotel, tried this hotel a few stays in 2015. Having said that, I felt quite excited to come back. I was upgraded to a room on the executive floor , but to be honest, the room is too spacious for one person. The hotel is very well located, in the center of CBD, close to everywhere. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The service is efficient. Overall the experience of staying here is better than that of Westin Beijing.

title: Great hardware but something missing.
desc: We had a short staycation here last month. Me and my boyfriend are a big fan of Starwood. The hotel is in a good condition. The room that we stayed located in front of the elevator but no noise disturbance. However, there were a spot on the service. Once we reach the foyer, no one greet us or offer luggage assistance (we may not carry much luggage but shouldn't happen). Compare with night shift staff that still smile and have a little conversation with us at 1am. Then again at the restaurant, we wore slippers. The hostess didn't notice us first since we entered but send another person to inform us when the food has been served. Full service hotel should notice this and never let this happen. I would love to give five stars as I really like the room and we have a great sleep here

title: Does not match up the standard as international buffet at Seasonal Tastes
desc: Upon stepping into the restaurant not long we noticed that the chefs behind the buffet counter were busy moving the food from the buffet counter to the cooking areas and food displayed on the buffet were lukewarm and many dishes were missing from the buffet counter, The end of buffet counter where the noodle station was completely in the darkness. Seem the chefs were too busy and facing their back to us i then approached this Chinese lady with black top standing behind the cooking area with a pot of piping hot noodle in front of her, She is all smiley and recommended i try the signature dish Hokkien noodle, She apologized to our family who are queuing up for food and explaining that the hotel have some issues with the power supplier and she reassured that the team currently is

title: Convenient for business in Singapore
desc: Super close to most meetings The rooms were spacious and nice. Staff were friendly. There is a lot of construction going on around the building, so something to be aware of. I found that the walls and doors were a bit thin. I could hear doors opening and closing a lot.

title: Great location and staff
desc: I stayed here on a business trip and the staff from the guys who greet you when your car arrives through to the guest services team on the phone in your room will do everything they can to make your stay the best it can. Would definitely recommend staying here as location is fantastic in terms of proximity to places to eat and bars.

title: Great hotel, excellent ambience, super view!
desc: The place is huge and spacious. The hotel is pretty new, nicely furnished and decorated. Clean and comfortable. The ambience is great, and the view is even better on the high floors! The staff is courteous and professional.

title: Hard to find jewel
desc: The hotel is a bit tricky to find the first time as it's located on the top floors of the building but that gives the rooms stellar views. I really liked this hotel and their staff. Not much for food offerings.

title: Utterly disappointed with the service
desc: My family checked in to this property for staycation last weekend. The view is awesome and the room is spacious. However, the room is not ready to serve the guest. I found out the USB port was not working as I need to charge my mobile. Despite trying to describe my issue to the operator using express service, the staff doesn't even know what is USB type C cable. Thus, arranged for a technician to come to my room. The technician confirmed that the panel wasn't working. Later on, to my surprise, the fridge was warm and the iPhone docking station has no power cord! Despite calling the operator and going to the counter several times, the staff did not offer to change the room for me. By the time I checked out of the property, the staff asked me if I'd enjoyed the stay. I shared my

title: Liked it...
desc: Heart of the new part of CBD where all the banks are. The hotel is located in a commercial building surrounded by other sky rise. The room is good size and the bathroom was beautiful and staff were helpful to suggest what good places around the area. I did not eat-in so cannot comment on the F&B but there is a nice bar to wind down after a long (hot) day. Definitely a place to stay to minimize the number of taxi rides to and from work if your company happens to be nearby but no doubt you will venture out at night. I liked it...

title: Great Hotel in CBD
desc: Was invited to a staycation with my niece at this hotel. Not to be mistaken from the ex -Westin which is located within City Hall MRT. I was still thinking of the old hotel when I got the invitation. Upon entering this new Westin, I immediately finds it pleasant and clean & relax although the location was not within any shopping or mrt. If you are seeking a good night sleep away from all the happenings in town, you may consider this place. We stayed on the 42th floor the view from our room and from the bathroom was awesome. It was overlooking the Chinatown street. Room size was good. My ever 1st staycation that I stayed in room all day and laze around and relax. The room service was good, food was delicious. Thumbs up for such a great hotel.

title: Exceptional stay
desc: At first it seems this hotel is lost in an industrial setting, but in truth it is an exceptional accommodation. The staff are all outstanding and the amenities can't be beat. I am a particular fan of the spa setting. Unfortunately, I did not take advantage of it until my last day at the hotel. I travel to Singapore quite a bit and would be very happy to stay at this location again.

title: Very comfortable and a great breakfast!
desc: Very clean, very efficient hotel in Asia Square in Singapore. Location probably not great for tourists, but then again nowhere in Singapore is far away from anywhere else. The room was comfortable, the air conditioning effective, wifi excellent, bath tub view was great. The breakfast buffet was amazing, catered for every taste and so much to choose from. An excellent business hotel and I would definitely stay again.

title: below standard service and absolutely unresponsive to any form of complaint
desc: My wife often stays in this hotel for business in Singapore (average of 20+ nights a year). So when I joined her on this trip we asked via email whether I could check in separately since I arrived on a different flight. Straight away we got slammed with a 30++ dollar a night because of double occupancy (I am SPG gold). I can promise you as as gold member of either the Hilton group or SPG since many years I never had to top up for a double occupancy, that (if any) fee ALWAYS gets waved, I can promise you that. The room was ok, but to be honest the hotel lost a lot of its freshness and charm from when it first opened years ago as a general remark. We were in a room opposite let's call it "the room with the cursed lock". One morning at 6:05 AM we were woken up because of

title: Beautiful Rooms
desc: Stayed here in June for 2 weeks for business. It was a good business hotel as it was close to the office. The rooms were beautiful and very well equipped with bath products, slippers, robe, great views and bathroom. Where I struggled was at times with the service. After arriving with 23 hours of traveling our rooms were not ready and when we asked about upgrades or early access to the lounge as we had access the answer was No, No, No. This seemed to be a bit of a theme. I recommend they start with Unfortunately we cannot assist at this time...etc. But starting a sentence with no is just annoying. Also, the bar at the pool is to remain open to 6, they were already packing up at 5:30 and again No to getting a drink, at $20 a drink you would think they would be amenable

title: Nice hotel, great view
desc: Lovely hotel, club room has high floors (request for room with city view - see my pictures), friendly hotel staff, comfy bed gives you a good sleep. You can find local food just opposite (Lau Pa Sat) or head to OUE downtown for restaurants . Westin Level32 serves seafood high tea set is really good. And end the day chilling at Westin Level33 for drinks and snacks.

title: Good hotel, good service; yet nothing memorable
desc: The Westin Singapore is a relatively new property located in the Singapore CBD that is hard to fault. The rooms are immaculate, and the service and staff standard consistent with the Westin brand. However, that is essentially what the property seems to be designed to be: predictable and - dare I say - boring. Which, for the business traveler, could be what is required to get the job done in the past, yet in a city like Singapore where hotel options are aplenty, and the lines between business and leisure travellers aren't as distinct as before, this hotel just doesn't seem well-equipped to cater to today's leisure travellers. There are factors that are hard to overlook purely for the reason that it is a 'business hotel'. For example, the cable channels available are far too

title: Perfect Staycation
desc: Staycations are for taking a break and resting, and that's certainly what I felt as I checked out of the Westin Singapore. The. Beds. Are. Simply. Amazing. I've never in my life felt a bed so comfy and so soft, up until a point where I didn't want to get out of bed. Felt like just lying there 24/7 and sinking into the soft sheets. But there was a huge bathroom and a tub for two to enjoy. Not to mention the 35th floor swimming pool which has a partial view of the sea (the rest of it is blocked by the newly-built Marina One office tower). Also, thank you Westin for the complementary upgrade and amenities offered given that I did a 1st wedding anniversary staycation! Won't forget this one night for a long long time to come.

title: Club Floor is a MUST
desc: After 8 months, staying at the Westin again. In my previous review, I have gone through how great the rooms are and how wonderful the staffs are, therefore I will not repeat myself. They are just AWESOME. This review, I would like to say how much the quality of the club lounge has improved. The staffs are always very attentive, and always pro-actively asking if you need anything. Food has also gotten a major upgrade. As I am typing this review at the airport, I am still reminiscing the mussels in cream sauce that was served this evening. Westin will be my go to hotel in Singapore and I have already made another booking for my upcoming trip in 2 weeks time. Can't wait to see familiar faces at the Westin again.

title: Disappointing
desc: Generally this hotel is one of my favourite Westin hotels in the world. Mainly this is because of the service. This trip was different. Room service has deteriorated and is not worth it. Food arrived cold and meal was missing items specifically requested. I asked for a large pot of coffee. Was told there is only one size of pot and if that was not enough then I should “feel free” to use the tea pot and instant coffee provided in the room to make more. There was a slimy green salad delivered which was not requested. Perhaps it belonged on another persons tray. The price-value is not there either. For a single half of a grilled tomato, the charge is $8. And instead comes the slimy salad. When I rang the service express to complain, was told there is no duty manager or general

title: Greta location to explore the city
desc: Wonderful few nights' stay in a suite with club lounge access. The club lounge is made by the staff (Patrick and colleagues), who look after you perfectly. Love the fact we were always addressed by name and they remembered what we drank. Breakfast there at the weekend can get a little hectic as there aren't that many tables, but there's champagne flowing those days so all can be forgiven! As others have said, the afternoon tea selection is the most limited I've ever come across at an SGP hotel, but given they might only have one or two guests in during this time, it's understandable. Well worth going for breakfast in the main restaurant - the Asian selection is wonderful, and there's something for everyone, from gluten-free options to a full English, through to ice-cream, if

title: Outstanding experience
desc: I travel, ALOT. The Westin in Singapore is an excellent hotel. The location is perfect whether traveling on business or pleasure. It is centrally located so you can get anywhere by taxi in less than 10 minutes. The food was outstanding, the views of the harbor were beautiful and my room was exceptionally clean. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: An all around "Champion" of Singapore Hotels
desc: I always like to define "perspective" so you can take a review with the right grain of salt. For perspective, I am an SPG platinum elite who travels extensively throughout SE Asia, usually staying in SPG hotels but often staying in other 4+ star properties. I travel for fun but like to get a little work done while I'm abroad. Some hotels are flashy. Some are exotic. Some have special gimmicks like casinos or rooftop bars. Some have prime locations. The Westin isn't going to blow your hair back with quirky interiors or street-level access to Singapore's hottest attractions. But it is absolutely the best place to stay if you want what I want in a top-tier hotel: Comfortable peace and respite from the bustling city around you, with pleasant amenities, good dining options,

title: Weekend Staycation!
desc: Stayed here for 2 nights. This hotel Located in the middle of the CBD Area and very close to MRT Station. 5 minutes walk to Lau Pa Sat. The view of Harbour and City are amazing ! No doubt the hotel is very new and all facilities and rooms are brand new. I arrived at 4pm from Kuala Lumpur, i was confused to find the Reception, Fortunately there was a concierge who was kind enough to assist me. The check in were swift and smooth. As usual, Heavenly Bed is the winner, room was spacious and very modern. Infinity Pool was amazing - We can see the Singapore Flyer & ArtScience Museum from the Infinity Pool. That's Cool!!!!!! I had a breakfast at Seasonal taste, the staff was friendly for the most part, it will be better if they can put their SMILE. I wish they can get more

title: Very nice hotel in the business district
desc: I stayed at this hotel for leisure even though it is attached to several office buildings. There are plenty of food options nearby (there's a big food court into he mall next door) and it's walking distance to Lau Pa Sat food centre. The rooms are quite spacious and the views are great. The pool is also quite high up and has a great view as well. The price is on the higher end because it is mainly a business hotel but on par with other hotels in the same price range.

title: Great stopover
desc: Second time staying in the Westin. Absolutely fabulous. Love the Heavenly Bed. Check in was fast, smooth and the receptionist is very welcoming. He gave us some recommendations for streetwear which was not found in the guide book. Sorry I forget his name but he is a tall gentleman . Would definitely return again and enjoy the hospitality.

title: Meeting the needs of the customers
desc: Although my flight landed a lot early than check in time, the hotel did recommend me to book the night before to guarantee a room ready but I refused and was willing to just leave my luggage. Once we arrived after a long flight, the room wasn’t ready but they let us use showers from spa services and the staff was super friendly and accommodating! The room was amazing and the bed was soft and comfortable!

title: Great facility with attentive service
desc: I checked out of this hotel this morning. I can’t wait to come back and stay again! The facilities and design were modern. It’s location in the downtown area makes it very convenient for work. But only a short walk away from MRT Downtown line makes it an easy destination for any activity. The staff couldn’t have been more attentive and helpful. The infinity pool was also nice and offered a great view from the 35th floor. Can’t wait for a return visit!

title: Beautiful hotel well located
desc: I stayed two nights at the Westin in Singapore, it is a new hotel in the large Asia Square development close to Marina Bay and within the extended downtown of Singapore. The room is beautiful, very nice bathroom, comfortable bed and very quiet, being on level 43. there is a large swimming pool generally not too busy, perfect for lapses and relaxing. The service is impeccable, as expected in Singapore. Recommended for people doing business in Singapore or staying for a few days.

title: Excellent hotel
desc: This hotel is part of the spg network only opened about 2-3 years.Can't fault it in any way.The staff were very helpful and considerate the rooms very spacious and always spotless.The restaurant caters European and asian food.

title: Great stay
desc: I had a great stay at the Westin. Quite close to Marina Bay and Lau Pa Sat, a big hawker center. Beautiful swimming pool, nice view, not crowded in the morning. Eunice was a helpful concierge and Raisa gave a splendid spa treatment.

title: 5 Star From the Bottom?
desc: Sadly. Such service (or rather, no service) Spent the evening in the midst of a dumpsite piled away with dirty dishes and lack of staff totally spoilt the entire dinning experience. Wasted over 30 mins waiting to pay my bill, worst still their waiter even had issues finding people to help.

title: Not a family friendly hotel.
desc: This is not a family friendly hotel. The air-conditioning was very dry, and terrible for my sinuses (I developed sinusitis following a cold whilst staying here). The rooms are large, but lack simple facilities found in other accommodations such as fridge, convection microwave, laundry basket, waste bins (These were unlined and very tiny, enough for receipts, and not much else). The room in which we were staying had one small (presumed) refrigerator filled with alcoholic beverages that could not be moved (it would trigger payment purchase if item moved for 15 seconds). It would have been much more useful to put some milk in the fridge! Similarly, there was no where to store food. There was no where to put dirty laundry, which we accumulated on the bathroom floor (3 young

title: Wonderful and Memorial stay
desc: Staff were very helpful and we very response when i emailed them. Room was very well furbish and the view is amazing. However, the location was slightly far from the MRT stations but i believe it will be more accessible with the opening of TEL.

title: Westin Singapore (Asia Square)
desc: Excellent environment & services experienced during my stay over the weekend. I could view the Marina Bay Cruise Centre from my room...and also the hotel infinity swimming pool. Great getaway weekend stay because the hotel is located in the Central Business District...where you will be far from the maddening crowd and yet convenient enough to travel via the MRT (metro) line to everywhere. Nearest station Downtown station (DTL-17) Downtown Line (Blue)

title: Great hotel!
desc: I was in Singapore for business meetings and then a few days of sightseeing. I chose the Westin Singapore because colleagues were staying there, but I’m happy I did as my stay was thoroughly enjoyable! The hotel is modern and new, so new that a couple of taxi drivers didn’t know where it was (tell them Asia Square and it’s no problem then). Rooms are large and nicely appointed with very comfortable beds and luxurious bathrooms. The views from the 32nd floor lobby, the guest rooms and the infinity pool on the 35th floor are stunning. The lobby bar is a great place to meet friends for drinks or relax and check email. Staff everywhere was very friendly and attentive. Hotel location is also great - in the heart of the financial district but close to the harbour for

title: very, very impressed
desc: Stayed here on business last week since my meetings were in the next tower block, only a minute door-to-door walk away. Check-in was smooth and very pleasant. The room definitely had a wow factor (see my pics). Previous reviewers have mentioned excellent things about their rooms and I totally agree. My room was on the 44th floor and the view was great. Buffet breakfast was really enjoyable. I will definitely stay here again when in the vicinity.

title: Well positioned
desc: A really comfortable hotel, very professional with easy walking access to key business centres. Rooms were extremely comfortable, all facilities and very spacious bathroom and cupboard space. Air conditioning could be set a few degrees lower but certainly comfortable. Breakfasts were excellent with lots of choice. A bit rigid on check out with regard to a few last minute changes and it is clear that front desk staff are not empowered to discuss changes, which is unusual given it caters for the global traveller. Access to various levels a touch confusing. Many restaurants and a few pubs in close proximity which is useful given the constant heat. All in all a positive stay.

title: A Westin Done Right
desc: As a frequent business traveler I appreciate SPG properties that lead the way in service and style...this is one of those properties. All of the amenities you are looking for, from a fantastic club lounge to an infinity pool and spa (heck, even 50% of Yoga sessions for when your meeting doesn't go as well as you'd hope). The difference maker here is the staff and the details. Club level is a must. Views on all sides have their pluses so no need to fret that. One thing I would personally avoid is the "buffet" style restaurant on the 32nd floor. It is so loud and "fishy smelling" we had to leave after a glass of water.

title: NO.PLATINUM RECOGNITION
desc: Must be Marriott takeover that's negatively impacting properties that used to be great. Thanks for the one inch diameter cookie and the small room for lifetime gold and now platinum..level. What's this mean...hmmm move to Hilton?

title: Hotel in Business District.
desc: If you happen to work around that area, or you work even more conveniently in Asia Square (a lot of people refer to the Citibank building because of the big CitiBank signboard on the top of the building), this is a hotel for you. If you like being in a quiet street at night, this is a place for you. People will be going home after work at about 5pm and many food outlets will stop selling after 4pm. You have to take the train to other areas to shop.

title: Great location, great staff
desc: The Westin is located within walking distance to the Marina Bay area. The hotel staff, who helped us, were very good. Rooms have a great view, very comfortable beds, and very roomy. Your view may be of the port, other skyscapers, buildings, or the bay. You have to go to the 9th or 10th floor for the lobby. There is a cafe on the ground floor. Easy to find taxis, for transportation. This hotel can be a bit expensive.

title: Great hotel in the CBD
desc: The Westin Singapore is one of my favourite hotel in Singapore. The infinity pool is amazing and when we went there it was quiet. The rooms are spacious and the view is pretty good (we had a CBD/port view). Cook and Brew bar has a splendid view over the port and the city! Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and I would recommend it to anyone who prefers a quiet hotel instead of the bustling touristic ones.

title: Good business property
desc: The Westin in Singapore is a good property. Although, it is a business hotel, the property is beautiful with spacious rooms. They have an infinity pool on one of the higher floors. The gymnasium also offers a good view.

title: Nice business hotel. Service level can be improved.
desc: I stayed at The Westin for business. The hotel is very new, nice layout. However, the service level varied. I came across 2 different front desk representatives, the first lady was nice and attentive to help me store the luggage while wiating for check in. the second gentleman whom i came across was not so much when he demanded that i give him my passport for another round of check in even though my luggage had already been sent up to my room with my passport inside. The rooms are clean and new, but i did find a long blonde hair in my towel, i am Chinese so it didn't come from me. I am not sure if they never washed their towels properly or what. Also the hotel has a lot of unreasonable charges, such as pre-booking taxi the night before. i did this at other hotels but i was

title: Honeymoon stop
desc: We stayed during National Day (It was a bit quieter, which we liked). The Property was beautiful and was in a central location. We stayed here as part of our honey moon trip and the staff were great. They welcomed us with some chocolate covered strawberries.

title: Fantastic hotel
desc: Lovely room, friendly staff and great location. Particularly liked the Exec Lounge. Pool water was little chilly to lie in which I liked as not crowded and plenty space to get few laps in. Would highly recommend.

title: Great place for short business trip through Singapore
desc: A quick ride of 15 minutes when you arrive on the early flight from Europe (Zuerich). SPG allows us the 24-hour scheme, so early check-in and early check-out after 2 days is no problem. Check in was so quick, really nice. Very friendly staff who are also well trained and can easily help you with directions and how to find addresses in Singapore. MRT Subway is just close by, as well as the new banking center of Singapore with all the main offices. Lau Passat market for best street food is just minutes away, as is the Anderson bridge and Singapore River trendy area. Highly recommend this hotel. Great rooms, food and a wonderful team who make it all happen.

title: Well located hotel with great service
desc: We stayed at the Westin for a couple of days for our trip to Singapore. The hotel is located in a business district within walking distance to Raffles Place and Lau Pa Sat, one of the best Hawker centers in Singapore. We got a nice spacious room on the top floors with a stunning view over the city including a bathtub in which you can enjoy that view while soaking. The Room contains lots of amenities with a Nespresso coffee maker an TWG tea amongst them. The staff throughout the hotel was very friendly, especially to mention the exceptional housekeeping staff and the ladies and gentlemen in the club lounge. I also recommend booking a club level room. The service and the food in the lounge are great which included also long drinks and proper buffets for dinner. The Westin

title: Great property; amazing stay
desc: I stayed here twice towards the very end of September and into early Oct – and both times had an amazingly wonderful stay made all the more possible by the staff at this hotel. Amir at front desk and Tharani at the Club Lounge. Efficient & professional they both seemed to take pride in their jobs and service with a smile was consistent in my interactions with them during my stay. The property location is convenient to the Downtown MRT line as well as walking distance to plenty of restaurants – and the views from this hotel are just spectacular. Rooms are clean; calming décor and functional. Only thing I wish they had was more USB charging ports near the desk in the room. Thanks again to both Amir and Tharani for making my stay warm & relaxing – especially during a rather hectic

title: Great location. Nice property.
desc: We stayed at the Westin for a week. Rooms - Nice rooms. Spacious. Nice bathroom. Shower and bathtub with views. Comfy Westin beds. Location - It is in a great location. Close to MRT, Chinatown, Marina Bay, etc. Property - Nice property. Relatively new. Nice décor and public spaces. Restaurants - Visited Cook and Brew and lobby bar. Both are nice with good service. Club lounge - Great club lounge with full breakfast in the mornings and evening cocktail hour. The breakfast selection is great with buffet and cooked to order eggs. Cocktail reception food is enough that you could call it dinner if you wanted. Service - The majority of the staff was amazing. Great service from concierge, restaurants, front desk, and most of the club lounge staff. Room for improvement - Only two

title: SPG Platinum, NOT WORTH IT
desc: 1st time i experienced as a SPG Platinum Level on my 5th year with ambasaddor status, i never feel more like im a regular and not worth of my peny at all. i would rather stay at four points, more like bed n bfast hotel type. worth every penny. starting from the arrival at the ground floor to the check in, to the smallest room i ever stay and all the staff nor friendly yet helpful. you can tell the sincerity of the staff and the ambiance is very BLAH.. asking abt room upgrade, replied not in the welcoming manner, anyway i gave 2/5 for this. maybe im too demanding for an spg platinum, but at this level and this type of hotel, what you expect must be beyond your imagination on TV that they sell. summary, i disappointed and would never back again in here.

title: Oasis in the commercial district
desc: After staying a number of times in different hotels in Singapore, we settled on the Westin as our preferred. The hotel is sufficiently removed from the tourist overload of Orchard Road and the bustle of the colonial district. Easy access to MRT and leisurely walks thru Gardens by the bay and the Marina area to the Fullerton. The pool on the 35th floor is just stunning, and the gym/spa on the same level is very good also. Service was understated, but very good. Particular thanks to concierge Tiffany for some great restaurant and bar suggestions.

title: An extremely pleasant stay
desc: Having visited this hotel back in 2016 I was slightly disappointed at the time. We decided to stay here again while attending the Singapore F1 night race. It is conveniently located for the F1 and as we now know our way around a little better we visited quite a few other attractions in the area; mainly walking. Our room on the 37th floor was excellent, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We enjoyed relaxing by the pool much more than previously before attending the afternoon/evening sessions at the race. Hope to come back before too long.

title: Business perfection
desc: Just came back from nearly a week of business trip. My first time at Westin. Location is perfect for walking distance to MBFC, Robinson Road and most business areas. Good nighttime choices are also nearby. Was given lovely and large room on top floor, everything in perfect order, well appointed, spotless. Everything you need as a business traveler is there. Polite and efficient service, great breakfast buffet. No complaints at all. Major shout out to the fantastic business center. They are as professional, trained and experienced as senior administrative staff in the best Wall Street firms. Very helpful and proactive. Only suggestion i would be to change the routine of the bellboys at taxi stand. They extend their hand for a handshake. Odd and unwelcome.

title: Must Read for SPG Platinum Premier Elite
desc: If you are a SPG Platinum Premier Elite member and are expecting that this property will offer the benefits promised by SPG, like 24 hours check-in, then you will be sadly let down. The staff at the reception will flatly refuse any SPG benefits and will relegate you to a stranger putting aside any SPG Platinum Premier Elite benefits that their program offers. This is not a reflection on the SPG program, but this specific property. The staff is curt, dispassionate and totally inconsiderate. While charging premium rates their only objective is to perform the role of cash/credit card payment collectors while having no desire to serve. I would hesitate recommending this property to a business traveler, especially SPG Platinum Premier Elite members. Avoid this property. The staff

title: Super convenient location
desc: My second visit to the Westin and I specially like it due to its proximity to the CBD, Banking area and Lau Passat market, where you get all that yummy Singaporean and SE Asian food. Close enough to Raffles Place MRT Station, too, so you can take the MRT-Subway direct to the Orchard Road area without changing trains... even all the way to the Airport... super convenient. As SPG member, early check-in was possible with their 24 hour deal, as I also checked out at the crack of dawn. Overall a great and modern hotel, offering all the creature comforts you need.

title: Nice, but no trophy
desc: On first visit, The Westin ticks the boxes but for fairly new hotel, lacks finesse. Firstly, and this is just a personal dislike, the lobby is on the 32nd floor, you have to change lifts to get to your room, just annoying. This perhaps wouldn’t be so bad but the lifts here are incredibly slow at mornings and late afternoon. I also found the rooms very. Okay and had trouble sleeping, even though the beds are lovely, I could hear everything that happened on my floor and several times I swear I heard my door open but obviously it was next door, very noisy. The room itself is nice, but in need of maintenance, the light in the robe stayed on, even when fully closed showing this sliver of light all night long and in a noisy room, just didn’t sleep well at all. I loved the outlook from

title: Beautiful Hotel
desc: Stayed here on business for 10 days and couldn't have asked for a better experience. The hotel is very clean and rooms are fantastic. I also had the opportunity to bring my wife on her first international trip and they treated her to anything she needed while I was working. Close to everything in the Marina. Thank you again for the amazing experience.

title: A tidy hotel with smiles
desc: Westin Singapore did a great job. The room is very tidy and the location is downtown and we can walk to many tourist destinations. MRT is just right across the street. The concierge and housekeeping team are always happy to assist you. They have all the basic facilities and the pool is fantastic. Highlight: the mattress is very comfortable. I would definitely recommend my friends to come here when they travel to Singapore.

title: Staycation
desc: A very good staycation we had over the weekend. The hotel is new and rooms are nice and comfortable, though as some pointed out there is a noise problem when the housekeeping goes around in the morning to clean up the other rooms, you can basically hear them from the room as they go about their business along the corridors. But not too big a disturbance. Breakfast is fantastic and the gym, swimming pool and spa facilities (whirl pool and steam room) are great. Location is a minus, as it is not near to shopping districts, but it is easy to get around with a nearby MRT station. The only complaint I have is the long check-in and check-out queues. Really should automate or streamline the process rather than have guest waiting for ages. But I note that many hotels still have this

title: Modern and tidy rooms
desc: Modern design, good location. Room was clean. Nice pool and staff friendly. Rich breakfast buffet. Shopping areas and food court are nearby. Try how far you can get by underground walkway. Helps if it is too wet or hot.

title: Very poor service
desc: I live in Singapore and my son and I took a client to Cook & Brew for dessert and coffee after we had lunch elsewhere on 2 October 2018. We were there from about 02:00 to 02.45 with the client. There were only a few customers. Service was average at best and the desert selection and quality not so good. I eat a lot of sugar but the desert was so extremely sweet that I could not finish it. After we finished my client left and we waited for another person to join us. While we waited nobody came to ask us if we wanted something else. We had to flag somebody down for a menu and got some beer (according to the new tab we opened it was 15:02 by this time and the other person arrived shortly after this. We stayed to 17:06).. When the person we were meeting arrived, we asked if

title: Great Hotel Complete with an Amazing Rooftop Infinity Pool
desc: One of the best Westin's I had ever stayed at, and I have stayed at a bunch of them around the world since I have been traveling so much for work the last 4-5 years. The quality of Westin's really vary country to country, with the US being worst, generally. This Westin's rooms were impeccably clean and nice. The hotel offered to upgrade me to a suite on my second day and I did not bother taking it because my room was nice enough already. That was the first time I had ever declined a room upgrade...just saying. The views from this hotel are amazing. The infinity pool was beautiful. The Starwood lounge was also on the same floor as the pool and had great views as well. There's also a spa that you're allowed to use for free, even if you're not getting a massage. Finally, the

title: Maiden stay @ Westin Singapore
desc: Being a Marriott Rewards member, I decided to hv my staycation @Westin SG and thus made the reservation via Marriott app. The check-in was a breeze which would be made better if I could experience the keyless check-in using my mobile app. Am thankful to the GSA/GSE (Im sorry that I forgotten to ask for ur name) whom assisted in my check-in whereby I was allocated to a room with breathtaking scenery esp at night fr 40th storey facing MBS. Overall it was truly a gd experience for me. No complaints...

title: Excellent service by Seasonal Taste
desc: My husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary on 27 October 2018 at the Seasonal Taste. We enjoyed the varieties of food and the service by Nui Paphatchon. She’s attentive and meticulous. Keep up the good job!

title: Truly excellent in every detail
desc: The staff was truly professional, well trained and authentically helpful, nice and welcoming. The room was large, bright and gave a straight feeling of cleanliness, high quality and urban class. Most important, sleep was deep as the room was very quiet. Room service, breakfast buffet, and the quick dishes in the lobby bar were all delicious. Like the gym, which is not very big, but has all basic equipment for a good work out while enjoying a fantastic view over the port and into the ocean. Interesting little swimming pool outside on the terrace on the 35th floor. good for a rapid break. If you have business meetings in the area this is the place to go. Liked also the proximity to a nice jog into the Gardens by the way and around MBS. Overall: fantastic experience.

title: Great hotel in business area
desc: Very nice room, lovely restroom and shower facilities, great bed with great views, fine internet and good ammenities! Best of all, within walking distance of Marina, for leisure, and from office buildings, for work. Outstanding lounge for breakfast, for guests who have access, with "finetastic" service.

title: Rooms with room to move!
desc: Beautifully appointed rooms, huge bathroom, really comfortable bed, and magical reception 32 floors up. Friendly staff even manged to get us checked in a few hours early, which, after an overnight flight, was very appreciated.

title: Almost Perfect Stay at a Great Hotel
desc: Had to stop by Singapore for work and was able to book 2 nights at this hotel at fairly reasonable rate. The hotel is located in the Marina Bay area of Singapore where many companies have their offices so it was fairly easy for me to get where my meetings were. From the moment I got out of the taxi, I kind of knew this was going to be a fairly pleasant stay. The doorman and the front desk staff were all very courteous and pleasant, and the checkin was very smooth and efficient--something anyone checking into a hotel after a long international flight and late arrival would appreciate. The room itself, including the bathroom, appeared fairly updated and clean. And like Westin everywhere, I believe the room was furnished with the Heavenly mattress, which was comfortable and easy

title: Opulent property in the heart of financial district
desc: As an SPG elite platinum member, I was upgraded to a corner room. All the rooms seem pretty nice but this one was more spacious. I was a bit annoyed that they couldn’t upgrade me to a suite but it’s a very busy hotel due to location. The rooftop pool has a great view. The executive lounge is quite nice and comfortable for working. The breakfast spread at the restaurant rivals other properties in the city. Gym was well appointed. All in all, it’s one of the best Westin (non-resorts) That I’ve been to.

title: Excellent Hotel in Financial District
desc: We spent 2 nights here at this beautiful hotel. Our flight arrived at 8 am, so we actually booked the night before, so we wouldn’t have to take the chance of not having a room when we got to Singapore. The hotel is located in the financial district, so you avoid all the chaos of the tourists around the convention center. Other major points of interest in Singapore and the shops in Orchard Road are easily accessed by the MTR, which stops half a block away. There is a Pure Yoga studio in the adjacent office building, which has a variety of classes and offers a discount to Westin guests. There is also a food court with a Starbucks and almost every kind of fast food you might be looking above a plaza just a few steps out of the hotel. The plaza is a pleasant place to people watch

title: Perfect!
desc: Excellent and polite staff! All get 5 stars: room, reception area, lobby bar, fitness room, pool. Located very close to light rail station "Downtown," exit E. Taxis are readily available and inexpensive. Food court, coffee shops, 7-11 are all within a short walk. Very clean and excellent rooms. The bathroom is A+++ with bathtub, walk in shower, separate toilet, make up mirror, tile everything. Luxurious!Well stocked with regular amenities (soap, shampoo, lotion, etc). There was even a motorized shade. Would definitely recommend & will return.

title: One of my best hotel experiences ever
desc: I have stayed in hundreds of hotels for business throughout my career but this is the most memorable one. Large room with an amazing view across the harbor. One of the largest bathrooms I have had in a hotel (with that same amazing view from the bath tub!). Modern amenities. Service is amazing - starts at breakfast and continues till late at night at the bar. The bar by the way is what a bar should be: a stylish yet fun place with fab cocktails and beers and again this great service and view! I can't think of a better place to stay in Singapore, or maybe even in the best part of the world. Don't even think about staying elsewhere in Singapore.

title: Quiet getaway in Singapore
desc: Weekend staycation. Check-in was quick with a welcome drink. Was upgraded to a corner room with views of both the sea as well as the flyer. Room was clean, spacious and the bed was really comfortable. Lounge is decent. High tea was limited to 2 or 3 dishes. However, one could have a proper meal during evening cocktails as food selection and quality were pretty decent. Alcohol was a downer though as they did not have a specialty cocktail menu. Locations not the best with nothing much around on a weekend. Near the metro and in the middle of the CBD though. Would recommend for a quiet weekend or a business trip.

title: Excellent Westin
desc: There for 5 days on business. Rooms are large, clean, well-appointed and most importantly quiet. Nespresso machine provided. There is an SPG lounge with good coffee and a very comprehensive breakfast including a chef making eggs/omelette etc. Opens at 7 which I think is late. Good small gym (lacks a rowing machine) and a very good outdoor pool which is ideal for swimming lengths. WiFi good and reasonably fast. Staff are friendly and professional. Did not use the bar but it looked pretty nice. Can walk to Marina Bay Sands resort etc in about 10-15 mins. Very close to metro station. Overall one of the best Westin experiences.

title: Comfortable and Cosy
desc: Stayed here for two nights after our wedding celebrations. Hotel kindly upgraded us knowing we are celebrating our new chapter together. Staff were professional, room was clean and spacious. Hotel can be easily accessed by two MRT stations. Had a great stay.

title: EXCELLENT HOTEL , EXCELLENT SERVICE .
desc: I have stayed four nights for my biz trip last week, room is excellent and super clean, good location, near to train station. Check-in lobby is at level 32 with great sea and port view . Quiet hotel unlike other hotels around Marina Bay area or at Orchard road which is crowded and noisy. Reception and housekeeping are friendly, helpful and smiling , especially a male staff (Name tag David Chan) always smiling and greet every one entering and leaving at the hotel main entrance located at level one. It really makes you feel welcome the moment you step into the hotel. Excellent hotel , Excellent service !

title: Fantastic stay at the Westin
desc: Stayed at the The Westin for my wife’s birthday along with my kid. Was upgraded to the harbour view suite, perhaps due to my SPG member level. The view was great, able to see Sentosa. Service was amazing, a call from the concierge to Ensure everything was fine after checking into the room. The room and amenities looked new and clean. I felt safe for my boy to run around, even on the floor. However, on the meals. I like to feedback perhaps the hotel could offer more variety of food for the lounge. Also, I understand the policy for kids under 12 is not allowed into the club lounge. I do hope the management can review this so the kids can join their parents into club lounge. If not very likely both the parents won’t be able to really enjoy the club lounge, which we did not have

title: Clean, efficient, and friendly—one of my best Westin experience
desc: I spent four nights at the Singapore Westin in Nov 18. This is easily one of the best Westin properties that I have ever experienced. They put me in a corner room with both city and bay view. The room has pretty much everything a well-appointed hotel room should have. The gym seems a bit small given the size of the hotel. I would not mind a more extensive collection of gym equipment. The location of the hotel is great with easy access to subway. No complaint in that department. The breakfast served at the executive lounge was decent. I had very limited interaction with the staff. But all those I met were polite and helpful. This is very much one of the best Westin properties that I have stayed with. Highly recommend.

title: Luxury room, great room service, gorgeous spa !
desc: My room was luxurious and spacious as was the bathroom. The in room dining was a very high standard and great for gluten free. The breakfast buffet was amazing, I tried something new everyday. The spa is gorgeous, treatments were great quality and the room after your treatments has a brilliant view!

title: Great stay
desc: We stayed in the Junior Suite and enjoyed the stay. Overall, all was good and we especially loved the heavenly beds! Our other favourite was the Club lounge - good spread of food and drinks. The pre-dinner spread were so good, we could have had it for dinner. Too bad, we were having the buffet dinner at Seasonal Taste. Good job to the Westin team. All staff we met were great!

title: Just an overnight stop
desc: Lovely professional hotel as you would expect. We arrived late on Friday and foyer cafe was closed as was most of Food Court next door. Room was spacious and clean with a beautiful bathroom. Situated in the business sector of town so a bit out of the way of restaurants and shops but close to buses and MRT.

title: excellent hotel ...loved it
desc: nice modern hotel with every facility and a lounge for preferred customers...Very nice large rooms and bathrooms...ceiling to floor glass windows....the best bed linin ever... The breakfast was amazing with countless choices...excellent service...the only minus point was its location...slightly out of the city centre...but would not hesitate to stay there again.

title: A Destination Where The Service Never Ends...
desc: I recently had the opportunity to stay at this hotel, my first time in Singapore and for sure my first time at the hotel. One word describes the total experience - FABULOUS!! The hotel is five-star - its location, its ambiance, its dining options, and foremost its service. At the outset, we met with the concierge Eunice who planned our entire visit and provided much background information on visiting Singapore. Even though we did not have the occasion to see Eunice again, all the other concierges were most helpful (like taking you by the hand to find subway, etc). And, then there was Eunice in the spa. She provided an excellent massage on short notice which included a not-to-be-forgotten foot massage. And, now to address the hotel. The room was spacious (if possible, try to

title: Saturday Brunch
desc: Six of us had Saturday Brunch at the Westin recently and we all thought that it was extremely enjoyable and very good value for money. Brunch here is a time limited, all you can eat buffet of delicious hot and cold dishes of a very high standard in very relaxed surroundings and with very good level of service..

title: Great room and facilities for wedding
desc: My husband and I got married at the Westin Singapore and had a great experience! The bridal suite was great and spacious considering Singapore pricing/standards, and the ballroom and other facilities for the wedding were great. Agnes Chong was the event manager liaising for our event, and she was extremely responsive and attentive to our needs. I cannot speak more highly of my experience with the Westin and its staff.

title: My new go-to hotel in Singapore
desc: The rooms are big, new and fresh. Housekeeping did a great job the whole 8 nights that we were there. Being Platinum, we chose the breakfast amenity at the restaurant. The choices were changed daily which is unusual as in most other hotels, you get the same food everyday. Chef Yeo was fabulous. He made some special meals for me. He even helped out his staff when needed. Great guy. The Platinum lounge was great. Really a varied choice for the evening hors d'oeuvre including huge prawns. One does not need dinner after a visit to the lounge. The only setback is that the lounge is small. One is less than 5 minutes walk to the closest MRT.

title: Nice hotel but for tourism a bit off
desc: The rooms were nice , being platinum with them , upgraded to the top floor of the executive floor , nice view outside, bit this hotel is off the track if u are a tourist would not recommend The executive lounge is adequate Service was good but did not make my visits feel special at all Breakfast at the executive lounge and downstairs adequate but nothing special On the weekend since it is financial district pretty much dead and no one around

title: Dexperience Undercover Service Quality Surveyor Ratings Review
desc: Category: International Cuisine Name: Westin Singapore Dexperience Undercover Service Quality Surveyor Ratings: Value 3/5 Quality 3/5 Ambience 3/5 Service 3/5 Experience 3/5 Verdict: Food taste is fine, but service standards need lots of improvement. Enter Dexperience List: Failed! Special compliments with gratitude to Mr Lance Ourednik for taking good care of us during our visit.

title: Great Service
desc: I attended a conference at the Westin and managed to leave my laptop behind when I left for the airport. The staff responded immediately and Manager, David Tan brought it to me in a taxi so I didn't have to miss my flight. Can't express how grateful I am for that service! Really made a difference.

title: What is there not to like about Westin Singapore?
desc: he room is big and spacious, the hotel is surrounded by places to eat and the mrt is just minutes away. Only gripe that I have would be that the mattress is too soft for my liking but that is my personal preference. I would say it is an awesome hotel! =D

title: Gold Service really worth it.
desc: Perfect stay. Really enjoyed it. It is a pity there is construction work for a while going on. I have doubt paying for a sea view is really worth it. It is paying for looking at construction sites, so unfair to charge money for that. Service is perfect, people are friendly.

title: Great stay at the Westin Singapore
desc: Stayed here for a short trip to Singapore and it was excellent. We were upgraded to a Club Room floor as Platinum members. The breakfast spread at Seasonal Tastes is fantastic with a great mix of Western and Eastern options. I wish the Club Lounge accepted children during some hours but it is understandable, we checked it out separately since one of use would stay with child. The location is very close to the Downtown MRT and walkable to the Marina attractions. We used the pool on many occasions which was nice. Overall I would stay again but there are many nice hotels in Singapore

title: Visible cost and service cutting
desc: When I arrived the hotel around 3pm, two ladies worked at the reception. It took more than fifteen minutes to check in the guests in front of me. No other staff was around there. I could not stop feeling lack of staff to support the guests. The lady attended me looked like did her minimum job and just passed me the key. Reaching the assigned floor, it took two minutes to get the room from the elevator hall after turning the corners four or five times. The location of the room was the deadened of the corridor but there is no room direction from the elevator hall. In other hotels like this league, the receptionist advises or escorts how to get a room if it is complex like this hotel. Going to the club lounge was easier but had to ask the spa reception about the direction. Once

title: Beautiful hotel with great amenities
desc: Our arrival was in the middle of the night. The hotel is maintained and luxurious. You enter on the main level which had a bakery/ deli. You go up to the 32nd floor to register. They have a beautiful club lounge and pool. The staff is overly attentive. The rooms are very clean and large and modern. The breakfast buffet it exceptional with so many fresh choices. We went to Cook & Brew one night late since not much else was open near the hotel. The food was mediocre and costly but met out needs for it being open when needed. The spa and workout room is typical to all Westin’s. It was a great stay

title: Nice Room Infinity Pool
desc: Beautiful Bed and rooms, lack of amenities ... nice view great locations .... and easy to go around in Singapore ... have a near by Food Hawker "lau pa sat" ... and also have a food garden beside the Buildingnin Asia Tower.

title: Fabulous club lounge food
desc: The highlight of my stay was the F&B at the Club Lounge. The evening menu was changed daily which includes an extravagant ice platter of lobster claws, crab claws, clams & prawns. Amongst a wide variety of hot dishes plus dessert. An extensive range of booze was also offered. As for the rooms & suites. I had the pleasure of staying in both the Premier Corner rooms with an L shape window panelling which came with a bath tub that had a panoramic view of the harbour. The Executive Suite was equally impressive & well balanced in terms of comfort & design. Both types had their respective strengths. A most enjoyable stay. Special thanks to Ms Erin Sang who coordinated my stays with the various room types with their respective views of the Singapore flyer, harbour & city

title: Spacious and cosy room
desc: Booked 3 rooms with family for Christmas stayvacation. I must say the big room size, comfortable bed, Cleanliness, bathtub and cosy atmosphere and service are living it’s Westin international brand ! The breakfast has a wide spread of international and Chinese, a fulfilling buffet breakfast. The only drawback is the room service, the quality of food is not good like fish N chips, Hor fun, nasi goreng. It is not worth paying at high price for such quality of room service. Nevertheless We enjoyed our room stay and spa facilities for this vacation.

title: Nice rooms but avoid Daily Treats and Lobby Lounge
desc: As per previous visits, the rooms are well maintained and still in gd condition. The hotel does attract a number of staycationer over the weekend due to its pool view and deservedly so. We dined in quite a few times as we had a rather packed schedule. Seasonal taste is all right - international buffet offering to a gd standard, the lobby lounge was quiet during our visit and the service staff seems a little downbeat / lethargic. The same can be said as we grabbed a light lunch at the Daily Treats - the gentlemen at the counters were downright unfriendly and uninterested - food were presented in a slipshod and unappetising manner. Their tone in service was just awful. Mgt should look into service standards! Its unbecoming for a 5 star hotel and such a pity.

title: Excellent Starwood/Marriott Option in Singapore
desc: I spent two nights in Singapore over Christmas while en-route to Vietnam. As an SPG/Marriott elite member this seemed to have the best location of any of their hotels, and it did not disappoint. The hotel is located on the top floors of the Asia Square Tower 2, so all rooms (and the lobby) have excellent views of either the harbor or the Singapore skyline. My room was massive, with very high ceilings, and a gigantic bathroom with floor-to-ceiling windows, large bathtub, oversize shower stall, and separate toilet cubicle. The buffet breakfast in the restaurant was typical of a high-end hotel in Asia: AMAZING. The hotel was adorned with tasteful Christmas decorations, and hotel staff were happy to oblige the requests from guests for photos in front of the massive Christmas tree

title: bad experience do Not stay
desc: we arrived at this hotel at 2:45pm. I was told the room is not ready. i asked how long i need to wait. the answer is "I don't know. I can't tell you the time. if I tell you it will be ready by 3:30pm and if it's not, then you will be more angry. so my answer has to be I don't know". I really can't understand the logic of this none professional answer. anyway, we went out for lunch and came back at 4:30pm, the room still not ready. after complained to the manager, they give me a room within 5 minutes. the manager told me the luggage will be send to my room soon. but after 30 min waiting in room , nonthing was delivered. i have a 3 years old boy, without my luggage I can do nothing for him. I went to lobby and found my bags were still there. nobody is sending them to anywhere.

title: Outstanding Executive Lounge
desc: The lounge is super luxurious and clean, and the staff are professional and friendly. Special credit goes to Daffeny who works in the evening shift at the lounge. She is always very helpful. People like her are what make Westin Singapore so enjoyable to stay and wanting to return. When I visit Singapore again, this hotel is where I will stay.

title: Club lounge
desc: We loved our stay at the Westin Singapore and especially the club lounge experience. We felt very pampered and very well taken care of by the staff. We had a wonderful room on floor 44 with lots of space, very modern and clean, and loved the large closet and large bathroom with separate soaking tub. The service and food in the lounge really impressed us the most.

title: Professional and Pleasant
desc: Impromptu stay decision Local guest Deluxe King City View Service 5/5- it was professional and I really like how the FD agents have warm smiles. They are easy to approach and they really get back to you to answer your queries. Room 5/5- for the lowest category room, the room is truly spacious, it has a tub and a separate shower and toilet and toiletries are sufficient. It was very clean and I love the bed sheets. Extremely comfortable linens. I like their free coffee in the room as its Roasted coffee and they provide the French press in the room too! Food - we didn't opt for breakfast however we had Seafood high tea at the Lobby lounge and in terms of service, it's all right nothing wow about it. In terms of their food, it's not that bad for the price and the platter for 1

title: VERY GOOD SERVICE !
desc: I stayed at The Westin last month(Jan) for my biz trip . When I arrived at the hotel in the late evening by taxi after a long flight from Sydney , I went up to level 32 for check- in I realised I left my cell phone inside the taxi. I quickly went down to level one driveway but taxi left with my phone at the back seat. Mr.David from the security was at the lobby during that time he immediately called my cellphone( +61) with his phone ,luckily the cabby managed to answer the call and made a U turn back to hotel and returned my phone. I felt very relieved and happy to get my phone back , and I truly appreciated Mr.David quick thinking and his help (IDD call on his phone) ,otherwise I really dont know what to do without my phone during my business trip. The Westin Singapore ,

title: Excellent Hotel for Business Trip
desc: A unique hotel with hotel lobby is at level 32, friendly hotel staff assisting check-in & check-out, provide guide to the lift as lift to hotel room is not the same lift coming from ground floor. Room is cool, huge especially the bathroom, I think same size or could be bigger than the bedroom. Mini bar is equip with digital tray, when u remove the item from the tray for more than 15 second, it will bill u 😅, if Jst wanna take a look remember to return to it original position within 15 second. Overall happy with the stay, too bad is very short stay for about 12 hours only.

title: Best hotel in singapore!
desc: Once again the Westin has outdone itself. Not only is the hotel amazing, the staff at cook and brew is the best! To Nathan and Caryn, thank you so much for always taking care of me on these long trips. Makes me feel like I'm at home. See you next time! Cant imagine staying anywhere else in Singapore. The hotel is amazing but the people make it all worth the trip!

title: Fabulous Hotel
desc: .In the heart of downtown Singapore within walking distance of major attractions especially the Ship on top of the hotel. I loved the people there and many underground shopping centers to explore. Expensive place but well worth the experience.

title: Fantastic!
desc: We decided to have a staycation here during Chinese New Year and the Westin was our last stop. This was our first stay at a Westin Hotel and we were thoroughly impressed. The location of the hotel is great for visitors. It's within walking distance of the Bayfront, MBS, Lau Pa Sat hawker centre etc. Trains and buses are just down the road. From arrival to departure all the staff were very helpful. Reception staff were very friendly and we were given an upgrade to a what I think was a Harbour View King Premier room and it was amazing! The bed was very comfy and the linen felt heavenly, which by the way you can buy any of their bed linen, pillows, towels, robes etc from the Westin Store online and you can actually buy the whole bed! The bathroom was stunning. Large

title: Lunch Buffet
desc: Good spread of international buffet. I like the best is their chilli crabs but you must prepared to get messy. Quite disappointed with the dessert as none of them has enticed me for 2nd serving. Price quite reasonable and atmosphere is quite nice especially with the window seat.

title: Fantastic place for a quiet weekend staycation!
desc: Were celebrating our Anniversary here and I have to give a big THANK YOU to the Westin-Team (although I have to say that the GM didn't even great us when entering the elevator...so much to leading by example) anyway other than this I am glad that the rest of the Team (Housekeeping, Pool personal, Breakfast Team and Bar Staff, Concierge and Check in) did not follow the same attitude and did an outstanding job of keeping us happy and satisfied!!

title: Great hotel in the financial district
desc: The Westin is very well located on downtown Singapore and its financial district, only walking distance to many office buildings and also China town. Those who don’t mind running in the tropic humidity can easily make it to Marina Bay. The hotel is brand new with nice rooms, achtest pool and perfect service.

title: Smart City Hotel
desc: My wife and I started our South East Asia holiday with 2 nights in Singapore. I chose the Westin as I am Premier Elite with Marriot/SPG so I could gain some nice benefits from the hotel including lounge access with complimentary breakfast, room upgrade, free cocktail hour. I've stayed in a number of Westin's and rate their quality and service. The Westin singapore is in the financial district very close to chinatown. With the easy to use underground nearby, everywhere is easily accessible. The Hotel has its reception on the 32nd floor, which is a bit odd, but the quality of the service and room was as good as I expected. All in all a very good hotel for a trip to Singapore.

title: Lovely everything, but you pay for it
desc: Came here for business. The location, service and quality of bedrooms, breakfast, fitness and swimming area is excellent al the way through, but it did cost more than £200 just to stay in the room per night without everything else. Close to the sea and dining areas, so if you have the money go there!

title: Great Hotel
desc: The Westin Hotel was the perfect choice for our Singapur Trip! The Hotel Staff is amazing! Started with a smooth checkin, very nice Room (4407), amazing view to the marina and very clean! Just the AC facing direct to the bed is not that nice. The Club Lounge Staff is awesome! Outstanding service and always working with an smile! Food and Drinks @ the Lounge are delicious! Everyday different specialties and good cocktails! For the Breakfast we joined the main Restaurant and not the Club. It was the right decission! You will find one of the best Breakfast Buffets i have ever seen! Live cooking stations and awesome stuff included😉 The Pool @ the 35th Floor is realy nice! After a long day in the City - perfect to relax! An sauna, whirlpool & steambath is also available. The

title: Recently spent a week here while in Singapore....nice place
desc: Recently spent a week here while on business. Overall a very nice property. Best thing was that ti was a walk to the office and the financial district. Not as over the top opulent as other hotels in Singapore, so it will remind you more of a high end hotel in the US. Staff is very friendly. The spa and the services were a bit underwhelming but OK. Would plan to stay there the next time I am in town

title: Wonderful Property
desc: This property is located in the Singapore financial district so its a little off the tourist beaten path but I was able to walk to the bay in 15 minutes and to the Sands Hotel in 25. The downtown metro line is a short 2 block away so you can get to most anywhere in Singapore quickly. The property itself is quite nice, the rooms are large and well maintained, the service was very good throughout the hotel. I had access to the Westin club and found it to be of good value, they had a full breakfast in the morning, soft drinks and cookies during the day and cold and warm snacks and alcohol in the evening

title: Good location and great service
desc: Weston Singapore has a great location for both business and leisure trips. It’s near Marina Bay Area, Merlion and there are good places to eat out near buy like boat quay. The staff is super courteous, would like to mention Darmen who even remembered my breakfast preferences and 3-4 months when I visited again. The lounge on the 35 floor has good views, with infinity pool on the same floor.

title: Can't wait to go back
desc: Fab hotel: Room - I stayed in a lead in room but this was lovely and spacious, the bathroom was particularly impressive with large bath and rainfall shower. All rooms are on high floors (starting level 32) Location - perfect to get around, right by the underground and walking distance to the marina Services - great gym and lovely pool area on 35th floor. My only criticism is the pool area was unattended - a welcome, someone to set up the sun lounger and the opportunity to have bought a drink would have been nice

title: Avoiding Platinum Privileges wherever they can
desc: So this is a pure business hotel - completely empty on weekends, and I even strolled up to a CSO on Saturday evening for a chat “no Sir, unless we have a wedding, weekends are always very quiet”.
