But of course, suite inventory is always zeroed out on the day - miraculous maintenance. I half had hopes that being ambassador would give me a shot at an upgrade as per T&C, but looks like Marriotts poor IT opened these hotels a way around it. Same for the lounge - while the spread is passable, the biggest motivation of the lounge staff seems to be removing all food exactly on time - not that anything had been refreshed in the last thirty minutes anyways. To top it off, I overheard the lounge manager trying to charge the lady at the neighboring table (who had checked out but was on a

title: Beautiful
desc: This is probably my 4th stay with Westin throughout the past 4 years... I like to go during my anniversary on a yearly basis. Over the years, things have changed and I must say that they have been positive. Let me go straight to the Club Lounge. Patrick, if I didn't remember wrongly, is a great addition to the team. Passionate and professional. They just introduced seafood on ice during the evening cocktail hours and it is mind blowing! Hot food and desserts could easily make it a meal. The other staff at lounge were equally prompt and friendly. At breakfast, I find that the availability of herbal soup noodles pretty interesting, and wide ranging fresh juices very appealing. I also got myself upgraded to an executive suite and this is most amazing... a bit too big

title: Lovely hotel
desc: This is a great well located hotel just 2 minutes from the Downtown MRT station. The rooms are large and luxourious with extremely comfortable beds. The staff are all very friendly and helpful and nothing is too much trouble. If you can afford it an execuive floor room gives access to the lounge with cocktails and great food in the evenings. Recommended.

title: It‘s a Westin. Westin with wow
desc: A typical luxury hotel. Still rather new. Why I mentioned rather new, bec many 5 stars hotel worldwide doesn’t earn the fifth or even sometimes the forth due to „a stoppable aging process“. As most of Westin properties I know, the location is excellent. The service is awesome- starting with the warming welcome upon check in (even to a teenager who happened to be in the bad mood) and even after the final check out - as we had a midnite flight home. Our room had both pool and city view. The pool is not huge but it’s an edgy one - overlooking the harbor icl MBS. If you are familiar with Westin, you know the standard of their beds and toilettries. But I still have to mention, that their bath tub is awesome. Just in the right size and place.

title: Great place to stay
desc: Stayed for a number of nights whilst in the region, had to split the stay as traveled elsewhere during the week but the hotel were great, they looked after my main luggage during this time. Both rooms I had were great and had views across the water, the number of boats / ships in this harbour has to be seen. The rooms were clean, spacious, comfortable and very well specified. WiFi was great too. The location is stunning, there are MRT stations a couple of minutes walk away and you can see the Mega trees at the bay from the hotel. This is somewhere you want to stay in a city where the standards are sky high.

title: Great hotel
desc: Located about 10 mins from MBS. I got a huge corner room with great views. It was well appointed with coffee machine and a good bathroom. Breakfast is good but expensive. Pool is great looking over the city. Service very good.

title: Wonderful food and drink
desc: Great food, lovely music, great drinks, lovely staff and excellent value. Wonderful location- will certainly eat here again. Spent a thoroughly marvellous evening at the Westin. Service could not have been more attentive and friendly.

title: Great hotel but there are things that need improvement
desc: My friends and I were planning a great birthday, but things didn't go according to plan. I booked with Hotels.com and long story short, I got charged more. I asked The Westin Team to help me with Hotels.com but didn't get too much assistance. That's fine - we were looking forward to giving my friend a great birthday so we dealt with paying +$400 extra and just looked forward to the trip. While the pool and views were stunning - ordering drinks seemed to take A LONG time. On one occasion, it seemed to take more than half an hour to get 5 Mojitos...? How is that possible when we were half of the patrons at the pool at that time? During 1 of 3 visits to their bars/restaurants, getting water during our buffet lunch seemed quite difficult. This made lunch a little harder to

title: Outstanding
desc: You can't go wrong with any West in...service and quality are the best! Hotel is centrally located for easy walking to most attractions. Underground malls are close for shopping which is good in the hot and humid season.

title: Beautiful hotel, beautiful view
desc: Got a corner room with a view of the bay. Only five years old and looks like new. Walking to Marina Bay for dinner tonight. Hotel starts on the 33rd floor and the breakfast on 35 was terrific. Hot and humid out there, take cool clothing.

title: Buffet Lunch
desc: Had a lunch buffet on a weekday. Being an Indian vegetarian, there's not much choice here. There's a DIY counter, where you can make a sandwich or burger of our choice, a pasta counter and Indian counter with naan, biryani rice, daal and mixed veg gravy. A good choice of healthy desserts. Overall, a few but healthy choice options and can survive upto few hours if consumed. A visit for a change of food, ambience and to celebrate an occasion. The reservation has to be made before going.

title: Great location in Singapore
desc: We had one of the best experiences during our Asia trip in this hotel. We were upgraded to a suite on a high floor. We really enjoyed the views and how comfortable the beds are. There was a small issue with the safe that got resolved quickly. The staff was very friendly and professional. Rosa Amor was specially helpful and informative. The main attractions in Singapore are walking distance from the hotel. We will for sure stay here again!

title: Luxurious and friendly
desc: Although in the Business District it is also on the edge of Chinatown and has views over the docks and water plus there is a Metro station a few minutes away and frequent supply of taxis so there is good accessibility to most tourist attractions. This was our second visit on a 3 night stop travelling as tourists (3 adults) from London to Australia. The attraction for us is the spacious, modern bedrooms and bathrooms, and large and comfortable informal lounge and bar area with views across the docks. The super friendly staff make it very enjoyable for tourists. We emailed a reply to Christabelle, Guest Services Supervisor, to warn of our early morning arrival so that one room booked for that night would be immediately available and she ensured that both our rooms were ready and

title: Excellent - could not fault this
desc: We stayed three nights at this hotel, 6, 7 and 8 April. Our room was lovely, although there was a small leak around the base of the bath. Rectified immediately. Breakfast variety was excellent and the service first class. The location of the hotel was good for the Marina area and many restaurants and bars. We experienced a small problem with the lock on our door and had to wait whilst an engineer fixed this. We were escorted to the pool bar, and given a complimentary soft drink (11am in the morning!) When we returned later in the day, we had a note of apology and some fruit in our room. Also, on check-out the charge for a wine I had the evening before was waived. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Excellent service and staff.

title: Exceptional Hotel, Exceptional Team
desc: My husband and I were warmly welcomed by the hotel and as Platinum Members we were lucky enough for there to have been an executive suite available when we arrived. The suite was on the 46th Floor, beautifully appointed in the Westin Creams, browns and greens and the heavenly bed was excellent as usual. The hotel is aesthetically beautiful, infinity pool overlooking the bay, gardens and facilities immaculately clean and common areas are beautiful. The club lounge is lovely, staff are excellent and very personable, great range of food and beverages, evening canapés for 2 hours and complimentary cocktails for 3 hours. The staff are truely world class, I can’t thank them enough for making our stay really wonderful, we can’t wait to come back ! Brad and Rob Bell

title: lovely hotel
desc: Stayed 2 nights at this beautiful hotel on route to Sydney. Hotel was perfect. Rooms were very spacious, beautiful beds, showers and great view. Service at the hotel was first class and we thoroghly enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Lovely swimming pool also available with good views. Location of the hotel is great, within walking distance to most attractions. Thank you for a great stay and this hotel will be definetely our hotel on our next visit to Singapore

title: Excellent Stay in Luxury Hotel
desc: Stay here for our honeymoon during our 2 nights visit in singapore. We arrived around 12 noon and the room was not ready as expected. They did let my spouse use the Spa as she needs to retouch. We went out to MBS with the MRT just around the corner. Not long after, they gave us a call and to our pleasure, we were given upgrade to Suite (thanks to Platinum member). The suite is very spacious and the pool is very good. We had breakfast in the club lounge with a very nice and private view. All staffs are very nice and courteous. Thank you Westin, will definitely return here again next time

title: One of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed at
desc: We chose something special to end our trip post cruise. We have stayed at alot of very nice hotels but this was one of the best. The Westin, is located in Asia Towers and the lobby is on the 32nd floor. We were lucky to stay in a Premier King room. It was huge with wonderful view to Sentosa Island, large bathroom, huge king comfy bed and a desk etc. The service at the Westin is fantastic and all staff as so friendly and helpful. Big shout out to Oliver who checked us in. He takes huge pride in his job. The Westin is right next door to a food court with heaps of options and if you walk about 200 mtrs you are at the food markets. You can walk to Marina Bay Sands area and the gardens. If we ever stay in Singapore again, the Westin is were we will stay again.

title: stay Apr.1-2, 2019
desc: A nice hotel with great service. Appreciate room upgrade during the busy season in Singapore. Suggest to offer point/cash rebate option for forgoing room service during the stay to go green. Looking forward to my next stay in the hotel on May 26-31!

title: Fantastic views from everywhere
desc: Stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip and found it to be very nice and convenient. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Downtown MRT station. The lobby is on the 32nd floor, along with the main restaurant, Views were undeniably fantastic from any vantage point. The pool was on the 35th floor, also with fantastic scenery. You have to use one set of elevators to get to the 32nd floor, and another set to access the rooms. My room was a corner unit on the 38th floor - very spacious, modern design with a bathtub overlooking the pool. The breakfast spread was also wonderful and had all the choices ranging from Asian to European. The only reason I wouldn't stay here is because there are no shops or convenience stores within close proximity. Otherwise, it is near enough

title: Immaculate sevice
desc: This is a wonderful hotel. The service is first class, nothing is too much. My room was beautiful, top floor over looking the bay. I wish more hotels would give you coffee, tea and water. It is a small cost but it makes such a difference. The club lounge is great, the food is absolutely delicious and caters well for vegetarians. A very well located hotel that I definitely stay at again.

title: Bad Customer Service from Marriott
desc: We had to cut our holiday short in Sri Lanka due to the bombings so I was looking for last minute accommodation as we had to stopover unexpectedly in Singapore. Westin Singapore had last minute availability however there was no direct contact number from Sri Lanka and no smart chat service so my only option was email. It took them almost 5 days to respond to my emergency request! Pretty poor service from a hotel group that is supposed to be service based. Thankfully a competitor group had much better customer service and we were able to book a last minute reservation during a very stressful time.

title: Great hotel in a fantastic location in Singapore.
desc: Stayed here for a couple of nights on business. This will be my go-to hotel for staying in this part of Singapore. Easy access from the airport. Check in (on 32nd floor) was quick and easy. Despite a mid-tower check in, nice atrium and open feel. Room was just spectacular. I was upgraded to a suite. One of those rooms you just don't want to leave. Very modern, crisp design. Electric blinds. Nespresso machine. Large bathroom area. Slept extremely well after a long flight. The gym is ok-ish. Adequate for a hotel of this size, but tv channels on the machines were mediocre. Make sure you bring your own headsets. Nice outdoor pool. Great location for going for a run. The club is fantastic - great breakfast and evening snacks and drinks.

title: I love the Westin
desc: This hotel is really beautiful, you can expect the same level of service and quality everytime. It was our second time in 2 months and they made it a pleasant stay. Rooms are gorgeous and spacious, stunning bathroom. Love the bar and G&T cocktails. Was just disappointed they couldn't accomodate me for high tea again, apparently they were fully booked but we left at 5pm and some people didn't pitch, leaving availability,just something for the hotel to look into. We unfortunately couldn't book online as we were commuting from China and the government blocked our Gmail and Facebook etc. Hotel across La Pau Sat night market, ate the chilli crab, prawns and some Indian dishes,quite convenient from hotel. Will definitely be back again!

title: One night staycation
desc: Had a one night staycation recently and really enjoyed the room. Room facilities are well designed and the room was spacious. Was assigned a room facing towards Chinatown. Tried out the workout gear rental at $6 nett. Probably one of my favourite feature of Westin hotels, coming in just after the heavenly beds! Didn't have a chance to join for breakfast, but had a tipple at Cook & Brew. They have a $10 nett promotion on Friday nights and there's also a live band performing, so it's a perfect location to grab a drink to unwind after a long week. Only negative to the stay was the weak shower pressure. The water also tended to run rather hot, so be careful during your showers.

title: Best Marriott Option in Singapore
desc: First of all, let me say that among the many Marriott properties that I've stayed in in Singapore, I do think that this is by far the best one and if not for its poorly-located location (specificically for me, as my offices are at the other end of Singapore), I will always choose to stay here. The staff is great, the rooms are extremely spacious with stunning views, the facilities are first-rate, and especially I think the Club Lounge is the best among the Marriott options in Singapore. What also amazes me is how well the hotel was maintained, as it's already six years old (I think) and yet the facilities do look as though they are new. One thing that I find funny is that the wait staff at the Club Lounge seems to share their uniforms, as the "Ashley Chang" in the morning was

title: Heaven in a business area
desc: I stayed in Westin for 11 nights with my husband and 4-year-old son. It was actually a business trip for my husband, and holiday trip for me and my son. The hotel interior is beautiful and grand, nothing to complain about, but the service of their staff had totally surprised me. Before my trip, I emailed the hotel's staff regarding their menu due to my son's food allergy. They put me through directly to the hotel's executive chef, Mr. Foster. He patiently tried to understand my son's allergy, what he likes to eat, what he's allergic to, how serious it is, etc. And he rest assured me that he would try his best to cater to his needs. I really appreciated it. Even after I reached the hotel, the staff at the front desk were extremely helpful, and also reminded me that they

title: Great start of our trip
desc: We checked in to this hotel around 1100 hrs. No problem with early check in. Room was upgraded to the 46th Floor (highest floor). Room size: Great, View from room: Great, Staff: Exceptional and always ready to help...will recommend it to everyone ..

title: Best hotel experience
desc: I really enjoyed everything about our stay here. The hotel is beautiful, the breakfast amazing and the service was outstanding. We had access to the club lounge where we had lovely food, wine and cocktails. The Downtown MRT was less than 5 minute walk. I would stay here again and again, thank you Westin.

title: Great value and comfort
desc: I was in town for a conference over 7 days. Not used to the heat and humidity of Singapore, I was so happy to be able to return to a very comfortable and spacious room each night. I definitely will return.

title: Business district.
desc: We spent 4 nights here and enjoyed the experience. We had a Club room which was good, had access to the Club Lounge every night, which had good food and drinks. Only thing missing was STEAMED RICE. They served wonderful curries, but no rice to soak up the sauce. The rooms are large, views of the city OK. Did get a loo with a view tho, which was great. Easy walk to Marina Bay and Raffles.

title: Glass walls everywhere!
desc: Although I have been to Singapore countless times, I had never stayed at the Westin before, mainly due to proximity to my office and client locations. As the financial district in Singapore has moved from Raffles towards Downtown, I gave this hotel, in the heart of Downtown a try. The rooms are very cool and spacious with glass walls everywhere (they even gave me an upgrade!). As the lobby of the hotel is on the 23rd floor, all rooms are on high floors with spectacular views. Even the showers and bathtub have views (yes you can put the blinds down if you are worried). Although it is a bit of a challenge to ge to the Quays, the Bay Sands is a lot easier to reach than from a hotel in Raffles. Point of caution is that there is construction going on in front of the hotel and

title: Seasonal Tastes
desc: Had dinner with my family tonight at Seasonal tastes. Wasnt expecting much from the restaurant as my last experience at one of the other restaurant left no lasting impression. Understand Hotel started operation since Nov 13, and there is still finetuning to be made. Seasonal taste was located, abeit on very obscure location. Not much publicity and awareness has been made to promote it. However, on visiting Seasonal Taste on the 32nd Flr, it has a wide view of the bay development. Started the buffet with the lobster (main part of the theme tonight - Seafood). Lobster - very fresh and sweet! What impresses me was the theme which the restaurant made - focusing on its main attraction lobster - it serves lobster porridge. With some creative, one can make oneself a delicious

title: Great room and lounge with a few improvements
desc: This is my second time staying at this hotel after 5 years. Utilised one of my suite night awards to get upgraded to an executive suite. Room was very nice, spacious, neat and comfortable. Heavenly bed was indeed heavenly. I can find no fault with the room and bed. Lounge access was complimentary due to my titanium status. Overall experience at the lounge was positive for the most part - spread was adequate and quality was good. We enjoyed our breakfast and cocktail time which comes with some nice food ( not just snacks and cakes ). Service at the lounge was prompt and friendly too. Gym and pool were also well maintained and beautiful. Okay so now comes the ‘not so good’ part. Checked in process and experience was weak. The staff seems pretty new ; apparently with another

title: Stunning views
desc: Fabulous and luxury Warmest welcome service you can see the ultimate Singapore bay from your room and sky pool you can walk to marina bay just 15 mins for enjoy the luxury shopping and eatting and take a photo with Merlion the landmark !!

title: Friendly Staff, Professional Team
desc: We stayed in the hotel for 3 weeks in June and we loved it there! The infinity pool is so amazing and we had dinner a couple times in cook & Brew restaurant Benjamin was super professional and nice in there. From the concierge Cora helped us a lot and she was so nice to us. At the executive lounge Beatrice was super friendly kind and professional. Thank you for everything.

title: Perfect stay at the Westin
desc: A note of appreciation for the staff of the Westin Singapore. Even before having my first stay at the Westin Singapore, I am already receiving the best of the services offered by the Westin. I am a member of their loyalty program, Marriott Bonvoy, and this was the first time I used their app to book my room. The app has a function to check-in and to send requests and room preferences. Replies via the app were very prompt which was impressive considering I am not the only one sending messages to them. Upon checked in, the very friendly front desk staff informed that all my requests have been taken note of and confirmed an upgrade for my room. The staff also enquired on my preferred newspaper to be delivered the next morning. You could still communicate with the staff by sending

title: Impersonal and poor service
desc: Poor service, impersonal. Took them over one hour to find someone that could solve a connection problem with my computer. Even had some workers who had no clue come to my room twice to supposedly fix the issue. After that l attempted to call the room service during over 15 minutes and got hang up on a few times. Asked for no white bread and got plenty of it. The answer to this was a basket of fruit...seriously ? At least one would expect your diner charge, which was minimal, to be dropped. Anyway if you go there, don’t expect much other than sleeping...just also be ready to keep pushing a button during over one minute to close your bathroom curtain...

title: Great Business Hotel
desc: We visited for three nights on a family vacation and the hotel is great in many ways but its more of a business hotel than a vacation spot. The Westin is deep in the heart of Singapore's financial district so not much going on there on the weekend, meaning that you need to take a taxi or an MRT to Orchard Road (or wherever) if you want to experience life in Singapore. That said, it IS possible to walk to Boat Quay, Clarke Quay and beyond of you are up for it. The evening drinks and canapes in the club are fantastic but it does get very crowded. Our corner room was spacious and very nice with a beautiful bathroom and tub looking out toward Indonesia. Unfortunately the feng shui was spoiled by an echoing marble hallway that led straight to the bed - they need a door here.

title: A hotel that uplifts their core value in its guests’ well-being.
desc: Booked a 3 days 2 nights staycation with The Westin Singapore. Was given an unexpected early check in and auto upgrade of room without asking for it. The counter staff Fiona Zhang who serves me exude a comfortable sincere vibe and was friendly. Would like to give a shout out to all the staff and team from various department for allowing my stay to be an incredible restful and rejuvenating one. Appreciate all of their services and effort, taking imitative and account even in the most smallest thoughtful way. View from the hotel room was amazing and hotel room was quiet, peaceful and calm. Love the heavenly bed and pillows, also the bathtub with a view. Ordered room services 3 times and I am impressed that the staff always greeted me in a polite and prompt manner. Felt very

title: Great rooms, and excellent service!!!! Thank you.
desc: I am writing this feedback to compliment your hotel staff for their excellent service. Special thanks to your team at front desk and also Cora’s team at Concierge for making it such a comfortable stay at your hotel. I stayed at the Westin Singapore for many nights during my two months business trip. I was attended with warmth and care. My need was catered with perfection, making me feel so important. Again, I want to compliment your entire staff for being so professional, friendly and helpful. They have been very impressive in their service. Thank you for remembering my name. I shall be back (soon)! :) GQ

title: Made for the client
desc: This hotel just makes me happy. I travel globally for business and this spot never disappoints. My rating is specifically in the context of solo business travel. My room as ready at 8am. They upgraded me to a corner room with a good view. The service from curbside to check-in is good without being overbearing. The amenities are what you need including a very good (I’d say four star) gym and lovely pool. Steps from my office. What makes me love this place though is the room layout. The room was clearly designed while contemplating the guest. There is tons of room in the bathroom and shower for unpacking your toiletries—something most hotels skip. They even have a nice little stool to sit on in the bathroom. You know how often I drag a chair in there!? The bathtub and rain shower

title: Beautiful Westin Hotel in a quiet location with a good view
desc: Visited this hotel for a night on a weekend. It is definitely one of the nicest Westin hotels i have stayed in Asia. The lobby is on the 6th floor and have a good view of the city. The associate were pretty friendly. I was given a good room but the view was slightly disappointing. Evening Cocktail at the club lounge was pretty decent and breakfast spread was pretty good as well. The only down side was the water of the swimming pool was too cold and i did not really get the chance to stay in the water for too long. All in all, it is definitely a hotel i will recommend to my friends if they will like a hotel just a stone's throw away from the famous Lau Pa Sat (their satay are so delicious) and a 10 minutes walk from Marina Bay Sands. It is also a hotel suitable for business

title: Feels of luxury, business in a convenient business and tourist location
desc: The incredible service starts at street level, Concierge will look after your bags on arrival at driveway and send you up to Hotel reception level 32. Incredible massive windows everywhere. Seating throughout is very comfortable not just to look at. We had club access which looked and felt luxurious, stylish and awesome food. Service across all departments was outstanding. Food in all areas except cook n brew also outstanding. We felt the flavors at cook n brew were bland for this level of hotel and my noodles chewy. Thanks to staff for our anniversary strawberries in chocolate surprise in room. A couple of small issues during our 3 night stay but were attended to very very quickly. Awesome service. Yes location is business but mrt is maybe a 5 minutes walk and another 5-10

title: good business hotel
desc: modern nice views running class a great idea great rooms but can be loud outside. some guy was passed out in the lobby when we were there at midnight, and the concierge was trying to tell their partner in the room opposite us about the issue, but they didnt speak english and it was around 1am, the discussion went on for ages, kept us up. doors slamming etc. great bathroom good staff, but they seemed under staffed often, waiting for a long time to order a drink at the bar, almost left. waiting a long time to get someone to order coffee, clear tables at breakfast. expensive, but thats singapore. lift system annoying, have to catch 2 lifts to get to room as lobby is on floor 32 I think if its not a business day, the surrounding area is completely dead. nothing happening

title: Wonderful place
desc: Expensive but really amazing, everything it was really good, near of everything, clean and luxury place, amazing pool, and the breakfast.... amazing, a lot of different choices and the best until now.

title: Unpleasant experience
desc: Booked 2 rooms to stay at The Westin on 10 - 11 August. Requested for early check in but were told that the hotel was running on full capacity and that the previous occupier of the rooms were elite members so their check out time was at 4pm (normal check out time is 12noon). The receptionist told us that we were assigned a room next to each other but we also informed the receptionist that we did not having any room as long as we could check in early or even at normal time, which is at 3pm. However, we were still had to wait. Luckily we were given access to the club lounge while waiting for our rooms. The lounge was comfortable and the staff there were friendly. By the time we were assigned one room, it was already close to 5pm. The second room was assigned to us around 6.30pm

title: Beautiful Oasis within the City
desc: Templating within the Marriott group, I decided to go ahead with Westin base on the pictures and boy was I not disappointed. I would only mention that there seems to be a lot of construction going on and the route makes it less desirable compare to other hotels. Very quaint and quiet area with not much offerings around the area! But I did like it because of the quietness from the hustle of the city! Convey my appreciation and thanks to Jamie who check me in. Gave me a beautiful room with a view that I could see the fireworks though it was slightly blocked. She also bother to mention other facilities which many always skip this process ! The occasion was for a birthday and it was weird that the hotel could not accommodate birthday candles? Does it really cost that much to

title: Wonder Staycation
desc: A good location, with easy access to o the subway and nearby Lau Pa Sat. The staff, from the valet parking, the front desk and the Seasonal Tastes were simply very professional. I would like to convey my thanks to the staff in the executive lounge, Tharani, Tiffany, Beatrice, Danna, Ashley and David who were very thoughtful and handled the busy weekend crowds very professionally.

title: Worst Staycation Ever
desc: We stayed here during a long public holiday weekend in Singapore to celebrate my husband’s birthday. I had booked a premier room on Level 40-42, but they gave us a deluxe room on Level 37 instead & told us the reason of giving us a lower floor for its a nice sea view (they added that there is no difference between a deluxe & premier room then why is there a price difference on the website?). They told me to send the email of the booking & kept us waiting for almost 2hours as we didn’t know if we should unpack & relax in our room or be prepared to move to another room. By the time they got back to us, they said it’s either a lower floor with sea view or higher floor with blocked view but we were too tired to dispute the matter further so we remained in our downgraded room but

title: 3day stay
desc: This is a beautiful hotel but was let down with visiting during a peak time. The hotel was fully booked and staff were unable to cope with the occupancy. The club lounge ended up as a mess when staff just disappeared apparently unable to cope with the busy period..food ran out as did drinks..fridges were empty.. When we attended for breakfast it took 20 minutes waiting in a queue waiting to be guided to a table. When we entered there would have been 20% of tables empty and set. We ordered coffee 4 times before it arrived cold. Some of the food was cold or plates empty. No glasses were available for juice, even when asked I had to wait 15 minutes before a glass was provided.. Just seems there was insufficient staff or the staff are nit trained as in other international hotels.

title: Luxury and comfort
desc: Stayed at the Westin last year during a business trip. I’ve travelled to SG many times for work but this is the first time I chose this hotel as it was closer to my company’s new office. Westin name never lets you down anywhere in the world and it proves here as well. Absolutely magnificent hotel with a beautiful lobby, great views of harbor and luxurious feel. Room and bathroom are spacious and the bathroom structure makes you chill at the end of a busy day. Bed and the overall feel in the room was great. Buffet food was great and staff were very helpful. Had a swim in the rooftop pool and it offers magnificent views. For business or pleasure this sure is a great choice

title: Fabulous 5 star Luxury Hotel, Very Comfortable and Excellent Service
desc: Hotel is located a short walking distance to the Marina bay, a great location to get access to most of the attractions. One of the reasons I choose this hotel. The hotel starts from level 25 to 46. My room was spacious with a great view and very comfortable. The bathroom was in a contemporary style and spacious too. The hotel provides a good size swimming pool and a fully equipped gym. The staff was very professional, polite and most helpful. I enjoyed my stay very much at the hotel and would highly recommend it as it made my stay in Singapore most memorable.

title: Very good Hotel
desc: Great Hotel. Nice bar. Good rooms. Staff friendly. Excellent business Hotel at good location. Breakfast buffet is great. Good views. Can recommend the Hotel for sure. I have been many times and service is consistently good. Check In sometimes a bit slow and cumbersome. To get a taxi in front of Hotel can sometimes be a challenge.

title: Excellent choice in business district
desc: Stayed here for four nights whilst formula one was on. This wasn’t intentional, due to an error on my part I mixed up dates and we ended up flying into Singapore the day before the F1 started. As such the Westin hadn’t been my first choice, but we are very pleased we did end up booking here. Given the expected intake of fans to the F1 we were somewhat apprehensive about crowds, noise etc in the hotel. This proved to be a total non issue. The hotel is in the financial district and close to the downtown and marina bay MRT stations making it easy to get to various places. I can understand some might find the location a bit offputting, but if you prefer to be away from the crowds at Marina Bay etc at night, then it is a great option. Ditto also if you are a business rather

title: Great Stay - Love the Pool
desc: I stayed here with my co-workers for 6 nights. This was my first time in Singapore and this hotel lived up to the hospitality I was expecting. Great location, it's less than 1/2 mile away from the Marina Bay area. You can easily walk to the Marina Bay for the laser show or to one of the many bars/restaurants. The lobby on the 32nd floor was very comfortable and lovely look at. The lobby bar was great for drinks after work. The infinity pool was amazing, just make sure you bring sun screen! There are plenty of cafes within walking distance for breakfast.

title: Looking New & Spacious, Small Things to Improve
desc: Rooms are spacious and well-maintained, looking new and sleek. The gym was a bit on the small side with few weights machines although they have a few treadmills. Some hallways had a weird pitch sound from the speakers. I was told that comes from the fire alarm system, but I couldn't hear that in the lobby or on the ground floor, so it seems sporadic to some parts of the hotel only. Otherwise, staff are very helpful and willing to make your stay a bit more exceptional.

title: Poor staff service
desc: I used to travel a lot, in SG,my First time stay this Weston hotel, as 5 star hotel we expected they provided great service. During the stay I used their SPA service, I encounter an accident as the locker room floor were slippery, I fell down got cut on my legs, which I was bleeding, no one in facility to offer helped. I walked out myself to the reception, asked the SPA front desk staff to get me first aid. First approached receptionist who called Sabarie , she has told me lesson ‘TO BE CAREFUL ‘ without any apology. And called The SECURITY David who came up with first aid, he David gave me the wound cleaning liquid and asked me to moved to the side as the liquid would have dropped on the floor (which the carpet ) was there. I told him I was in pain and not able to moved. Then

title: Authentic afternoon tea
desc: We had afternoon tea at the lobby lounge at 32th floor of the hotel. The food was awesome, scenery was fantastic. Seating was comfortable. Desert was good. Worth spending the afternoon here with family and friends

title: Fantastic
desc: We stayed for 7nights with a luxury escapes voucher. We loved everything about the hotel and it’s location was perfect. The pool was wonderful, room spacious with amazing views and the food was fantastic with many selections at breakfast. Special mention to Angie who was lovely and very helpful at front desk. We absolutely loved our stay in Singapore

title: OKAY STAY
desc: We did this on a Luxury Escape voucher and found IF we were business people, the location would have been ideal. You needed to taxi everywhere (which took a while from the downstairs concierge at times) or use your Big Bus (hop on Hop off tickets) to go elsewhere. Taxi drivers are good with English. The room and view was amazing but the front reception check-in desk needs to be given a rev up. No friendliness about them (especially after being in Vietnam & Cambodia for a month, these ones were appalling). Upon check-out no thank you for staying, hope to see you back again etc. etc. Very surprised at them. Need to work on their customer service! No Porter downstairs upon arriving in a taxi. Westin even though you are new, you definitely need to polish up your efficiency

title: Train wreck...
desc: Nonstop construction noise from outside Very quiet lobby, restaurant and bars 12 oz beers are replaced with smaller beers in minibar Getting worn out Traffic to get to hotel can be bad due to construction Ceiling of lobby is like 10 shades of white Too bad as rooms are big, staff is great and (not sure o the third!)

title: Great hotel and service
desc: A wonderfully comfortable hotel with everything you need on site. Rooms and bathrooms are very clean and comfortable. My only question was why they did not restock the mini bar or refreshment station in the evening. Free drinks and snack at the pool from 17-30 every evening

title: The Westin Singapore, a great hotel.
desc: We decided to stay at The Westin Singapore, and we made the right choice. The hotel is near the Downtown Station of the MRT. It is close to restaurants, bars, and coffee shops. It is quite on the weekend. The room was well appointed, with a fast internet.

title: Love the Lobby Bar
desc: Appreciate Patrick and Chris (Lobby lounge staff) warm hospitality. They made the extra mile service to tap out Guinness draugh when we like the stout creamy on the tap. Huge thank you to both of them for making our evening so pleasant.

title: 4 Night Visit
desc: Spent 4 nights at the Westin. Room very spacious and well appointed. Massive bathroom, great views. Excellent executive/members lounge serving drinks and food every evening. Staff very helpful and friendly.

title: Great stay and good location
desc: We had booked the club floor through Luxury Escapes and were very pleased with the hotel. It is in a relatively new reclaimed area in Singapore and though in the financial district did not seem overcrowded. The MRT - Downtown station - is a 3 minute walk away meaning you can get anywhere in Singapore easily. We had a large room with a marble bathroom as you'd expect in a Westin hotel - separate shower, free standing bath and shower. Automatic block out blinds were welcome as the sun seemed quite intense. The buffet breakfast was superb with more Asian than International dishes and a huge variety of food. The club (35th) floor Happy Hour between 1730 and 1930 was very well attended and you could easily see why. Wine, beer and some spirits were free flow and the range of food -

title: NICE & QUIET HOTEL , SERVICE EXCELLENT !
desc: I stayed at The Westin Singapore last week for biz and leisure trip, very nice quiet hotel at the CBD. The room very clean , big and modern , food center and train station nearby. All staffs very helpful and friendly , especially David from the security. He smile and approached me when the concierge was busy when I need assistant and some information. David was helpful and explained every details I need and gave me few options. He got me a taxi from valet and explained to driver the location . I am impressed he even help to unload the luggage from taxi when there's no bellman around while I am waiting for a cab. David show full of passion, energy , efficient and teamwork. Thank you Westin !

title: Break up Singapore stay
desc: Rooms very nice. Bathroom large and clean. Quiet and good AC. Lounge very good. (Busy!) Staff very friendly. Breakfast very good. Location good for the business district and the marina. Pool area great. Gym very nice.

title: Great location for a business trip
desc: The Westin is perfectly located for a business trip given its proximity to MBFC and the rest of the CBD. The rooms, service and facilities are all of a very high standard and I would definitely stay again

title: Great Stay
desc: The Westin is certainly a great Hotel. The rooms were large with great beds. The pool was a nice way to relax at the end of the day. The breakfast buffet catered to all needs and the club room was certainly worth it. Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Refined, Friendly, Top Notch
desc: I have stayed here a few times and every time I come back I am reminded why it is one my favorite hotels in the world. The rooms are not just "Westin" class but really take it up a notch. Floor to ceiling windows; powered curtains; spacious rooms and, if course, that "Westin" heavenly bed. What distinguishes the Westin Singapore, in my opinion, is the unique 32nd and up location in Asia Square; the understanded infinity pool on the 35th floor (No, this is NOT the Marina Bay Sands selfy pool - which is, of course, a lot of fun). I can particularly recommend the club floor lounge. While the team has changed over the years, they are always highly professional and friendly. One of the great hotels in my opinion.

title: Nice, efficient hotel
desc: I stayed for a few nights on business. If your office is close by then it is very convenient, however the area is not particularly interesting and very quiet at weekends. The rooms are very big. The service is very good. I ate the laksa (delicious) and brownies (also delicious but enough to feed 2 people) at the bar. The choice at breakfast is extensive. The highlight is the pool - the air seems less humid high up and it is quite large.

title: Software company 31 Oct and 1 Nov
desc: Jonathan tan , from banquet has been very supportive and helping Through out the event ,we had conference arranged. Very. Dedicative . Had been service oriental We had a 2 day meeting at meeting room 2. Excellent job by Westin. Meeting room and staff are friendly, polite and managing hygen always. And always on time

title: Quick Overnight
desc: Spent one evening in a standard room. Rooms are huge. Bathrooms are gigantic. And of course the hallmark Westin Heavenly Bed did not disappoint. The only complaint about the room was the automated mini bar and amenity system that charges items to room account if removed from their location for more than 15 seconds. Seemed a bit cheapish from a property of this caliber. Hotel is located in business district and as such caters mostly to corporate travelers. Fantastic lobby on the 34th floor overlooking the city. Stayed on the 44th floor and were greeted with a view of the water and cruise ship port. Our Convoy status granted access to the Westin Club Lounge. A beautifully comprehensive breakfast, tea/canapés until 4:30, open bar from 5:00 to 7:30, and heavy

title: Clean and fresh, business use only
desc: My partner and I stayed here for 6 nights. The rooms are large, new, modern and had a great view. The downtown MRT station is close by, but when you are travelling each day you will notice the hotel is quite far out of the way. Would stay again if the hotel was located more centrally. Definitely recommended for business travellers. My partner went down and had buffet breakfast one morning and it was around $55spg which I think is quite hefty.

title: Excellent
desc: I think this is an excellent hotel with first class efficiency, friendly-ness and service. The room was fantastic with a wonderful view of Singapore (and a bath in which to view it from). The breakfast was also fantastic. This is not a cheap hotel but the perfect business one.

title: Loud Construction Noises
desc: We stayed there for one quick night to attend a family wedding. The team of staff there are very friendly with great service. Room size was alright, bathroom a bit squishy (if we open the toilet room door we cannot pass through to get to the sink area without closing the door). The view was gorgeous though, we were allocated on a higher floor with a view of the waterfront. Location is ok. There’s the famous Lau Pa Sat within walking distance (about 5-10 minutes), but other than that you are surrounded by office buildings. There is a small 7-11 convenient store around the corner though. Downside was there are currently numerous ongoing government construction projects within the area, so during the weekdays you ARE going to hear non stop drilling noises even if you are on 38F.

title: Great for a business traveler, not great for a tourist
desc: I stayed here during a business trip and it was exceptionally convenient. There is a huge food court within Asia Square open during the work week, a Paris Baguette down the street, and La Pau Sat just a stones throw away for all the Hawker delights! Also the MRT is walking distance. The room itself was nice. I was upgraded to a higher floor and a larger room that had a beautiful view of Central Business District and Chinatown. It was clean, modern, and comfortable. Compared to some of the other hotels, the amenities are more ordinary but still nice. Customer service is excellent and staff members are always willing to help with whatever needs you might have. Reason why I say its not so great for tourists is because the area is VERY quiet over the weekend and there aren't

title: One night layover, great property!
desc: We were here for an overnight layover. This property is the perfect location for a business traveler as well as couples. The Marina is a few blocks away and you are a short walk from the MRT blue line. The lounge has great options for food/snacks as well as beverages. The roof top infinity pool offers fantastic views. We were in corner junior suite and had unobstructed views of the city and Chinatown. I highly recommend this property for couples and business travelers.

title: One of the better business hotels I have stayed in
desc: Excellent staff (nothing too much trouble), excellent room, very fast wifi, USB ports AND a single master switch to turn off the lights. Just two nights - managed the gym twice which is airy and fairly well equipped with about 5 running machines.

title: Very comfortable stay
desc: At the outset, thank you for ensuring a great stay for my family over 5 nights from 28 Oct to 2 Nov. We were here for a leisure trip and while this is a business hotel, it was a great hotel for leisure as well. Great location as it’s located in the heart of Singapore, and great staff, ever smiling and prompt, Always happy to help. I just need a bit help: Upon leaving the hotel, my 3 year old daughter realised that she had left a Wooden Jigsaw puzzle behind which was on the bed. This is very dear to her. Please do let me know if the same has been found. If it has been found, do let me know if the same can be sent across to us. I shall be extremely grateful for a revert on this. Stayed at #3802 from 28 Oct to 2 Nov.

title: Great business hotel, but lacks the charm
desc: Stayed here numerous times due to its location, within walking distance to my office in Singapore. Room is comfortable and spacious, and the Westin beds are indeed heavenly. The hotel also has a stunning rooftop pool that you should definitely check out. I appreciate them keeping the pool open at night, allowing me to swim after work.

title: Great location
desc: This hotel is in the financial district, having said that it is only a short walk from the MRT Downtowm. You can also walk to China town , hawkers market with amazing food and Marina Bay. Asia square also has lots of fast food outlets. The hotel is very comfortable and the staff were amazing. You enter on the ground floor and take the elevator to 32nd floor for reception. There are three dedicated elevators to the rooms where you need your key card to access guest bedrooms. There is a gym and infinity pool on floor 42, where there is an execuitive lounge which is excellent for . Would definately stay there again. Highly recommended

title: 6 Things to Know About Your Stay at the Westin Singapore
desc: Stayed for 3 nights at the Westin in a Presidential Suite and an adjoining room for my family of 5 adults. The Westin is one of my favorite hotel chains and thus did not disappoint — very clean, ultra spacious and great service! There are just a GM few things that will be helpful for you to know about this location: 1. Location of the hotel seems to be in the business district of Singapore, so there’s not a lot of things to do within walking distance of the hotel. The Marina Bay Area is reasonably walkable, but it’s on the outside perimeter of what you’d want to walk to in the heat. 2. However, there is an MRT station (Downtown station) within 5 mins of the hotel do it’s easy to take the subway anywhere you want to go. 3. There is an ATM right under the escalators outside

title: Convenient business hotel
desc: Pros -Excellent service -Good location close to Marina One, MBFS, Asia Square, etc -BonVoy member -For BonVoy members, breakfast in executive lounge is good and open until 11am -There is a Pure Fitness and Pure Yoga next door which is perfect for HK members of the club who want to use it as membership allows you to use SG gyms as well Cons -Restaurant/bar closed on Sunday -Not allowed to smoke on outdoor poolside terrace. This should be changed to allow clients to smoke after a certain hour when there are no more swimmers -Executive lounge closes at 730 for food and 830pm for drinks. The fact that no drinks are available in the executive lounge after 8:30pm is ridiculous.

title: Seasonal Tastes - The Westin Singapore
desc: Seasonal Tastes Restaurant offered wide variety of international, chinese, Singapore local dish, japanese and indian cusine. From salad starters to desserts , all are at its best taste. Special mention to the following: 1. Restaurant view is spectacular at 32nd floor. 2. Lobsters quality and quantity are worth for your visit 3. Mala wok fried baby lobster- tastes very good 4. Prawns- variety of dishes prepared for Prawn lovers 5. Pork steak and beef- supply is unending, tastes very good 6 Naan- vooked nicely and very soft, creamy 7. Desserts- island table supply of desserts . Key item caught my attention is the mango sorbet, tastes like a mixtire of Alphonse and Philippine sweet mango... must must try Customer Service- top notch , commendable! I requested windo view because

title: Fantastic stay - highly recommend
desc: Recently stayed here as part of a Luxury escapes package. Had a fantastic stay and would like to thank everyone for a wonderful break. Had read reviews about it being a very good hotel but the location could be better. I really could not fault it. MRT is 5 minutes away, and soon there will be a stop right next door. Marina Bay Sands, Gardens by the Bay and the nightly light show all very good distance from the hotel. Satay street, 5 minutes away and easy to access any part of the city. Club faculties outstanding and the staff at Cook and Brew all so lovely. Had dinner there as part of our package and the lady singing that night was amazing. Cannot wait to return and would like to thank all the staff for an outstanding job

title: Good Hotel, but could be better
desc: A great hotel as you would expect for a Westin. The rooms are spacious and modern. The bed was fantastic and the sleep quality was good as well (not a lot of noise from the air conditioner). They offer plunger coffee bags in the room which, is always welcome over instant coffee (which shouldn’t be any hotel rooms in this day and age). The bathroom is huge with a large soaker tub and floor to ceiling windows offering a great view. One negative was the time of servicing our room. We had been out all day just to come back to find our room was being made up at 4.00pm in the afternoon! Being a Bonvoy member and staying at many Westin hotels, I find their breakfast buffets are somewhat the same no matter which hotel you visit. The hash browns are straight out of a packet and they

title: One of my favorite hotels in the world
desc: I've been here several times and never had anything but a great experience. The rooms are clean, attractive and comfortable, even luxurious. They're also quiet, and the beds are wonderful. Food from room service and in the restaurants is very good. The location is perfect for me, because it's a 5 minute walk from the office I visit. However, the thing that makes the Westin Singapore one of my favorite hotels is the staff. They will do anything to make your stay better and are patient and flexible when it comes to things like arranging transfers to airport. They are helpful, friendly, polite and enthusiastic. I look forward to staying a the Westin Singapore again!

title: Great Room
desc: Fantastic room,comfortable bed, great floor to ceiling windows, room was large. The pool was amazing and a real highlight. The only negative was the breakfast very average for the price also we made a stuff up with our booking which meant we booked a night we did not use. There was no negotiation with the front of staff to get a refund.

title: Fantastic stay
desc: I normally stay at So Sofitel when I visit Singapore but decided on a change as I am trying to save more bonvoy points. I was not disapointed the hotel was excellent. When we arrived we were warmly greeted and told they had upgraded us due to my bonvoy status which was very much appreciated. The room was lovely with a nice view out to sea. The bathroom was INCREDIBLE! The hotel also sent up some chocolate dipped strawberries as it was our anniversary. We ordered room service for lunch as we were tired from an early flight from Langkawi when we arrived and wanted to chill. It was very nice and arrived quickly. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as I felt it was overpriced and lots of options around the hotel. The lobby bar was really nice. The waitress there was so

title: Staycation over the weekend
desc: Just checked into the Westin Singapore at the new downtown business district, southern tip of Singapore. The view unfortunately is blocked by the office tower but the rooms more than make up for it. The connecting suite that we got was superb. The beds are Super fluffy and the sheets so soft to the skin. The rooms are well stocked with complimentary water, Nespresso coffee and tea, a welcome chocolate platter and even kids-sized slippers. The bathtub in the toilet overlooks the biz district so beware of preying eyes, hahah. Our package comes with complimentary breakfast and kids below 12 eats for free if you are a Marriott Bonvoy member (if you are not just join for free). Overall def worth a stay. Even the lobby cafe looks good and will pop by for a cuppa. One note for

title: First Terrible Westin Experience
desc: I have been a huge fan of the Westin franchise for its consistent great service, amenities and location of its hotel. Also, an SPG member for more than a decade prior to the change to Bonvoy. I have never had an unpleasant stay in all my visits to Westin be it in Asia or out of Asia. Unfortunately, my first terrible experience happened just recently when I booked in 3 rooms for my whole family as I was having a wedding celebration nearby. The check-in service was horrendous. We had requested for early check-in and understand that despite being a member, it is often subject to availability and we were willing to wait till the official check-in time of 3pm as informed. Arrived for check-in at 230pm on 9th Nov 2019, was told that our rooms will only be ready an hour later

title: I feel disappointed
desc: I booked Westin Singapore hotel for my boss but this hotel made me feel so disappointed then any hotels in the world and we had so much trouble with it. I feel I was not support for my booking. I will never come back again.

title: Beautiful Hotel with Great Location
desc: Another “Room with a View” hotel in Singapore. With private infinity pool, viewing Singapore Strait and City Center. Their Heavenly Bed, it’s lovely. But my friend, he can’t sleep well because the bed is too soft. The staffs very friendly and informative. Especially the guy who work in Front Office. I tried the Seasonal Taste also, on Weekday Lunch. Very good food selections. All the best for The Westin Singapore!

title: Newer property but a bit hard to find at first
desc: This hotel is part of a multi-use complex and was difficult for our taxi driver to find. This was compounded by roadway shut downs due to a 5k run event. Once we arrived everything was wonderful. The rooms are nice, great executive lounge and nice pool. The views from the pool area were wonderful. Very peaceful and relaxing. Did not use the gym but did peek in. We were impressed with the quantity and type of equipment the gym had. Liked how close everything was to us. We enjoyed staying here.

title: Great hotel
desc: The room was fantastic. I lucked out I was given a suite. The pool is beyond belief and the onsite restaurants are all fantastic. My only complaint, go to 7-11 for your soft drinks, they charge $9 a can.

title: WONDERFUL HOTEL
desc: We recently stayed at The Westin Singapore during New Year , it was our first time to Singapore and also at The Westin. The hotel was wonderful and nice , service from the staffs (FO and WC) was excellent and amazing. A staff David at the lobby was attentive and approachable to every guests. He helped us by providing details and tips on the transport and exact locations. Happy New Year ! Morgan Kings USA

title: Nice Hotel building and rooms, but sadly lacking in the usual Westin Service Standards!
desc: My visit to the Westin Hotel Singapore didn't start well due to the lack of Service by the Concierge, which is shocking on my arrival and even my departure! On arrival, the bell hop guy took our luggage out and told us to make our own way up to the front office. On my departure, I called to book a taxi to get to the airport in advance, only to have to wait another 20mins more when I was ready to leave. Very unlike the previous Westin Singapore or Westin in other countries I have visited. Had dinner in the Cook & Brew outlet and the live music was shocking LOUD that I struggled to order my drinks or food OR have a conversation. Buffet breakfast spread is good but serving staff is also poorly trained. I know it is the holiday season but standards shouldn't suffer

title: Great room
desc: Loved the spacious room and design. Was only here on business so did not have the time to enjoy all amenities but from what I can tell the Westin service is great as always. The only thing that bugged me was the gap in the bathroom blinds - there are privacy switches for the windows but it still felt like people from the building across could see into my room!

title: Loved the location of property and view
desc: Checked in at night after a flight from Ho Chi Minh City and staff was very welcoming and cordial. View of the harbor ("industrial") and cruise port was great from our high perch. Close to an MRT stop where everything begins. Also within a block of a Hawkers nest and little longer walk to Merlion Park. Large room with plenty of closet space and bathroom. Room rate we chose included an amazing breakfast buffet with western and Asian foods. Extended the length of the restaurant. Wife had planned the entire trip and this property was another winner.

title: Wonderful stay
desc: Thank you for a wonderful stay. Special mention to Dinesh, Fiona, Irish, Fiona(FD). They were all fantastic and looked after us. The rooms were spacious and were clean. Special mention to housekeeping Kevin and Mike.We will be back again!

title: 5 Star Service
desc: We have really enjoyed our 3 nights with Westin Singapore. The staff have been beautiful. We love that they remember us from one day to the next, offering us bottles of water each time we leave the hotel, directions and a smile. Nothing is too much trouble. We were very grateful they could manage an early checkin when we arrived super early off an overnight flight. We chose to book the Club Rooms in order to save money on food and drinks, as Singapore can get expensive to eat out all the time. The food and drinks offered in the Club Room is generous and certainly meant we all relaxed into the start of our holiday. The Hotel is not really located amongst it, if you are here purely for tourism, however taxis are cheap, the MTR Station is right at the Hotel and nothing is very far

title: Loved the Room
desc: We travel quite a bit and I can honestly say the the rooms at this Westin are the best we experienced this year. Lots of light, spacious and a very practical bathroom and closet configuration. We and our teenager shared the room and it still felt spacious. Pool area is relaxing and has wonderful views. Plus, I love Westin beds, they are so comfortable. We stayed down in Marina Bay, great location from which to use the MRT or taxi to go wherever you want. It was a great location and the staff was very friendly. Like the rest of Singapore, all dressed up for Christmas! Highly recommend, you can spend more or less, but Westin hits the sweet spot of value for us.

title: Beautiful Hotel with Excellent Service
desc: Friendly and welcoming ladies at the front desk upon check in, it was fast and smooth. Very good first impression…. Beautiful view, spacious and comfy room. Sparkling clean. Superb toiletries. Superb evening cocktail at the Westin Club and breakfast at Seasonal Taste. We met the staff, Ms. Janise and Nisa at at The Westin Club, Damenran during breakfast at Seasonal Taste and Chris at The Lobby Lounge. They were very friendly and helpful. Both Janice and Nisa were very attentive, offered us various selections of special menu and wine for our evening cocktail so we don’t have to wait for too long. We have chosen The Westin Singapore because the location and to celebrate my daughter 7th birthday. It was WOW! Everything was perfect, the birthday cake, the decoration and the style.

title: Spectacular
desc: Wow. Just wow! A spectacular hotel. From the courteous staff, decor, comfort and little extras like the beautiful pool, great club amenities, and possibly the best buffet bfast around!!!! The housekeeping staff’s attention to detail - even replacing the pen on a day when i had taken it out around town with me. Concierge was very helpful and offered extra water bottles to take out with us on our adventures. We weren’t too keen on the limited menu at the Cook and Brew - the included meal for our luxury escapes package was bitterly disappointing. We should have gone out to one of the local hawker centres instead, but the buffet breakfast in the morning was phenomenal- and changed each day. The hotel is well located with a spectacular view of the South China Sea, and very close to

title: Staycation with Hubby
desc: Excellent and impeccable service was provided by Amir who welcomed us upon arrival. He offered us late check-out as we arrived late and we are very appreciative of that. He shared tips of the halal eateries nearby as we are Muslims and can't consume the food and beverages offered in the hotel as it is not halal-certified. When we checked out the next day, it was Amir again who checked on us whether our stay was good. Thank you Amir! You are truly an asset to the hotel! :)

title: Amazing view!
desc: We have previously stayed at the Stamford on our previous visits to Singapore but for something different we chose The Westin for our 2 night stopover. Our room was on the 43rd level (Executive Floor) and had a magnificent view across the harbour. The Executive Floor access included a beautiful buffet breakfast, evening drinks and canapés and is conveniently located adjacent to the infinity pool. Our spacious room was well appointed and the enormous bathroom was very luxurious with the bathtub positioned near a ceiling to floor wall of glass with a view across the harbour also. The hotel is situated in a newer development and is a short walk from the Marina Bay Sands complex and Gardens by the Bay. I really can’t fault this establishment at all. Staff are to be complimented on

title: All is great
desc: My very first impression with the hotel is that they were able to accommodate me and my family with early check in at 10AM! I was very surprise as it is quite early compare to their 3PM standard check in time. I really appreciated their effort on this. Furthermore, we booked a room for 3 adults and they provided us with a complimentary extra bed for all 3 nights we were staying. Such a kind gesture. The hotel ambiance is very nice and smart. It is located in the heart of Singapore Business District so it is easy to get around by MRT. There is a coffee shop and a 7-eleven nearby as well as a food hawk - Lau Pa Sat - all are located in a short walking distance. On to the facility and amenities - I personally LOVE the White Tea amenities because they smell SUPER GREAT and I can't

title: A few days in Singapore
desc: As a Lifetime Titanium BonVoy member, I often choose to stay at a Bonvoy property. Luckily Singapore offers a great selection! The Westin Singapore is near the financial district/Marina Bay Area but still offers easy access (walking, taxi, public transportation) to a lot of destinations. Access to the hotel was a bit of a chore with some local construction, however, once you arrive, you head up to the lobby level for check in, and you are greeted by the top notch service so many of the hotels in SE Asia offer. With an early morning arrival, our room was not quite ready. The staff were very accommodating and stored our bags, then provide up with access to the Westin Club Lounge where we enjoyed a wonderful breakfast. The lounge really has a lot to offer. Within an hour our

title: Great hotel
desc: Very certainly located. We were able to walk to the Marina Bay Sands and Garden by the Bay in 15 minutes. The Downtown MRT was less than a 5 min walk. Lovely rooms. Great club--wonderful breakfast and happy hour.

title: Great Place to Stay
desc: We stayed in a large modern room which made up for in space what it lacked in character. Bed was super comfy giving a great night's sleep. We had a club/dining package and the club was the outstanding feature of our stay. Extremely attentive staff and great food and refreshments available during the day. The one disappointment was our single inclusive meal at the unimpressive Cook and Brew. We had been looking forward to this meal and were then handed a "special" i.e. greatly restricted menu with only 3 or 4 choices for each course. The staff was very helpful and by forgoing the uninspiring desert options, I was able to add a some fries to the only main course that I could eat. The conversation stifling piped music did not help and ensured that we did not linger after our meal.

title: Would definitely stay here again!
desc: Loved the hotel. Great staff, eating facilities, convenient location to a number of things, including the cruise terminal. Fortunately, I am a Marriott Platinum and so had access to the Westin Club. GREAT club.

title: Excellent stay and service
desc: Let me begin by saying that I am an Ambassador-level traveller with Bonvoy so, my reservations are highlighted to the staff. Let me also say that many hotels do a poor job at offering the earned benefits...but, not this Westin. From the welcome at the curb, to the outstanding welcome and service at the front desk, to the executive club team...the staff at this Westin were tremendous. The suite was spacious and comfortably appointed. Large bathroom and shower. The tub was large enough for me, which is unusual even for suites. Double closet. In this particular suite, the closet is away from the bedroom so the dressing area is awkward. Again, my usual lament against hotel designers not actually sleeping in rooms. But, this was only the slightest inconvenience. My room

title: Fantastic Luxury Escape
desc: We had a fabulous stay at the Westin as part of a Luxury Escapes deal for 5 nights The staff were extremely friendly and helpful The room was excellent . Clean and quiet and the view was incredible . The Cook and Brew dinner was particularly good....so tasty . The breakfast offered everything we needed and more . We had canapés each night in the Westin Club which was outstanding We loved the heavenly beds... they were so comfortable Can truly recommend the Westin . We hope to come back and bring our friends .

title: Post cruise stopover
desc: We stayed for one day & night post Asian cruise, the hotel was very accommodating to provide an early check-in and upgrade, probably helped that I’ve got a reasonable Bonvoy status. We arrived on a Saturday so the general area around the hotel was fairly quiet as it’s based in the CBD, there are various bars and restaurants in the very close vicinity but most were closed as I presume they support CBD employee’s during Mon-Fri. It is a very modern new hotel, staff are very accommodating and rooms are lovely. We had some drinks at the bar in the lobby and there is an amazing view out towards the islands and cruise terminal through the huge windows. There is a short walk through a passageway to the local Singaporean food market which is very popular with tourists and locals, I

title: Wonderful Hotel
desc: We have stayed here three different times over the course of six years. The location is perfect for getting around. Walking distance to the marina. Two minutes from the MRT. The rooms are quiet, beautifully equipped, modern and lovely. I’m especially taken with the bathroom (lovely soaking tub and large shower). This stay had only one drawback. Since our last stay, another large skyscraper has gone up so the view is blocked to the bay when you have a pool view room. The gym is perfect, the pool divine, the concierge is exceptionally accommodating. There is also a yoga studio next door that has great classes at 50% discount for hotel guests.

title: Nice hotel - not for families
desc: Westin Singapore: Now this is an interesting post as my husband and I had different opinions on this hotel. We booked a 3 night luxury escapes deal for $999 which included breakfast daily, access to the club lounge, afternoon drinks & snacks and a 3 course meal at cook and brew for 2 adults. Check in was on the 32nd floor of the Asia Square building number 2. This area is where all of the business people would go and I think the hotel is much better suited to them rather than families. The Downtown MRT is across the road a short walk away. Raffles Place MRT is also close by near La Pau Sat where we love to eat. The staff were all lovely at the hotel, but very sterile with almost no character about them. This was the thing I judged the hotel on the most as we have just

title: Truly Outstanding
desc: Super-impressed with every aspect of my first stay at this property. I decided to try something different from my normal go-to in Singapore [The Conrad]. I am so glad I did. This hotel is awesome. Love the modern rooms and elevated views. The location isn’t the best but I was happy to be away from any traffic/outside noise. The service was rock solid. Every team member was friendly, helpful, and very responsive. [shout-outs to David in the Club lounge for his energy and engaging personality]. The food and beverage options were truly world-class. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant was one of the best I have ever seen. The club lounge food offerings were the best I have experienced in Singapore. I was very impressed by the recognition I received for my Titanium

title: Family holiday
desc: We stayed in the Westin as a family for the first time, it was great from check in to check out. The breakfast are fantastic and the staff are really lovely offering great service. The rooms were excellent really comfortable. Can’t wait to come here again.

title: bad management and bad service
desc: i book this hotel for 2 night, 750 SGD per NIGHT from january 15-17, 2020. i arrive at night around 8.30 pm for check in. BUT this is the best part. Westin said all room fullbook and CAN NOT accommodate my reservation. i book through AGODA and fullpayment. i am travelling with my wife and my 2 month son. can you imagine what should i do when i want to check in they said like that? we need a room for rest. i don't have any choice beside accept they offer to move the other hotel and the hotel not so good. because of that i must change all my plan and ruin my day. a whole night i try to find a new hotel in city center. westin staff did not help me at all. its make me think twice if i must stay di westin singapore.

title: Truly a luxury escape!
desc: My partner and I spent three nights at the Westin as part of a luxury escapes deal and we certainly found that this hotel was definitely a luxurious place in which to escape! Our room was very spacious, with a separate bathroom which featured a free standing bath. The bed was enormous, with fine quality linen and our room overlooked the pool area. Our deal included a daily breakfast and it was one of the best buffet breakfasts I have encountered, with a wide range of Western, Asian and healthy options. The egg station was manned by an extremely cheerful lady and even featured eggs benedict, as well as the more usual offerings of omelettes, poached and fried eggs made to order. The pastries were wonderful and there was even a small oven which contained heated croissants and

title: Lovely stay!
desc: We stayed here a few nights after our cruise. We got a good deal on luxury escapes. From the moment we arrived it was pleasant. The staff checked us in early and were lovely to deal with. Rooms were spotless and comfortable. We had longe access (Ashley in the lounge was amazing) and ensured our glasses were never empty. We stayed for 3 nights, the first 2 in the lounge ran smoothly and was faultless, however the only criticism I can give is on the third night a manager (I think her name was Tahini) was micromanaging the staff quite obviously and gave off an uncomfortable feeling, so we left. Apart from that the hotel stay was faultless and I would definitely visit again.

title: Excellent in luxury
desc: I really enjoyed my stay at the Westin in Singapore. The hotel well maintains modern and clean facilities, large bedroom and bathroom, and the magnificent view of the city and harbour. The location is also convenient for both business and leisure.

title: More than 5 stars!!!
desc: Amazing hotel, great food, good people..this is more than a 5-star hotel! All the comforts and luxury in one place. Must stay when you travel to Singapore. A big thank you to the entire team who took good care of us-will choose you again!

title: Excellent business hotel - very friendly staff
desc: I have recently stayed at the Westin, Singapore on a business trip. I needed somewhere very near to the office but not to far from the city. The hotel was very clean, rooms were well presented, comfortable bed, large desk, excellent bathroom and the room was well appointed. I ended up staying for just over four weeks and found all the staff very friendly, helpful and quick to resolve any problems or general questions. I cannot thank the the whole team enough for making my stay so bearable considering the length of time staying in a hotel. I would highly recommend the hotel, it’s staff and outstanding weekend dinner buffet - amazing. Finally to other business travellers, you will find all the things you need whilst travelling - quiet room, comfortable bed, good work space,

title: Very pleased with this choice of hotel
desc: Good location in CBD, five minutes from the excellent Lau Pa Sat hawker centre and also five minutes from a MRT stop. We didn’t use the MRT however, choosing to walk where practical, the Marina Bay area is only 10-15 minutes away, or taking metered and very cheap taxis. Excellent views of either the harbour or Marina Bay areas from bedrooms and the glass fronted bath and shower areas are very novel. Bedrooms are a good size and are very well equipped. Service was excellent, staff were happy for us to use the very pleasant infinity pool and shower facilities to change several hours after we had checked out to accommodate our late flight. Breakfast gave a broad range of choices to a very high standard. I got an excellent room rate including breakfast and free Singapore Slings

title: Commendation on outstanding hospitality service
desc: I visited The Westin Singapore, Seasonal Taste for a lunch. I was brought in by a lady which I was then seated by the window with an amazing sea view. The lady whom served us doesn’t seemed very polite. Subsequently, a manager by the name of Jonathan Tan. He refilled water for us very often as compared to the lady mentioned earlier. Jonathan Tan rendered us an excellent customer service by taking care of us in a very calm and polite manner. He mentioned that he was from the Banquet team. We had quite a few small talks with him and he mentioned that he was helping out in the restaurant on that specific day. And we did asked him whether when will he be at the restaurant again because I would definitely visit this restaurant and be under his care. As observed, he maintained a great

title: Central Location at its best
desc: Stayed in the Westin Singapore for three nights during our first time in the city. We have chosen this place due to its location and proximity to all the main attractions. Stay was pleasant and the team was very efficient. The hotel lobby is located on the 32nd floor and all the rooms are located above it - hence you may get yourself ready to have some nice city views from the high floors. Swimming pool is quite spacious and not busy at the time we were there - another benefit for those who would like to relax in not a crowded space. Rooms were quite spacious and bright, yet very comfortable. Thank you the Westin team for taking care of us - until we meet again.

title: Great place great food great staff
desc: As the title stated! Enjoyed my dinner. The manager Jonathan was really friendly and great service! Thank the service crew darmendran for the excellent service and attitude too. The lobsters were very fresh! Will be back.

title: Birthday Celebration at Seasonal Tastes
