desc: We met 2 lovely service staff, Darmendran & Jonathan Tan, who made my Mother’s bday dinner celebration all the more special by presenting her with a large slice of bday cake and singing a bday song for her. They did this out of goodwill and it was a nice gesture from them. The food and ambience was great too! Would highly recommend!

title: Great
desc: Before reading this review, remember that my eye sight is extremely bad and I am too lazy to put on my glasses, so I'm just going to describe how the staff looks like. :) During my first visit, a couple of weeks ago, I had an amazing service from the front desk. The lady who checked me in (I think it's the manager, she has the letters I, A, and Y in her name), anticipated all my needs (late checkout, bigger room, double bed, more amenities, etc). It was really crazy how intelligent this lady is. There were 2 other ladies who were also at the front desk who smiled and wished me a pleasant stay even though they had they own work to do, which I though was really amazing. During my second visit, it was a different group of people at the front desk. The service was good but

title: Comfortable Room and Amazing Rooftop Pool
desc: Thoroughly enjoyed our staycation at The Westin Singapore. Staff were courteous and prompt in all deliveries and encounters. Room was spacious with comfortable beds. Tranquil rooftop swimming pool that overlooks the city skyline. Will definitely recommend!

title: Seasonal Taste
desc: We dined at Seasonal Taste, located at the 32 floor of The Westin. Jonathan Tan, The Manager offered great service and made my mother's birthday a memorable experience. We really appreciate the hospitality and we will return soon. Thank you.

title: Seasonal Tastes
desc: Kudos to the service personal who have the natural flare in playing host and make you feel so VIP Special thanks to Jonathan Tan who is so attentive and professional playing host to make the birthday celebration memorable. Will certainly recommend the venue as it’s certainly worth the visits

title: Modern with great service
desc: Super modern hotel with wonderful staff and facilities - great gym with spectacular views and infinity pool Location is more in the business area but easy walk to mtr and access to all tourist areas Walked to the marina bay sands at night - easy stroll Definitely will return

title: Great Weekend Retreat
desc: The area is quiet during weekends, allowing for the Sunday morning jogs in the CBD without the hustle & bustle. Hotel room is well equipped and the lounge presents great options during breakfast with friendly service provided.

title: Seasonal taste
desc: Jonathan Tan expressed great hospitality towards me and my missus. Incredibly polite and courteous. After we finished dining he helped to clean the plates really fast and efficiently.Truly Served us well:)

title: Birthday Staycation!
desc: Had a birthday staycation recently with my friends and we were pleasantly greeted by hospitable staff and also a slice of cake after check in. Facilities were great, having used the gym and spa facilities (especially the whirlpool - these are free for in-house guests), and toiletries were sufficient. Special mention to Angie, Yani and several staff whose names we unfortunately did not note, for their extreme hospitality and acceding to our requests whenever we had them. Also, one of the housekeeping staff who brought extra pillows and blankets to us upon request, took it upon herself to provide us with more bottles of water seeing that we had 3 people instead of 2. Thank you to the staff at The Westin for this pleasant staycation! :)

title: they are Aware and now I am Aware! they Believe, ... I Totally Believe in them!!
desc: Savour and Immersed my taste buds with The Westin Singapore dining at my own table, in the comfort of my home on 20 August 2020, evening. Woah!! You may ask how did I managed to indulge into this Hotel's food in view of the current situation? Since I am unable 'To Go'; to this Hotel and her restaurants to dine, they To-Go; to me via their delivery service. The other reason is from 2 Amazing People I got to know in 2 occasions, being Aware and totally Believing in their Services & Products, recommended me to try. Thank You, you Fabulous ones; Angie Ong for informing me that her Hotel 'Made It Possible' to feast with The Westin Singapore Food & Beverage + Culinary and provided me the delivery link. For Nur Aishah Chen, suggested the Talk-a-Bout & Flavourful Minang Chicken

title: AN AMAZING HOTEL FOR STAYCATION!
desc: It was a really pleasant stay with Westin Singapore from 18th December to 20th December. I would like to compliment afew people. Firstly, the bellboy Chinese tall guy didn't catch his name. Debbie from the reception as well. She was super nice and polite and did her job really well. She deserved to be pat on the back. Though it was just 2 days after reopening of the hotel, it seems that she knows her stuff well. Nisa if i am not wrong, the girl at the first floor counter. She is super friendly towards all her guests coming to the hotel. Never did i see that she never smile to us. She also deserved to be commendable. Lastly, i cannot remember the colleague name that was with Debbie on 20th Dec at the counter. She also did a very good job. Please find out who this lady and

title: Great hotel
desc: My second time here. The room is clean and I enjoy staying here. I had the infinity pool to myself. You need to book in advanced. I took the earlier slot from 8-9.30AM. The staff were friendly. It was such a good stay. Probably can look into halal buffet for breakfast and so something about the opaque toilet door as if you are travelling with siblings or cousins or even friends, what's inside in the bathroom can be seen from the outside.

title: One night stay on 19th dec 2020
desc: The room was booked under my sister's name as she was a Marriott bonvoy member. Westin lived up to its 5 star hotel name. We had an absolutely fantastic relaxed staycay. Service: In the email, it was stated that we are to park at level 5 n use the lift up to the lobby. But due to covid, the only entrance is via level 1 and the level 5 carpark lift is closed. So the email is slightly misleading and shld be tailored to the changes. So if u are driving, park at any level n take the lift to first floor. The hotel staff that greeted us at the lobby was superb. He offered to carry our stuffs and pressed the lift for us. Front desk was professional. Check in was smooth. Our room was ready by 2p.m when we arrived at the hotel while my sister's room was not yet ready. Hotel: The

title: Great stay but could be better
desc: We stayed at The Westin Singapore for our family staycation during the December holidays. It was a very pleasant stay in general. The staffs were nice, location is convenient and the view is great. But you could tell that the hotel needs some upgrading here and there. Our rainforest shower was working but 1/3 of it doesn’t have water coming out. Then on our second day, the Aircon broke down and we had to move rooms. The staffs were all very fast in accommodating our request. But still... these are not something you’d expect on a 5 star hotel. Hope standards will get better once covid is over.

title: really a business hotel but with a great elevated view
desc: [Positives] 1. It has to be the view. it is situated above the office building and thus, you will get an elevated view. 2. a deep soaking bathtub 3. an unique cook & brew where we dine. 4. based on my Marriott Bonvoy Plat Elite Tier, received an additional $100 dining credit as the lounge was not opened (or maybe there wasn't any lounge) 5. small bites (Cookies) were offered to us during the evening and it was indeed a pleasant surprise 6. Breakfast selection was amazing (somehow a lite version of Conrad's Oscars) [Negatives] 1. didn't get a suite upgrade based on my Marriott Bonvoy Platinum Elite tier as it was full. 2. booked a stay for a date but when was checking in, was informed that throughout the stay, I won't be able to get a slot at the swimming pool because it was

title: Nice business hotel
desc: Very good hotel Great location - close to business district as well as to marina bay Astonishing views - everything is on upper stories Basic facilities - my room was nothing special but had everything I need (including comfortable kind bed) Yammy breakfast - wide variety of choices, good healthy food selection, nice staff Lovely lounge - l enjoyed sitting on a roof top terrace Wonderful pool - an infinity one! Also - good in terms of value for money

title: Heavenly Staycation
desc: Check in: Has a queue but not very crowded, staff gave water bottles to those in the line, a good gesture. Given 2pm late checkout with Bonvoy Gold. Room: Amazing view and spacious. Bed: Heavenly, nuff said. Bathroom: Great, but with a tinge of envy looking at other reviews with a nice view from bathtub. Restaurant: Hard to secure a timing during dinner as I believe many guests have F&B voucher to utilize, lunch time has more availability. Service is prompt and friendly, appetizers and mains are good. Desserts are too sweet. Location: Near Lau Pa Sat, good place for dinner, nothing else in the vicinity as it is located right within CBD. Nevertheless Westin is a good choice to chill for staycation.

title: Lovely staycation
desc: Clean and spacious room, comfortable bedding, lovely and efficient staff, coast in sight from room and pool. Thanks for the complimentary cake, it was ready upon arrival as my friend informed the hotel via email that its my birthday. Breakfast was good, select 1 main dish and the rest of the food are unlimited ala carte order. Smaller portion could be given for the ala carte items so that we can order more variety. Check-in and check-out was quite fast although the queue was long during the weekend, they had many staff and counters available. Booking for breakfast, pool, and gym is manual. Would be great if they can have automated booking system like many other hotels. Overall, very good experience with the hotel. Thank you to the hotel staff for the lovely experience and

title: Busines Trip in Pandemic Years
desc: Really have a good Joy of stay and keep in God Health Protocol during my Stay. Every years come to Visit still the same good service & quality. Can’t wait to be back soon. Food are really good during B’fast, the room is Huge and Clean. Easy access to go to city and MRT station. If you want to have a Singapore Hawkers is easly pass by the Street in Laupassat Hawker.

title: Amazing views, service and breakfast
desc: I booked the 12.12 deal last year and honestly, it was one of the best decision I've made! My family enjoyed the staycation very much. We were upgraded to their Club King room, so it was on the highest floor (the 46th floor). Since the lounge was closed, we received $100 credit to spend. Breakfast was great too! You've got a lot of choices, see my photo. Servings were small but it's good if you want to try different dishes, and you could always reorder. Would recommend coming here for a staycation!

title: Good hotel, less convenient location for tourists
desc: A relatively new hotel means top notch furnishing and facilities. Perched on top of a office building, views are stunning. The spa was great. The only drawback is its location, far from all the usual tourist sights and it is not directly connected to the subway network.

title: Absolutely fantastic with unparalleled service.
desc: Stayed a few times in this property after it finally reopened for staycations. The property is well appointed and well maintained. As rooms starts from around level 35, all rooms have great views of the port, Marina Bay or Chinatown. The hotel adjusted well post covid not just in health measures but in terms of experience, there was sealed packet welcome chocolates for elite members and a SGD100 F&B benefit (to be consumed within on day of arrival) due to lounge closure. Breakfast slots were nicely allocated with the last slot at 11.30am to 1pm to ensure everyone would be able to dine in the restaurant. In fact, this would be the best staycation I have been to thus far. Exceptional compliments also goes to Fiona, Gaya, Khatik and Thomas (Cook and Brew) and I can’t wait to

title: Tranquility in the City
desc: Room was spacious and very clean. The Heavenly Beds were soft and comfortable. Rooftop swimming pool was relaxing with a stunning view of the city. Hotel staff were courteous and eager to assist. Special mention to Sarina at the Reception for being efficient and sincere. The rain shower in the room sprays water in many directions which was uncomfortable but the handheld shower head was powerful and made up for the shower experience. Thing to note: The hotel only provides complimentary parking over the weekends. We stayed during the weekday and had 2 rooms with 2 cars. Parking charges went up to $50 per vehicle. Recommend locals on staycation to leave their cars at home. Overall, hotel was well maintained and service level was consistent before COVID and now. Thoroughly

title: Stunning View
desc: I would say that the hotel room comes with stunning views of the City. Located above the Asia Square offices, all rooms are minimally 32 storeys and above. I had a room facing the Shenton way and Chinatown. Full glass window by the bed, and I'm in awe with the views. The toilet has a full glass window facing the same scenery too. The bathtub beside the window is the icing. Really enjoyed my stay here.

title: Nicely surprised
desc: As a business hotel that has just finished SHN, I didn't expect much except for looking forward to enjoy cycling on business district for quiet weekend. I was so wrong. There was no queue during check in. Our room was ready when we came before noon. To use up our F&B credit due to club lounge closure, we went for lunch at Cook and Brew. Nice selection and the price is not stupid. Mr. Park Kiwon also saved us from our 3 y.o Spaghetti tantrum. We then went for a nice cold swim but beautiful view of the hotel's infinity pool, which a staff has kindly informed us that a slot was available due to no-show. On return, there's 2 boxes of plain teddy bear cookies+icing+very generous amount of choc balls 100's 1000's and heart decoration for our kids to decorate their teddy bear.

title: Luxury, Comfort & Top of the World feeling
desc: Great place for Staycation or Business Stay, situated in Singapore’s CBD and enjoys great views of Marina Bay (although partially blocked by other buildings). Superb restaurants nearby with fantastic views too like The Vue, Stellar Art, etc. Executive Suite is approximately 750sq ft! Sleeps 3 (including a rollaway bed). In-room amenities are outstanding, including Expresso Coffee machine and TV Screen in bathroom! Only setback is not having a full length mirror inside the bedroom eg inside the wardrobe. Only mirrors are located in the bathroom and corridor/hallway. Despite the rainy weekend, we enjoyed the Fitness Studio, bar & restaurant and watching TV in our suite. It’s a pity that we couldn’t go out to the infinity pool, if only there was a covered walkway from the hotel to

title: Heavenly Beds For Sure!
desc: I stayed at this magnificent hotel for 2 nights as a long-awaited getaway from work. Irish (Duty Manager) reached out to me via a Pre-Arrival Email to check if I needed any assistance. She was so kind to arrange an early check in for me and also attended to my enquiries about their F&B offerings. On the day of check in, Gayathri and Sarina arranged a complimentary upgrade which was a lovely surprise during my registration. A late check-out was much appreciated so I could relax in the room a little longer too! The room was incredibly spacious, clean and had a stunning view of the harbour. The bed and pillows were very soft and comfortable. The bath tub was Instagram-worthy and I enjoyed a hot soak every night. I enjoyed the room so much that I didnt realise I had overstayed

title: New Year Staycation
desc: New year staycation for one night. Hotel lobby is located on the 32nd Floor. Got an upgrade and thanks to Haryani for the arrangement. Ceck in was swift. Room had a stunning view. Very spacious and superbly clean and comfortable. All in all, it was a great stay!

title: Comfortable and Cozy Staycation
desc: One of the best staycation we had because the room was super comfortable and cozy. The breakfast was superb and indeed I must say, it was the best hotel breakfast that I ever had. Great job chefs! The staff was very friendly, pleasant and warm. They entertained the kids while we were having breakfast and they had fun. The deep soaking bathtub was great gateaway for relaxation. The only downfall was missing the kids amenities. Being a Marriott properties, I was expecting that but they don't have much expect for kids slippers. If you would have that, I guess it would be bomb staycation indeed.

title: Something to be WOW for.
desc: Extraordinary Magnificent Stay. The first experienced, WOW!! Amazing service and room. First all of, Thanks to Siti Sarina for the lovely upgrade to Grand Premier room. Very spacious at 46sm, with panoramic view with the floor to ceiling window. Good natural lights made the room so bright. The bathroom is superb too. Bathtub by the window can relax yourself at the the end of the day. This is simply indulgence. Pictures attached will tell you what I mean. The reception is so accommodating & friendly, Janine (i think that's her name). Your service attitude is remarkable. The service is super fast. whenever I request for additional items, I got it within 5mins. Unlike other 5 star hotels, I have to wait 10 to 15 mins (including at The Raffles) . I use the chat app on mobile is

title: Wonderful stay experience
desc: Thank you to the awesome team in westin Singapore. Me and my family members were having a great time during our recent CNY staycation. Everyone from front desk are friendly. I've been staying there several times and always assisted by helpful associates. Ms Fiona who assisted my previous check in and also kudos to Ms Gayathri who assisted with our recent check in. We really impressed by their professionalism and courteous attitude. See you guys soon. Cheers!

title: A business hotel
desc: Nothing more than a business hotel. Clean and big rooms, yummy breakfast! beautiful swimming pool! Central location and lots of yummy food around. Stay in the high floor for greater views! Parking is not complimentary though which is a pity.

title: Wonderful weekend
desc: We stayed over the weekend and got the room with 2 queen beds. The room is spacious, the bathroom is luxurious and most important the room is clean. We stayed on the highest floor, the view is amazing. There is only one pool but the view from the pool is beautiful. Room service is fast and efficient. Overall will definitely stay here again next time. Thank you Westin.

title: Great rooms great value staycay for Plat Elite!
desc: Location – The hotel seems like it was set up to be a business hotel, nestled in the Asia Square area where all the fancy banks are. It was considered more ‘ulu’ before the Downtown line was up and running but now with Downtown station (DT17) just a 3-5min walk away, staying here is not as inconvenient if you need to run around. On weekdays, the area is bustling with working peeps and plenty food options but a lot quieter on weekends when the office crowds are almost non existent. Pre-arrival – I received my very detailed pre-arrival email 5 days prior to my stay listing the necessary info and I appreciate the thought that goes into making sure it contains everything that a guest would possibly need to know. Room – I was upgraded to a Grand Premier Room (46SqM) from a Deluxe

title: Bestie's Bdae Surprise was a Success!
desc: From the start, I am such a detailed-oriented Virgoan and when I planned such surprises it really wouldn't be an easy accomplishment without tremendously also genuinely helpful yet truly dedicated (shall I say passionate🤔hehe) front desk representatives such as Mr Syed,Ms Gayathri,Ms Jasmine,Ms Yana,Ms Hani,Ms Huda! They treated my request with great sense of professionalism with assisting me in ensuring that my surprised event for my bestie Ms Sha could take place🙆🏻‍♀️ From the bottom of my heart, I truly appreciate all the effort and hardwork placed into assisting me with the entire plan out. Westin Singapore truly felt as if I am out of my reality bubble. The bed was heavenly and yes I knocked out straight and had such cosy,comforting atmosphere too with spectacular view

title: Absolutely Wonderful
desc: As you enter the lobby on the ground floor and take the lift to the 32nd floor, what awaits you as the lift door opens are the hotel lobby and food and beverage outlets. Another outlet is found on the 33rd floor. The floor to ceiling window panels allow you to admire the breathtaking view. One should also luxuriate in the open space. There is a grand piano in the lobby, and if my memory serves me correctly, there used to a pianist playing tunes, but in these uncertain times, not anymore; I guess. As it was a weekday, the check-in process was smooth and efficient, and like most hotels, booking of facilities such as the pool and gym; is necessary. This and other precautions and notices were thoroughly explained as I was being checked in. Finding my way to the room was also easy.

title: Great stay and friendly staff
desc: Stayed here for an advance staycation for my sister in law. The staff who checked us in was friendly and very accommodating. Same goes with the staff who manages the marriott bonvoy chat. They reply promptly with our request. Heads up too for the staff at the heavenly spa. He adjusted our schedule for the pool and spa easily and was so polite and always smiling. We had a short but really great stay. Thank you.

title: staycation
desc: Had staycation at Westin. Overall Service was ok. I was given upgrade to premium room, which somehow i ended up in one of the connecting rooms. Door for connecting room wasnt locked, and the next door to us were talking loudly that disturbs our sleep. I hope something can be done to lessen the noise disturbance as we hear slamming/closing of door sounds as well. Oh yes, I did manage to get a slot to the pool even though I was on the waitlist, which is a plus point for this trip. Love the pool view.

title: Amazing stay
desc: Booked on hotelux rate and stayed as platinum elite Front desk staff were friendly per business hotel standard Cook and brew staff (namely Alif and Mr Park) were fantastic and were willing to attend to your needs Highlight of the hotel would be the panoramic view of the sea perched atop of the building Breakfast spread was great except food is somewhat cold (assume this was done in bulk preparation due to COVID situation) Sadly club lounge was closed for an extended period Would look forward to returning

title: Pleasantly surprised with room upgrade and all requests met
desc: Stayed a nice during jun holidays during heightened alert (no dine in and facilities were closed). Pleasantly surprised at how not crowded it was for a Friday check in.. Pluses: Pretty empty foe a Friday check in No kids in sight - Guess kids need activities and being stuck at home would probably be better than being stuck in a small hotel room. Room upgrade and all requests met Hotel staff were very pleasant. Food delivery options were plentiful. Had a room with a bathtub with a view Minuses Parking in the building was expensive. Complimentary carpark was only for per entry. Overall, a bit of hassle with the heightened alert but not the hotel’s fault. A better than expected stay!

title: Excellent hotel
desc: I went for my birthday celebration on 17 April. Everything was amazing. The room was big with comp upgrade. Super clean !!!!!!!!!!! I can tell the managers lead the team very well. You should proud to have such amazing team Westin Singapore ! Check in was done in 10min. Cake delivered to the room delicious and cute ! Your bathtub and room view excellent ! Can you imagine being far from family,and on your birthday Westin gave the best service to you. I almost cry to received such great experience ! I will definitely come back !

title: The Westin Bed
desc: Stayed in the Westin Bali previously and I love the bed. Booked for 2 nights in Westin SG and I enjoyed my stay. The check in was amazing. 1 of the biggest in-shower bathroom I have stayed in SG hotels even though there was a bathtub. The only short coming of the stay was the room was opposite of the staff rooms. Opening and closing of the doors can be heard easily. Overall stay was good. Especially with the Marriott Bonvoy app. It's super convenient with the chat bot.

title: Exceptional Stay but Exceptionally Silly Excuse to Deny Bonvoy F&B Benefits
desc: I stayed at the Westin for three nights as a Marriott Bonvoy Gold on the Luminous rate. This is a fantastic property. The service extended by Associates was warm and professional. I was accommodated in a Grand Premier Room which offered a large work desk and two-seater sofa which made for a very productive work stay (these are rooms ending in x19). Views were unparalleled. Takeout from Cook & Brew was tasty and prompt. The sriracha wings and fries are excellent. The gym and steam room/jacuzzi are free to access and well-equipped. Breakfast at Seasonal Tastes is currently on a three-slot system due to the need to sanitize the area. This creates some problems if you want to have a working breakfast as the restaurant closes from 8.30am to 9.00am. However, staff were able to make

title: Delicious Food and Friendly Service
desc: This hotel has by far been very consistent in their food quality. Almost every dish in the menu is deserving of a praise. From mains like Singapore Style Lobster Fried Beehoon to snacks like Truffle Fries to Breakfast Scrambled Eggs. The chefs in the kitchen are definitely deserving of a Michelin award. Looking forward to more delicious food whipped up by Chef Glen and Chef Ivan! Kudos to Kiwon and his team for the awesome food experience which has also secured my re-visits. Thomas at Cook and Brew, Nui at the Lobby Lounge and Linda at Seasonal Treat have ensured that all guests are well looked after. Looking forward to my next visit already!

title: Staycation Just before Heightened Alert
desc: This was my first time staying at The Westin since it reopened at CBD area. The Premier room was spacious especially the bathroom and not much issue with the room. I love their infinity swimming pool and it was an indulgence to enjoy the surrounding views from the pool. However, I encountered an issue. The access to the pool was via the Spa reception area and the door can only be electronically opened by the staff. There was an occasion that I was not able to go back to the pool as there was no staff at the reception area. I waited for good 20 minutes before I called the operator for assistance to get someone to open it. Can understand the rationale of crowd control and temperature taking via this access and also the lean number of staff faced by the hotel at the moment but

title: Pleasant Experience!
desc: Stayed here at the start of the month and got the opportunity to be assisted by Charmein at the Front Desk. Despite the swift changes in the country’s ‘New Normal’ Charmein has meticulously explained the details and informations which made me enjoy my stay to the fullest!

title: Excellent food from Room Service
desc: Stayed at the Junior Suite for 2 nights and we had a pleasant stay. Despite being away from the main shopping area, the walk to Fullerton and Marina Bay Sands was not that bad. We also managed to go for a run around the Marina Bay Area as it was located within that vicinity. We ordered food from the room service menu, didn't have high hopes of good food but the food blew our minds. I got the name of the chef from the front desk, thank you Chef Glenn Cooper and team for the fabulous food. We also had dinner at Cook and Brew - good ambience and decent food and drinks - but I prefer the room service food. Pool was nice, didn't manage to go to the gym but a good stay overall.

title: No lounge, but were given credits for dinner
desc: Booked the Executive suite and was pleasantly surprised that we had an upgrade to the spacious Harbor View suite. The views were spectacular! Although the lounge was closed, we were given dining credits. The food @ Cook & Brew was delicious and it was a fantastic dinner date. Although the spa was closed, we had the opportunity to enjoy the facilities. Soaking in the whirlpool was indeed relaxing! Looking forward to returning back to Westin!

title: Decent staycation
desc: Had a 2-nights staycation over the Hari Raya holidays. The hotel lobby on 32nd floor was rather quiet and we got our room before 2p.m. The Premier room with city view was big and bright. The floor-to-ceiling window allowed lots of natural light shinning into the room. The bathroom was very big and spacious. Love soaking in the deep bathtub, and the water filled up the tub very quickly too. The highlight of our staycation was definitely the infinity pool on 35th floor. View from the pool wasn’t exactly spectacular as it was partially blocked by the surrounding office buildings. Nevertheless we still had a relaxing good time at the pool. Guests were able to make advance booking of pool time slots 48 hours prior to day of stay, 1.5 hours session per day. After the SafeEntry and

title: 5 star service
desc: Today is my first time to a wedding lunch in The Westin Sg. We love how the staff greeted us with a smile and guided us on temperature checking and TraceTogether. Very clear route and instructions from the staffs guiding us to our zone. The whole set up of the ballroom was so gorgeous! That whole different experience we had as compared to other hotel. The banquet was smooth. I would like to compliment a staff, Marcus Tan for paying attention to his guest. My napkin accidentally dropped on the floor and I left it on the side of the table after picking up. Almost within 1 min, he suddenly approached with a new napkin for me. I was amaze with his attentiveness. Next, my Chinese tea was cold from the air con. I informed him and he had a hot tea replaced for me and using the

title: Delightful banquet experience!
desc: Held our wedding banquet at The Westin and it was a splendid experience! Our liason manager - Yan Hui was superb and very proactive in ensuring the event details were sorted out prior to the AD. The same can be said for our banquet managers Ken and Raymond who were everywhere on the AD and made sure we were very well taken care of. Before deciding on The Westin, we had some reservations about the banquet menu. However, it was totally unfounded as our guests were raving about the food and the red wine. We did encounter some minor hiccups in our stay, but it's understandable given the tight schedule the hotel had to work with, having just reopened to public stay a few days prior. I'm sure it will only improve from here. Would definitely recommend!

title: It was a definite worth the money.
desc: Service rendered was great. There was almost zero waiting time for check-in. The room was clean and cozy. The bed was so good. The team sent a very delicious Burnt Cheesecake up in celebration of our wedding anniversary. The only downside was parking was far. The building may not be Westin’s but it was ghost empty. It doesn’t hurt to let us part in the building.

title: Could have been better
desc: Have been using this hotel frequently pre-pandemic days and am a Ambassador Elite member. Have always had a nice room upgrade before but this time no such thing. I had the normal size room. If they claim its a room with a view upgrade then I beg to differ. Who stays in a room for a long period just for the view? Personally would have preferred a bigger room. Was there for only 2 nights, surely this would have been possible. Loyalty to this hotel doesn't count for much. I had emailed them before arrival that housekeeping was not necessary and that all they needed to do was to ensure that enough towels/amenities were available for the 2 nights. Well, did not happen in spite of assurances. Somehow there is a feeling of slipping standards overall. The members Lounge

title: My favourite hotel in Singapore
desc: The Westin Singapore always my first choice for short staycation. Nice hotel design with high floor view, Room service food was good and delicious, special highlight staff fr Front desk Irish Joy and Haziq. Both of them are friendly when doing the check-in process, and give some recommendation during my stay period. Pool, gym and spa located at Level 35, all facilities well maintain and guide by Eddie. He friendly and always feel welcome when we using the facilities at all the time. Room always feel clean and tidy, love the big bed, and the huge bathtub. That is a point to bring me back in Westin also.Will always comeback here!!!

title: Recommended, is managing Covid issues well.
desc: This is my first time at the Westin as my preferred hotel (Marriott Tang Plaza) is currently closed. I was concerned that the location would not be ideal but this turned out not to be a problem. A short walk to either Downtown or Marina Bay MRT stations (though not entirely covered) and this will improve when Shenton Way MRT station opens right by the hotel entrance, and that will provide covered access to Marina Bay MRT. For dining, Lou Pa Sat and its Satay street is a short walk and there are several other restaurants locally that mainly cater to the weekday office workers. In the Westin itself breakfast buffet is currently closed (Covid-19) and replaced by a choice of local or western breakfast which I found to be limited but reasonable. Service was inconsistent at

title: What a great service!
desc: We came here for a short staycation. Of course we knew Westin standards are usually good, but here there is an additional aspect. THE service. And I put the in capital letters for a reason: ALL the staff has been amazingly professional (have been working in F&B for 20+ years, so I promise you, I can see it) , courteous to the max and really caring. I mean: EVERY single one of them. Food served is also excellent: we had a variety of breakfasts and none of them disappointed. I really cannot find any fault. So, in a nutshell: even if this hotel mainly caters for business, it is also good for a short staycation (stone's throw from Chinatown) with a relaxing atmosphere, and great food. Kudos to all the staff!

title: Excellent Stay with Outstanding Cook & Brew Experiences
desc: Stayed at the Westin Singapore in Feb 2022 for three nights as a Bonvoy Plat on a Luminous rate. I was accommodated in an upgraded corner room -- these were previously called Grand Premier Rooms and are now called Larger Guest Rooms. In the absence of an open Club Lounge, the property offered $100 in F&B credit per night. The property made good on its previous assurance to clearly indicate that the Afternoon Tea set was not eligible for the Marriott Bonvoy restaurant discount. Service during my stay was stellar and the continuation of turndown service reflected that the property was not cutting amenities on the basis of COVID theatre. I noticed one cut back, which was the replacement of TWG tea with Dilmah tea -- this wasn't the end of the world, given that TWG was available at

title: Enjoyable great services!
desc: My partner came for business purposes while me just enjoying the ambience and great services! We stayed from 09th - 11th March. Room was clean and dust free. From the desk to express / in room services everything was smooth. I would like to highlight few names who did a great job ( Sorry for the spelling though ) Nursuryanie ( Front Desk ) - She did my checked in very fast and friendly. Huda ( Express Service) - Was very genuine and friendly too! I asked many questions about the in room services for dinner and she recommended me the best dessert- Oreo Cheesecake ( I hope you enjoy yours ;) Jasmine ( Express Service ) Very soft spoken! I had a great start of the day when I ordered our breakfast and heard her soothing voice taking our order. And Rakhi / Rathi who sent my

title: Another 3-night staycay to revisit Westin
desc: Came back for a 3-night staycay because I missed the first world problem of having to think about how to spend the dining credit loot. 🤣 Their Suites are still closed but reservations kindly accommodated my request for the infamous stack 19 - yays! That double panel view still rocks! 🙆‍♀️ The room remains one of my favorites with its spacious layout, immaculate cleanliness, and but of course those White Tea toiletries. 🥶 With $100 daily dining credit + Hotelux’s usd100, it was once again time to obsess about how and where to spend it. Cook & Brew won in the end, with in-room dining quality rather dire. Also not quite up to mark was breakfast quality - selection have reduced and sadly was not something I find myself wanting to take up early for. 🎭 What was new this time

title: Very memorable stay
desc: Since the first impressions I have stepped into the hotel to check in and walked into my room, every service and facilities were looking very luxury which I have never expected for the Westin brand. Very beautiful views of city and harbour from the room as well as the swimming pool and lobby as the hotel is located in the higher floors on the iconic tall building. I had good rest and good luxury experience with this amazing hotel.

title: Cozy room with nice port view
desc: Had a great birthday celebration for my husband. Room was ready at 11am and check in by Fiona was efficient and professionally done. Welcome amenity and small birthday cake were already ready in. Facilities like pool, gym and spa located at level 35 are great and have good views of the CBD areas. Breakfast at Seasonal taste comes in set, although less variety but portion are big n taste great. Staffs there are friendly and efficient.

title: Unacceptable QC
desc: Usually I can tolerate to a degree of poor housekeeping QC but from a hotel. But for one that is priced at a premium, this level of ignorance is not acceptable. Detached curtain rail, broken shower head grip, water leaking out of shower, vomit marks on toilet floor and a nasty stain on the lounge chair. All of these in one single room.

title: Great Check-in Experiemce
desc: Friendly welcome after a long flight. Haziq was great and arranged a fantastic room overlooking the marina and swimming pool. Loved the Thai Tom Yum Peanuts in the room - thank you Fiona. The Westin is right in the heart of the business district. Great location for meetings, leisure and a true feel of everything Singapore has to offer. Highly recommend.

title: Bad experience - Cook & Brew
desc: Went for my birthday dinner at Cook & Bew Westin. It turned out to be quite embarrassing. The staff was extremely slow in service ...One of the people from the staff attending had very less idea even on the menu...To make matters worse, they got us the cheque before we could even order dessert. Awful experience simply not expected from Westin...Won't recommend

title: Still getting their act together following the pandemic
desc: Did a 3-night staycation for the first time here. Overall alright, but in some areas they might still be trying to recover from the pandemic, and are not totally ready yet. The positives: - Excellent service levels all around. This applies to pretty much almost every one of their service staff we encountered during the visit, including the security personnel on the ground floor, and the housekeeping staff. The people at Seasonal Tastes were exceptional. - Room was spacious, comfortable, and generally well-maintained. Wish we got a room with a better view though. - Relatively uncrowded over the long weekend, which is great for a peaceful break with the family. The not-so-positives: - Only one parking pass per stay, regardless of number of nights. We had to leave the car behind

title: Good Business Hotel. Not worth the price.
desc: I stayed at The Westin on a business trip and frankly found the hotel to be very over priced for the facilities & hospitality. Since my office was in the business district, the location was perfect, however if you are on holiday, I would not suggest this location. There was absolutely nothing wrong in the hotel, but nothing that wowed me either.

title: One of the finest 5-stars in Singapore
desc: The Westin Singapore is probably one of the finest hotels in the business district that is superly managed and perfect for vacation as well as for business. From check-in to checkout, everything was excellent. The staff and amenities were top notch. They went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. I would like to thank the amazing Tiha Aljunied, manager at food and beverage (she deserves a big raise), ever-hardworking and smiling Nui at the lobby bar, Miguel, Irish and Haziq at the front desk, Eddy at the pool and spa and David at the ground floor lobby for all their professionalism, kindness and care that made our stay memorable. The hotel infinity pool is beautiful, the lobby is huge and classy with a bar that serves Afternoon Tea and the restaurants, Cook and Brew

title: Great place to stay in Singapore
desc: We had an amazing stay at this Marriott property in the downtown area of Singapore. The hotel was close to everything including Marina bay and the downtown MRT station. I can’t say enough about the staff at this hotel. They went over and above to make our stay enjoyable. Everyone was so polite and helpful. Special shout out to Mr. Eddy in the fitness area and Fiona at the front desk who both went over and above our expectations. Food was very good at the Cook and Brew as well as the Seasonal Tastes. Highly recommend this property.

title: Beautiful hotel
desc: Beautiful hotel with lovely rooms. The service was exceptional and we enjoyed the pool also. We were upgraded to a very spacious room with a view of the harbor. Walking distance to many restaurants also which is very nice. We highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again on our next visit to Singapore.

title: The fire test causes permanent hearing damage
desc: The hotel delivered a warning letter which stated guested did not have to participate in the fire drill. What they did not say was that the fire alarm would constantly ring for over 30 minutes. By the time I reached someone to check the length of the alarm it was too late to leave the building and escape. In hindsight the hotel should tell all guests they need to participate in the evacuation in order to remain safe and not be inflicted by permanent hearing damage.

title: Great “happy hour” alternative amidst COVID-19
desc: We made a spontaneous booking for 2 nights before my flight out just to relax, and it was a really great decision because the hotel is pretty quiet. Didn’t seem like a large volume of traffic and definitely not many tourists in the area, so our stay was very private and tranquil. Our room is quite quirky in terms of shape. There’s this long narrow hallway leading into the bathroom which was separate from the bedroom. It’s nice to have the bathroom separate, and because the room is hidden way inside, our room is extremely quiet which is nice to ensure quality of sleep. In fact it’s so hidden in and quiet that we could hardly hear the doorbell ring. The two panels of 90-degrees view in our bedroom ensured we’re in a good mood with a good view every morning we wake up. But I feel

title: Terrible ! Will never stay again
desc: Very poorly planned hotel. The rooms are dated and have bad interiors. The hotel has hardly any views. Had the most horrible experience at breakfast. Not expected from Westin, especially at this price level ! Very limited breakfast choice with terrible service. With the limited choice and the long time they take, they still short change you with your orders. Breakfast area was dirty although there were hardly any people. Would never stay here again. There are better choices in Singapore for this price range. I am a Marriott Titanium Elite member

title: Excellent Downtown Stay at The Westin
desc: Excellent stay at the Westin in Singapore. Staff were great, cocktails, food and drink was very good. The breakfast buffet is up there with the best Westin breakfasts. My family and I really enjoyed the rooftop pool area and the view. Location was fine near to Downtown. Only a 5mins walk to the Lau Pa Sat, Hawker Food Centre. MRT stations were very close. We actually walked to the Gardens on the Bay, only 20mins or so. The Exec Lounge was closed when we came but the hotel provided a F&B credit which we fully used. Would recommned and return.

title: Amazing Hotel and Perfect Service
desc: We love Singapore and loved staying at the Westin Singspore. The hotel is beautiful and spotless clean. The breakfast buffet was excellent, and the view from our room was amazing. We loved looking out into the endless harbor and the infinity edge pool was beyond words. A very special thanks to Miguel at the fromt desk for taking the time to explain all of the sights in Singapore. His knowledge and kind advice truly made our stay so unforgettable. Loved the Westin!

title: Peace in the city
desc: We thoroughly enjoyed our staycation at The Westin Singapore. Upon check-in, we were waemly welcomed by Miguel who assisted us with the registration. He was efficient and patiently explained the inclusions and facilities in the hotel. The room was spacious and clean with floor to ceiling glass windows overlooking the ocean. At turndown, we were delighted to receive some chocolate amenities. We enjoyed the rooftop swimming pool and the jacuzzi. The housekeeping and counter attendants were polite and always ready to assist. Dinner at Cook & Brew was great with interesting cocktails to accompany the delicious food. Overall a great experience and will definitely be back!

title: Wonderful service was provided by Haziq
desc: Thanks to Haziq, he was friendly and nice during the check in process. Able to see that, he was clam at the desk! Thumb up to him. Late check out was given too! Thank You!🫶🏻. If there’s chance, would head back again for another round of stayca

title: No halal food.
desc: Stayed for two nights. Poor check inn experience. Was promised a water view room, given a city view room. There was no bidet in the toilet. No direction of Makkah in the room. Shockingly there was no halal options at all in the breakfast Buffett. Clearly Muslim guests needs have not been provided for.

title: Awesome Westin
desc: I booked through Marriott website, easy process on checking in. I got an early check in and I was lucky to be welcomed by Joe Wok and be was exceptional. This Westin really values your Marriott status. The room exceptional, great location, super clean, awesome breakfast. Great awesome place to stay in Singapore.

title: Avoid.
desc: Changed two rooms, first one with toilet smell that you experienced when the exhaust pipes are blocked. Second room was just faeces smell. Found this notice at the entrance of the bathroom. Quickly checkout as I don’t want to get Covid. Avoid.

title: Great hardware, but could do better in other departments. Average value for the money.
desc: The hotel is located in the office complex where my regional office is located so extremely convenient. Despite using my company's corporate code, I found that the reception was parsimonious with upgrades. A higher floor of the same class of room was the only upgrade offered despite high volumes from my corp account and platinum status. Also, the club lounge is still closed. Last time I stayed at the JWM South Beach in Q3, their lounge was already open. Westin not keeping their lounge open in the F1 week seems a pure cost-based decision as rates are through the roof. The breakfast staff is lovely - service at seasonal tastes was thoughtful. The food however seems to be perfunctory; a collection of the continental standards, none of them done exceptionally. The laksa

title: Good hardware and not high class service
desc: Chose this hotel for a birthday celebration. The check-in was very cold, very formal. The same with check-out - just “pay and go” 🙃 Got a room upgrade as Titanium Elite, thanks for that. Large room with partial water view, stylish In honor of my birthday, a mini-dessert with a piece of paper "happy wedding anniversary" was brought to the room... Really? Is there no difference between bday and wedding anniversary? )) and this was a vivid manifestation of the staff attitude to the hotel guests: no one cares a lot. They just do things somehow. The breakfast was good, with wide variety of food, but the cleaning of the tables was slow. I had to go around the whole hall twice to find a table without dirty dishes on it. You don't feel welcome here. Hospitality and friendliness

title: Urban Chic and the hotel staff embrace humanity and the environment.
desc: I am a sustainability promoter and am certainly impressed with the LEED and BCA GreenMark Platinum Award in choosing my conference venue. The friendly staff like Clara Beh, Yilin Ang, and Agnes Chong made a difference in planning and delivery. The precinct skyline of Marina Bay greeted my customers during my networking event. The humanistic touch of hiring retrenched employees living up to improve Singapore’s social mobility. Anthony Constantine Tan Head of Marketing and Communication, Kongsberg Maritime Health & Safety Engineering Technical Committee Chairperson Action for Alliance for Lower Wage Workers – Alpha Award Lead

title: Compliments regarding our stay
desc: Dear Team, Good morning! I am writing this email to just express our thanks for the Westin Team for taking good care of Stacia & I. Please send our thanks to Fiona for taking great care of our Check in/out experience. And proactively offering Late Check-out. And also Gayathri for liaising our pre-arrival stay. Please also send our thanks to Chef Kelly/Sherlyn (my RCMS colleagues) for arranging the amenities for us. Breakfast super huge spread! Love it! Cook & Brew Love their Hawker Burger, Thai wings, view! Stacia & I felt that our stay was Peaceful (due to long PH weekend so no one around the cbd area), & well thought of bathroom/bedside amenities. Wishing the Westin Team all the very best & hope to come back one day again. Yours sincerely, Javier Chang & Stacia

title: Nice standard luxury hotel but lacks service
desc: This hotel is located in a high-rise building that is part of an office complex and given its location, it is definitely targeting business travelers and there is nothing wrong with that. However, it certainly lacks the soft touches or services that you would expect from a luxury hotel. The hardware is great because it's a relatively new hotel and has an amazing view of the water, as well as hundreds of ships entering and leaving Singapore. You can enjoy these views from the floor-to-ceiling windows in the breakfast restaurant, lobby or room depending on which way it faces. The standard room (I did not get upgraded even though I am an Ambassador Member) is also very spacious for Singapore. I was quite impressed with the space and high ceiling. However, as some other reviews

title: Westin Singapore : excellent stay
desc: Stayed at The Westin Singapore for business Oct 17 to Oct 19. Refreshed under the stewardship of new General Manager, James Walkden, my stay at the Westin was excellent. The hotel is centrally located in the Marina Bay district and the lobby definitely gives you a sense of occasion upon entry. I stayed in a junior suite which was spacious and luxurious with lots of natural light - there was nothing junior about it at all – ample room to both work (reliable high speed internet, good sized desk) and rest (beds at Marriott properties are always large and comfortable, and included a separate lounge area in my suite). Well insulated, didn’t hear any noise from adjoining rooms at all. Housekeeping was thorough and with nice touches like complimentary chocolates and snacks. Service

title: Like a second home
desc: I stayed in November 2022 one week for business at the Westin Singapore. The team and also the general manager himself made me feel like home and tried to make my stay as convenient as possible. I liked the pool and the gym on the 35th floor. Everything is perfectly equipped and contemporary standard. The lobby bar is really a place at every time of the day to work, to recover and to just have a break. The food is amazing. And also the lobby bar team is awesome and make you feel like coming home.

title: Great Stay!
desc: We had a great 2 days at this hotel located centrally in the main business district as well as close to the nightspots. Very comfortable rooms and the staff are extremely polite, efficient and professional. And I mean each and every staff we came across, starting with the lady who helped with our check in (don’t remember name but wears glasses), Nui at the 32nd floor bar, and the hardworking staff at breakfast who made our breakfasts so enjoyable. There was one incident at the end of our trip which was annoying but does not take anything from our excellent experience. Having lived in Singapore 10 years ago, we should have known but didn’t realize. We asked the concierge for a taxi to the airport which he did. But as soon as the taxi had gone about 100m, we noticed that the

title: Not for families and if you don’t like breakfast que..
desc: We checked in around 21:30, took them 30 min to finish the process and give us room keys. The hotel location is in the middle of the business district, it has great views of the port and it’s walking distance to the MBS area and to the city center. The rooms are quite small. With very poor bathrooms design. Each and every shower water are leaking out and it’s getting all slippery. We got connected rooms and you can’t keep the doors open, they add a spring that pull the doors back and it’s so difficult for kids to open the door. If a connection door opens so you can’t go in the room.. not smart design. The breakfast is great, lots of variety, but every morning you need to stand at least 5 minutes in the que because they don’t have enough staff to get you seated even though

title: Great Hotel with a Price Tag to Match
desc: This was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Staff were super attentive and detailed. Extremely friendly and always there to lend a helping hand. The rooms themselves were immaculate. Large and spacious and the bathroom was massive for its size. The room was extremely clean and modern and was in working order. All in all a great stay during my few days in Singapore during November and would recommend to others just be aware of the price tag you are paying for this hotel is at quite the premium but if you can afford it, it is well worth the price.

title: Cockroach in room
desc: We found a cockroach crawling on the walls of the bathroom as soon as we arrived. We were shocked to find this in a 5-star hotel in Singapore. My wife was luckily able to trap it in a cup when it dropped down to the sink. The operator was unhelpful when we called; she seemed lost as to how to respond, and at first suggested just calling housekeeping (is this a common occurrence?) I had to explicitly ask to move to another room, which she couldn't promise and told us she'd call back. I never received the callback, so ended up needing to go to the front desk. The room & hotel was otherwise beautiful, but we were disappointed by the cockroach and the unhelpful response. Avoid. We'll be staying somewhere else next time we are in Singapore.

title: Impeccable Stay at The Westin SG
desc: The hotel situated in the heart of Shenton CBD but surrounded by MRT stations (Shenton Way and Downtown) and Bus station. Upon arrival the 1st query I posed to the concierge is how old the hotel is and I understand it is 9 years old. The hotel has rooms viewing the main pool with Marina bay and contemporary artisan CBD buildings, both are great views. Room size is considered large compared to other hotels in Singapore. What stunned me are that the rooms gives the feel of fresh rejoiced ambience, all the highend furnishings are perfectly well maintained, I can't find any tarnish signs of worn. The amenities are all good and on top of that the service from the house keeper is top notch, as all my needs arrived at my door less than 5 minutes, credit to the phone-operator, the

title: My most favorite Hotel in Marriott.
desc: Staff is very friendly and they go out of their way to help you. Rooms are large, clean and very functional while still being stylish. Breakfast buffet is absolutely awesome with the actual Hotel Chef cooking your breakfast omelette! The hotel was fully booked, still reception managed to give me an upgrade (Bonvoy status). Also got a personal, handwritten message from the General Manager. That doesn’t happen very often, so big thank you. All in all: if you’re staying in Singapore, I feel the Westin is the Hotel to book. You won’t regret it

title: Great hotel! Will return!
desc: Excellent hotel stay! Very accommodating staff and the concierge level perks were great! The spread at the club level every morning and evebing was well worth the price! Good location with the MRT station right outside and LAU PA SAT dangerously close!! LOL! We really enjoyed our stay!

title: Great hospitality and beautiful property
desc: Amazing experience made even more special by their GM, Mr. James Walkden. We really enjoyed our stay at the Westin. It’s a beautiful property and is centrally located. We really liked the overall hospitality, cleanliness and prompt service. The checkin line was a little longer but Mr. Walkden was standing there and helping guests himself. We were celebrating our 10 year anniversary and when he got to know it, he made it special by sending chocolates, champagne and cake.

title: Great Sevice
desc: Beautiful hotel located in Singapore’s business district. A food court, restaurants, and bars featuring many exciting cuisines can be found within the same building complex. A hawker center called Lau Pa Sat Festival Pavillion is within walking distance too. Spacious room and bathroom. We were treated with complimentary chocolates nightly, bottled water replenished nightly, turndown service available, and bathroom amenities replenished when used. Very courteous staff, even helping us mail a letter to Dublin! Thank you to the concierge desk. Also, note mentioning Debbie Garcia of Cook and Brew! We spent many hours there unwinding after a day of walking and even spent our New Year’s eve dinner and celebration there. Their service was top-notch.

title: Most Festive Stay since Pandemic
desc: This stay marks as my first overseas trip since pandemic and with backdrop being Christmas, it was the most important stay of the year and I wanted everything to be as festive as ever. Surprisingly, The Westin Singapore did deliver on all my expectations and diva demands 😂 The food at the club lounge was very good and very generous. The service from most of the staffs are good especially Yaini who made sure that this stay was a memorable stay for me. The only downside I’d say is that during my visit, they seem to be understaffed due to the long holiday which created a little problem with concierge service which went a bit subpar. However, it’s not as bad as I’ve encountered at The St. Regis Shanghai so I digress. But yes, it’d be nice if the concierge here has more manpower

title: Excellent Location
desc: Good location and easy walk to most of Singapore's attractions. Rooms were large and lots of natural light. The food at the restaurants was also great although expensive...but so is everything in Singapore. Staff friendly and helpful, would stay here again

title: Buffet&Bar
desc: Westin is amazing，Meal worth revisiting。 The meal is very worth visiting again, the environment is beautiful, there are very good red wine, fresh seafood and very considerate service, the high-altitude bar is also very professional, you can visit their classic bartending, and the environment is relaxing, really very recommend 非常值得再回訪的餐點，環境優美，有很不錯的紅酒，新鮮的海鮮及非常貼心的服務，高空酒吧也非常專業，可以來造訪他們的經典調酒，以及環境讓人放鬆，真的非常推薦

title: Good stay, however definitely could have been better
desc: Firstly the modern rooms and facilities were excellent. My overall stay at the Westin Singapore was very enjoyable. Positives: Very new, modern design room Great swimming pool, infinity pool overlooking Singapore City The location of the hotel is excellent Design of the hotel is very nice Negatives: I found the gym / fitness centre pretty disappointing. Pretty small in design and free weights in a bad location (corner). Would be great if you could arrange a bigger area for gym Both nights during my stay, the lounge was disappointing. There was no glasses or cutlery at one point. 90% of the dishes were seafood related (both identical main dishes both nights). If you don't eat seafood, like myself you would be left disappointed. The lounge also feels like a meeting area space

title: Great for families especially with status
desc: Hays off to James and Miguel for doing g their best to accommodate us during Chinese new years. They ultimately couldn't make it work but not for lack of trying. We spent 7 nights here at the westin and it was wonderful. Spacious rooms with enough space for a family of 4. My daughter loved the breakfast each day and the pool as well. Only minor complaint is the lack of snacks during the day in the lounge. Next time we are in singapore, we are definitely booking here again.

title: Fantastic accommodation and service
desc: Our room was stunning with an enormous bathroom and views overlooking the bay. Luxurious and spotlessly clean. Staff were exceptional and welcoming -our check in was easy and seamless. Breakfast was excellent value, with a large variety of foods and offerings. Situated within walking distance of retail and food outlets we would recommend The Westin Singapore to travellers and business people who want the benefits of comfort and location

title: Nice rooms, comfortable beds, good food.
desc: We had to stay another night in Singapore last January 1 because of an issue at the Manila airport. I quickly booked at the Westin using my Bonvoy app because we were so tired and I wanted a nice room with comfortable beds, so I reserved last minute at the Westin. We were a group of 3, so I was expecting that there would be an extra rollaway bed for my daughter, but when we got to the hotel, they told me that they could not provide me with one in spite of the fact that I booked a room for 3 adults. They instead gave me a bigger room with a couch and food allowance, I guess to compensate for not having a rollaway bed. Except for that issue, we had a very comfortable stay at the hotel. The food was good too.

title: nice ambience nice experience
desc: had dinner at seasonal tastes and then decided to have drinks at Cook & Brew. served by Franz & Marlou ~ great service! Franz even noticed that it was a birthday celebration and served a slice of cake to our table! such a nice gesture! they even help to serve the cake we brought! thanks so much! nice cocktail drinks except wine wasn’t that great! overall very nice experience! will definitely go there again’

title: Singapore First Timer
desc: I would highly recommend the Westin Singapore for for a stay whether it is for business or pleasure. First of all service was outstanding, prompt, and done with a smile! Our room was impeccable with great views and the food wonderful. Gabriel in the Club Lounge was top notch and provided some outstanding tips for our visit in addition to some great service. The hotel is in a great location for getting around the city as it is right across the street from the Shenton Way MRT station, a couple blocks from Lau Pa Sat food center, and a short walk to the Marina Bay Promenade. We miss The Westin Singapore and would do it again!

title: Excellent Hotel!
desc: Great hotel for our first Singapore trip. Location was excellent within walking distance to the hotspots and surrounded by 3 MRT to take you anywhere. Staff was very nice and helpful. Was upgraded to Club with lounge access. Beautiful hotel, would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone.

title: Compliment
desc: Dear General Manager, I would like to give a good compliment to one of your hotel staff, Mr. David Chan. Two weeks ago, when I was at the level 1 lobby, David helped to book a taxi on his cellphone and also assist my luggage as I was rushing to the airport. During that time, the level 1 counter was busy with other guests. David is indeed very alert, helpful and approachable when guests need help at the lobby. He is an ambassador for Westin. Yours Sincerely, Peter Tan

title: Very good hardware
desc: Booked via HoteLux on Luminous Exclusive Rate, with complimentary breakfast, 100 USD hotel credits and welcome amenities. Emailed property informing this is for a birthday staycation and staff mentioned a slice of cake will be arranged. I have also reached out via chat about being informed if early check in can be granted, although never received any confirmation. On day of check-in, I arrived at 1 pm to an empty lobby. Magnificent views and posh lobby. Check in process was just business-like and makes me feel the staff has other better things to do. Assigned a mid-level King room on the 43rd floor which is an upgrade from the base room booked, as per the HoteLux package. The room is well-appointed and solid, just like the rest of the property “hardware”. Can only spot a

title: Amazing
desc: Great service, great bartender Marlou!! Had a pleasant experience. Good ambience and food was very tasty. Drinks were really good as well! Will definitely go back again for more drinks and bar snacks. Heard good reviews about the main dishes and would like to try some.

title: Very disappointed staycation and Birthday celebration
desc: Waste time for customer to arrange Staff don't care reasonable request and no feedback even complains #1 Email communicate to the hotel staff at least 4 days for a) Children Amenity arrangement and flower delivery arrangement The front desk staff / Reservation staff confirmed by email. But have to repeat again and even remind to the Front staff during check in. The replied to you but without any arrangement. If the Hotel cannot arrange Child Amenity and cannot help to deliver the flower to the room, they should tell in advance but not like they confirmed the request but nothing happens. #2 when Booking the restaurant tables for buffet , already mentioned this is for my family members birthday. During the dinner , many tables they are arranged birthday cake for them.

title: Exceptional service!
desc: Everyone from the ground floor concierge to the staff at the spa were exceptional representatives of the Westin. Our room was well maintained, well equipped and I had the best night's sleep on the ultra soft, cushy bed. Also a special shout out to Eunice at the spa. Not only did the hotel staff help accomodate a late check out for us, they seamlessly held into our luggage until late in the evening. Eunice took the extra step to stay late after her shift so my husband and I could use the shower facilities before our flight late at night. We are so grateful for her kindness!

title: Great Place
desc: Great Staff, Nice Rooms. We were only here for one night, but we really enjoyed our time here. The breakfast buffet is excellent, lots of choices. Only issue I had is the gluten free bread section is mixed with the regular breads. So potential for cross contamination.

title: Birthday staycation
desc: Westin Singapore Had a wonderful birthday staycation for son. We booked a double twin beds for 4 pax. Was pleasantly surprised that the team prepared a cute plush toy from Jellycat London. Received complimentary birthday cake, chocolate and nuts. Room was modern and spacious. Heavenly beds are comfortable. The jacuzzi and steam room are open to all hotel guests. No reservation needed. Was disappointed that young adults under 18 are not allowed to go in. Swimming pool has this infinity vibe which is very popular for 📸 Overall a very memorable and fun stay for us. Thank you Westin Singapore.

title: Fantastic hotel
desc: We stayed one night in a Guest room on the 40th floor and were amazed by the floor to ceiling view of the city skyline from both the room and the bathroom. Very spacious and beautifully furnished. Staff were polite and courteous. Highly recommended.

title: Pleasant Stay but spoilt by poor water pressure
desc: Overall, a pleasant stay. The water pressure in room 4317 is no good. Called the technician and eventually had to shift to another room 4311. The water pressure in this room is only slightly better. By then, this process of waiting for technician to check on water pressure and the shifting of room had caused me a lot of inconvenience. I had stayed in this hotel several times and this is a isolated incident. But considering the price of the room, I find this to be unacceptable. I hope the hotel will conduct regular check so that other guests will not be inconvenienced.

title: Great hotel in Singapore
desc: Stayed for 4 nights. Location is great, right across the street from the subway station. Hotel lobby is on the 32 ND floor which is odd. We had a fantastic stay, and enjoyed the room, restaurant, club lounge, and the gym facilities. Great service as well. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Good hotel
desc: It is a very nice hotel. It is comfortable and clean. The staff is friendly. The location is good, close to things and a lot of food in the area. The bed and room was very comfortable. The business lounge was nice. The pool was nice looking but does not have a hot tub. The breakfast was very good.

title: Birthday Celebrations
desc: The place is awesome. Good variety of food selection. Most importantly is the food quality is the best. Friendly and approachable staff makes me feel like comfortable. Definitely, come back with my family again.

title: Excellent Customer Service
desc: I had the privilege of dining at the Seasonal Tastes outlet in Marriot Hotel today [17 Feb]. I was pleasantly surprised. Having spent 40 years in SIA as a cabin crew and retired recently at as an Inflight Manager, I have a keen eye for service excellence. I can discern a genuine effort to please customers by persons in the service and food industry. I would like to compliment the following staff: - Tina Aljunid - Rahayu & Sharon Ms Aljunid remembered me from my advanced reservations booking as it included special requests. She was very professional, and yet warm and approachable to not only to me, but my entourage of 5. She checked in periodically on our well being and asked whether the lunch buffet met our expectations. She attended to her other guests in the same

title: Class act
desc: Great hotel with equally great service. Rooms are spacious and the amenities were particularly appreciated since our luggage was lost…got us through without having to buy much. Breakfast was fantastic. Large buffet with impressive selection including a fresh juice bar. Really enjoyed our stay.

title: Great ambience and prompt service
desc: The buffet ambience is very warm and vibrant. Food prepared is also very savoury and delicious. Service was prompt and service staff was very helpful and receptive of additional favours. Would highly recommend this place!

title: Love the Westin!
desc: Second stay at the Westin and REALLY hope to make a third very soon! We love this hotel. Having stayed in many lovely places in Singapore, the Westin just scores on so many points. Firstly we were off the red eye London flight and arrived at the hotel at 8am... and we were in our room at 9am having been given coffee in the lobby by the brilliant team member on the front desk! That is just lovely service and was so appreciated. We had a lovely lunch in the restaurant with friends, the service and food was great. We spent the next morning hanging by the lovely pool - no problem getting a sunbed at all. After going into the city we came back to the lovely pool with the most fantastic views. I used the gym twice which is really well equipped with new machines. Our room was

title: Outstanding Stay at Westin Singapore
desc: What an outstanding hotel in all regards: -Location is just a couple blocks from Las Pa Sat, and three MRT stations in easy walk distance, one right under the hotel. Nice views from the hotel of the bay and the Malacca Strait -Rooms are quite modern and spacious, Easy light and curtain controls, AC keeps the room nice and cool -Bath is large, beautiful, small WC and large shower with overhead shower or wall shower, and very easy controls to use -Pool on level 35 is great and rarely crowded, nice deck to sit on even if you dont want to jump in the pool -Staff has been very helpful with details and reservations -Restaurant really exceeded all expectations for a hotel restaurant, large buffet with boundless choices of Asian and western favorites with an asian twist -Quiet,

title: Excellent
desc: I got a massage with Pat. She was excellent. Really catered to my needs and made sure I was comfortable. I have had massages in many places in Singapore but this was by far one of the best massages thanks to pat.

title: Out of The World Experience at Cook & Brew
desc: I enjoyed an amazing dinner at Cook&Brew served by Marlou, Saravanan, Ricci and Jack. They frequently checked in on me and were very proactive to ensure that my dining experience was great. Even the bartender Marlou came by to check in on me to ask how were the drinks and my dining experience. They were very patient even though I had several requests. For the starters, I ordered the whipped buffalo ricotta bread and for the mains, the beef pot roast as recommended by Ricci to pair it together with the Merlot. I highly recommend the beef pot roast. The beef chunks were cooked to perfection. It was so soft and it MELTS in your mouth. It's an explosion of flavour. I truly enjoyed this dish. For dessert, Saravanan recommended Bailey's Tiramisu after learning about my food

title: Cook & Brew Restaurant
desc: The cook & brew restaurant of westin hotel serves awesome food. Loved the brocolli & ricotta cheese & bread . Staffs were friendly, polite n kept checking in on us. Highly recommend the hotel & restaurant. Lovely experience

title: Dinner Buffet
desc: Food is generally good. There are lots of meat cuts such as beef slices, char siew, chicken, pork belly, lamb. There are also quite a few good seafood selection, especially fresh sashimi and oyster. But food selection and dessert can be improved. Meat cuts such as lamb and chicken could be softer and more tender

title: Good ambience and approchable staff
desc: Ambience is perfect, food are average. Attendant named debbie of cook&brew is very accommodating for our requests. Its my birthday and she give us time to ask if everything is alright. Keep it up the good work. Its nice to have a great service,we highly recommended here. Thanks a lot.

title: Nice experience in The Westin
desc: The service and the environment are both nice~ Especially the staffs named Charlie & Wayson! And the food is also good. Fresh seafood, roasted beef ,and pasta aglio! Thanks for the hard-working and everything.

title: Great spa experience
desc: Jennifer Peres at Heavenly was phenomenal. Extremely high quality service. Thoroughly amazing experience. Appreciated her brilliant massage skills but also her sharing valuable tips on wellness. 10/10.

title: Great food … Great ambience
desc: Seasonal taste restaurant at Westin Hotel is great! Atmosphere is chill and cool and the staff is also really friendly. They know what they’re doing and what they’re talking about, and you can tell making the customers happy is their main priority. Food is pretty good, some seafood and some twists, and for their prices it’s 100% worth it.It’s a great experience.

title: Kudos to Westin Singapore
desc: Loved my stay. Being Titanium level I was upgraded to Corner King room overseeing the bay and the city. Breakfast is excellent and daily snacks at lounge was great variety to choose from. Staff is always so attentive no matter where you are. I lived the spa treatment and the staff is accommodating and excellent massages . Will definitely stay here again . These are the staff that should get kudos: Matra and Davina at the spa, Jake and Gabby at lounge, Audrey at breakfast buffet.

title: No benefits at all
desc: My husband is a lifetime platinum member of Bonvoy Elite and we can totally understand that we didn't get a room upgrade because of a lot of guests. Having said that we were a bit disappointed when we found out that we were assigned a room with no ocean view. And besides we think the food they offered at the club lounge & restaurant had a bit lower quality than we expected.

title: Cook and Brew
desc: The Cook and Brew restaurant at 33th floor has great food and view. Service is exceptional. Their burger was meticulously cooked to the perfection. When you go there ask for Debbie. She did an outstanding job serving the table

title: Awesome dining experience in Level 33 Cook and Brew
desc: Awesome service by Debbie and Marlou from Cook and Brew located at Level 33 The Westin. They have created a very good experiences for me and my friends! Definitely will introduce to my other friends and return to the restaurant for the good service.

title: Worth it!
desc: Dinner with friends at cook and brew last Saturday, it was too crowded and we were to lounge area. It was uncomfortable to eat because the table was too small but we were transferred to a bigger table. The staff were few and the service was slow but was undertansdable because the place was full of customers. It was unexpected because usually on the weekends it's not too crowded. Anyhow, you could see that the staff was trying to serve all guests we really appreciate that we were transferred to a dining area despite of and we truly liked their asamboi sour and laveney. Thanks to waitress Garcia who assisted us to be tranferred to a more comfortable dining area. The food and drinks are worth trying. The waitress informed us that the happy hour is from 11:30am- 10:30 pm Sat and

title: Amazing views, food and service!
desc: It’s my first time to Westin. We decided to go for the buffet at seasonal taste. Was greeted warmly at the door and seated with an excellent sea view. The food! Glorious! All of them was so delicious and seafood was fresh! Most importantly the service was amazing! I ordered a bottle of wine and was craving for some snacks like peanuts. Though we can lobster, oyster but drinks should go with snacks! And the server went the extra mile to find some peanuts, macadamia and cashew nuts for me! Overall I would love to come back again! Thank you !

title: Excellent!
desc: My stay at the Westin Singapore was an excellent one. Drinks (champagne or tea) were offered during check-in, service staff were friendly and polite throughout our stay, good breakfast buffet spread and the room was extremely clean and comfortable!

title: Excellent Hotel and Stay
desc: We are truly appreciate the hospitality and great service we receive from the team at the Westin Singapore. We have enjoyed our stay, and just as we expected, the Westin again had added joy to our get away.
