desc: Absolutely lovely hotel, excellent staff, beautiful rooms, amazing pool and gym. This is my favourite Westin so far. Can't fault a thing. The room was magnificent, wifi worked perfectly, staff were infallibly polite, helpful and welcoming. Drinks in the bar were great, even the laundry service was great!

title: Refreshing and Excellent View of the South
desc: Cosy, Ideally Relax Setting with a Perfect View of full Panoramic Glass View, Top to Toe. Service was Excellent throughout the stay, Smiles, Friendly and Helpful.. The very Basic Room we got was huge compared to some.. Nice lighting settings and king bed.. Love the fact that the lighting made the ambience feel romantic n calm.. Bathroom with such full Glass View was awesome for you to wind down n watch as the busy city passes by.. Highly recommended and will take pics to upload here next round..

title: Great staff but really a business hotel
desc: There for 10 days so really got to know the hotel well! The staff are awesome and really try to help and are friendly. The prices are high but it is Singapore so they take full advantage! A little out of the way in the business area so everything is a taxi to get to! The club level and lounge are great if you don't want a large meal at dinner time. Fiona on the front desk reception is fantastic so ask for her! The tall girl at the concierge is great as well with her knowledge of what to do in Singapore!

title: Wonderful experience
desc: The wonderful service never forget. MRT is near and can access it very easily. Even can get on to the highway to return to Airport as well. One of the best choices. Value for money. Super linen provided a wonderful sleep we really get. But one thing I noticed even I asked the hotel to remove the mini-bar items from the room, they have left an expensive water bottle along with the complementary ones. There was an issue with the TV and was fixed by a professional guy. The robes were on two places and couldn't make out where are they. The team was kind enough to give us one our late checkout but we really wanted to wanted to checkout around 4pm to use the swimming pool which is one of the very attractive attraction. But the front desk at 32nd floor was kind enough to offer

title: Excellent location
desc: Large room, stunning views of the harbor, could see several islands out of our window, exceptionally clean, comfortable bed wirh crispy linens, bathroom with separate bath and shower, wonderful infinity pool, very accommodating staff

title: Fresh Salmon
desc: A wide variety of food, especially the fresh salmon that was pan fried on the spot . There was also a wide variety of chocolates and awesome desserts. There was an assortment of fruits and nice dining area.

title: Construction Around Hotel
desc: Decided to stay for a night at this relatively new Westin hotel in Singapore. Uber driver had some issues finding it because quite a bit of construction going around. Checked in at the Executive Club and was upgraded to a corner suite with few of the waters. The views must have been better from many of the rooms before the nearby buildings were not up yet (and still construction going on). The suite was lovely with usual Westin amenities plus some chocolates and cookies. The happy hour in the club included beer, wine and mixed drinks with some snacks. Our rate includes breakfast in the restaurant but decided to do it in the lounge. Quite typical lounge offering. The hotel had an interesting seafood afternoon tea with bottle of Veuve for 150SGD including tax and service.

title: Disappointing experience
desc: I stayed in Westin for 5 nights for a business trip. However, the room I stayed only has a window as big as a door which is the smallest among different business hotel I stayed. The staff were nice but the housekeeping quality had a huge room for improvement.

title: One of the best hotel I have stayed in
desc: Just few year old, this hotel is situated on higher floor of a high rise in Marina bay area and is quiet simply the best (business/City) hotel I have been to in 20+ countries. We stayed here for leisure which made no difference. The front desk staff was the best I have ever encountered. The staff in room service, lounge, breakfast and concierge were equally warm and dedicated. The term "friendly staff" is not even appropiate here because all staff were trained to go beyond and take care like house guest in eastern countries. The rooms are again probably one of the best I have seen in non resort hotel. The view from the room although doesnt rival Marina Bay, is nonetheless an add-on. We had one higher category room with ocean view and a suite with obstructed ocean view. The

title: Decent business hotel in central location by marina
desc: We stayed here for a week in July. This is a great Westin hotel and relatively new, with modern decor. Everything you would expect from business hotel with quiet, spacious executive rooms with views over the harbour. The room service is excellent and the food good quality. If you have time the pool is lovely and quiet, with a good bar. Would happily come here again for work.

title: Luxurious Comfortable Stay
desc: Room was large, comfortable and contemporary. Linen soft and smooth. Bed would be perfect if it was harder. Bathroom was very spacious. Location will be suitable for those who prefer walking distance to CBD. Downtown MRT station is within 5 mins walk. Staff were friendly and attentive. A pleasant highlight was the partial view of fireworks during national day rehearsal.

title: Superb All Round
desc: I've stayed at this hotel many times now (15 in the last 15 months) and have to say whilst it's not a beach front location everything else about this hotel is superb. Great food. Brilliant staff. Excellent facilities and the rooms are also very good. Thoroughly recommended and will be staying here many times more. Well done Westin!!

title: One night stopover in Singapore
desc: We stayed at the Westin on a one-day stopover after a redeye from Europe. I had submitted a Your24 request to check in early, but due to a misunderstanding, I didn't realize that my room would not be ready at 8am when I arrived. While I was very agitated after a long flight, the hotel was very very accommodating and was very quickly able to turn a room around for us to stay in. Overall, the hotel felt very new and clean, and the staff was incredibly helpful. The hotel is located in the business district, so I would say it may not be ideal for vacationing, however the tourist spots (Orchard Street, Marina Bay) were a very short and cheap cab ride away. Final verdict - ideal hotel for business travelers over vacationers, but otherwise very satisfied with the hotel and level of

title: Enjoyable Stay
desc: Good location,very classy hotel 10 minutes walk to Marina Bay, 2 mins walk to MRT. We only had 3 nights here but really enjoyed the hotel. The rooms are very spacious for a modern hotel, very nicely fitted out with quality fixtures and fittings. Heavenly bed to sleep on, a/c works well and is not noisey, spacious bathroom with bath, seperate shower, and a rain shower. We were upgraded to a room overlooking the bay on 41st level, part of the SPG floors. Would definitely consider this hotel again on our next visit. Only got around to eating in the coffee shop which was excellent and cocktails in the bar that has huge windows overlooking the water. Great infinity pool on 33rd level, excellent free wifi when booked through SPG Website Special thanks to Shaik on concierge who was

title: Not overly impressive
desc: Three nights. Nice comfy room and room service. Pool and gym pretty great. But very expensive so I was expecting more. Irritating lifts. Average location for holidayers - in the CBD but walkable to food centres and china town. In room fridge has tiny little 'personal use' part which isn't practical at all.

title: Unpleasant Stay
desc: Unpleasant Stay with Westin Singapore. Unhelpful staff over at the check in counter. Ignore customer request. Huge Disappointment. Small Pool. Not very accessible. Be careful and not to remove anything from the mini bar as once you removed the things more than 15 seconds then you will be charged for it, if you need to store your own things in the fridge, then you have to ask the staff to clear the fridge for you.

title: A great Westin experience in the heart of the business district
desc: The Westin Singapore is located in the heart of the CBD. A typical weekday would see huge traffic of office workers around the area, while our stay over the weekends was peaceful and tranquil. We were also fortunate to have the dedicated Westin experience specialist Li Ling continuously checking with us that everything is in order before, during and even after the stay. As a relatively new property, the hotel is well-maintained and tastefully decorated. The facilities, especially the gym and the spa, were enjoyable. The stay was in a corner seaview room, where 2 out of 4 walls were floor-to-ceiling glass panels peering out into the port! Of particular note were some of Westin's specialty programmes. The provision of New Balance running gears at a token sum was very

title: Family holiday
desc: We spend 2 weeks in 5 different hotels (including a suite at the Marina Bay Sands) and the Westin was my daughters favourite. I was travelling with my wife and 2 kids. We were checked in by Victor, who noticed that our two rooms were on separate floors. He then coordinated a connecting room so that we could be next to the kids. One of the rooms wasn't ready so he rushed the cleaning for us, and sent us some cookies and chocolates for the delay. The lobby was really impressive. Great views and wall to ceiling glass from level 32. The infinity pool was nice, not quite the Marina Bay Sands, but less crowded. The club lounge was nice. Very quiet, but my disappointment was that their club rules don't allow children under 12. So we ordered room service for the kids and my wife

title: Handy for Marina Bay
desc: Stayed a week on business. Very convenient for financial centre but also on two metro lines to get about the city. Asia Square is very quiet at weekends. Staff helpful. Nice pool and gym albeit small. Also pool is in the shade most of the day. Would stay again. Limited restaurant offer but extensive breakfast with panoramic views.

title: A great hotel experience; refined
desc: Sometimes I wonder how am I going to start the review of The Westin Singapore. The experience was more holistic thus making it difficult for me to nitpick. One thing for sure, one can smell the luxury just by stepping into the 'ante lobby' on the ground floor. The lobby proper, on the 35 floor, is reached by 3 high speed elevators. Lo and behold, stepping out of the elevator, you will be greeted by a panoramic view of the sea. The simple yet opulently furnished lobby is an oasis for the worn-out traveller. Checking in was speedy and the staff had been very courteous. Made me feel welcomed. The room? As my budget only allowed me to reserve the most economical room, I didn't expect much from it. How surprised i was when I opened the door. The room oozes with modern luxury and

title: Standard Westin Hotel, probably the best SPG property in Singapore
desc: New hotel with good service & nice facilities, but some teething problems. Terrible buffet restaurant which should be avoided at all costs. SPG recognition: received an upgrade to a suite as an ambassador platinum member, although on a lower floor with obstructed views so it was a little dark. Rooms: new hotel so the rooms are quite nice, with the usual business amenities. Location: Very convenient, walking distance to two MRT stations, nearby food courts & restaurants. Service: Not bad, but not great. Don't let the concierge on the ground floor call you a taxi, instead walk further down to the other tower block where there is a public taxi stand. If not, they'll call you a cab and charge you an extra S$5. F&B: Bar was not bad, has decent drinks, a nice view, and good

title: Average/poor - have to iron out some problems
desc: Our stay at the Westin was short and sweet before we moved off to another hotel in Singapore. Our first impression was not so good, next door to a building site (a lot of places i know), reception not good! Automated an inexperienced people behind the desk. We used a huge booking website to book this room as my husband does for a lot of trips, we stated a king size room and told we could only have a twin despite booking a king via website! Even our email stated king but manager told us it is just a request and booking websites do not have priority it just a request!!! Something worth noting. We booked a executive club room with all its so called privileges? The duty manager managed to find us a king size room?? The bag man was the best member of staff we have met in our 48hr

title: Westin
desc: Well, how do I start. We booked with another hotel but it didn't work out. We booked quickly and found the hotel they let us in straight away. The Room We booked two double rooms with a connecting door. We all got a double bed and it was a luxurious stay. Facilities The swimming pool is a good size though it is outside, the gym is well equipped. Food The only downside is breakfast is not included in the initial price, we did not eat in the restaurant but there is a takeaway area downstairs, good food for breakfast. Very good. Enjoyed stay.

title: A bit noisy
desc: This is a great hotel, especially if you're doing business in the financial area. However the downside for me was all the construction going on around it. The construction continued throughout the night and during the weekend too, so for me there was no respite. My husband is a deep sleeper so it didn't bother him, but I heard the clanging all night long. I recommend asking for a room far away from the construction, but if you're a light sleeper, you may still hear it. Apart from that, it's a great hotel. It's close to the bay, but about a 15 minute taxi ride from Orchard st (the main shopping district). Service at the hotel is first rate and the staff are very accommodation and friendly.

title: Not a five star experience
desc: Business combined with leisure as decided to add a weekend onto trip - new hotel - location good but awful building site with work going on all around it from the bottom to the rooftop and all weekend so try and get a room with city view as the building site by the pool is not good and very loud - the executive club (having used so many as we travel all the time especially throughout the APAC region) is just ok very limited - the afternoon tea is two savoury canapés and one cake served whole and very sloppy and basic - limited choice of wines for the evening cocktail sessions and very disappointed to find no offer of champagne or anything other than standard spirits and very average wine - at the weekend they had champagne at breakfast but not during the week (why not

title: Bad and Unpolite front desk and Conceirge Service
desc: This is my second time staying in Westin Singapore, I would say the same incident happened to me again this time round again. First: Your CONCIERGE is like blind or pretend didn't see me, when I reach your hotel, no one open the taxi door for me and help me on my luggage, I HAVE TO DO IT ALL MY OWN and walk to the Hotel Lobby for Check-In. Second: I'm a SPG Gold Members, when I reach to the lobby for check-in at 1pm, your staff is arguing with me that I've to wait till 3pm for check-in and there's not even a full occupancy period and I get this reply and your staff argue with me that I'm only entitled for late check out and not early check-in. My question to you all that, you give the benefits of SPG Gold Members for late check-out and not early check-in, so what's the point

title: Good location, average service, mediocre fit out.
desc: The hotel is well located when I visit my company office in Singapore, but the hotel feels like it ran out of money toward the end of the fit out phase, leaving it feeling pretty sterile with too many blank walls and insufficient lighting. I needed some bigger room slippers, so I called down to ask if they had any larger than the size 6-7 in the room. The clerk apologized saying they only had the one size - disappointing but understandable. But he then proceeded to call me back 5 min later to offer me another pair - of the same too small size. I appreciate the effort, but the lack of understanding demonstrates the need for better training I found at several service points They do have an ok gym (much better than the hopeless gym at the nearby Fullerton Bay).

title: Pretty close to perfect
desc: What can you say if everything is great? What was particular positive : - the pool guy is genuinely friendly and he anticipates almost your needs before you have them - Happy hour and snack time is really good in regards to drinks and food - the staff in general is continously focused on customer satisfaction. I don't know what I could recommend as an area for improvement.

title: A Hotel more suitable for executives
desc: Hotel is located in CBD area. Not a very big hotel so gym/swimming pool tends to be more exclusive. Hotel rooms are new, well upkept. The view is not bad actually, some parts overlooking at the port, with nice Seaview. I just got the feeling where this Hotel is targeted at Execs, not really for family stays. Did not get a extra bed when I requested for my kid. If you are looking for a newer hotel with nice view and prefer less crowd, this will be a suitable hotel for you.

title: Fantastic new hotel
desc: Lovely hotel in a fantastic location near Lau Pa Sat market- 5 mins to downtown mrt station. Hotel is new and nice and spanking clean. Service excellent minus some minor glitches- faced two issues which was resolved- one was a bathroom scale malfunction and another was turndown service not done after requesting. Nevertheless everything else was smooth and perfect!

title: Satisfied and comfortable
desc: We are a family with one kid. Staying for 3 nights at premier room. We are very satisfied with the quality of the room and feel comfortable during our stay. This area is very quiet during our stay over the weekend. It is convenient as it's close to MRT, with 1-2 stations to Marina bay and China town. Overall happy with our stay.

title: Great hotel but a bit out of the Centre
desc: The Westin Singapore is a very good hotel even if you have to go up 32 floors to check in. The rooms are new and spacious with all the amenities you would expect. The restaurants and bar are well stocked with a good range of food although the bar service was sometimes a bit slow when busy. The hotel is a little bit out of the City Centre so a bit of a walk however a great food hall next door. Their conference facilities are excellent.

title: Better than my expectations
desc: When I first reserved at the westin I wanted to change the hotel becase of some reviews here and on booking.com that said some negative review about the probrety, then I didn't and I stayed with my small family for a week vacation,hotel location is superb unlike the some review said, access is easy to every destination (mrt,marina bay,the malls including the shopes at marina bay Sands,marina square and so many more)santosa island is just a 10 minutes away by taxi, the morning breakfast was good and has so many varaity and choices.stuff were very helpful and kindy unlike some reviews said. I agree to some extent that the hotel is more likely businessmen hotel but that doesn't affect the family stayed their,but for me the all positive and advantage I have mentioned is deserve

title: A very impressive business hotel
desc: We went there a year before (Aug 2016) but I start writing tripadivsor since Sept 2016 so I decide to catch it back and share where I stayed in Singapore. We went there immediately after the arrival in the Changi airport. It only takes less than half hour to arrive the hotel. It is located in the heart of the business centre and close to the metro station (Downtown station). The hotel itself actually occupies the upper several floor of the building. The building is actually multi-purposed. There is a escort lobby on the ground floor and the bell show us to the check in lobby which is on the high floor. The lobby is spacious and they use natural light to make the space bright. We check in immediately and was upgraded to the corner room with panoramic view. The room is also on

title: Love it
desc: We had the opportunity to stay at the Executive Suite at The Westin Singapore and was pleasantly surprised to find out that we were upgraded to the Harbor View Suite for the first night. The room (Harbor View Suite) was immaculate! Huge, and well thought-out with all the best furnishings - Bose sound system, Loewe TV, and much more. The second room (Executive Suite) was great too. In fact, probably cozier for two people. Breakfast at the Executive Lounge was good. The spread is not massive, but the ambience is nice and it is not too crowded. Evening cocktails are chill too. Similarly, there is not much food to speak of, but it was enjoyable nonetheless. We dined at Seasonal Tastes restaurant and the food was good too. Overall, a great experience. I love it that the hotel

title: Afternoon Tea was delicious
desc: My husband and I wanted to d9 s9mething different for national day. I was pleased to read that the Westin hotel offers afternoon tea. The hotel is located near to the business district. The hotel is beautifully decorated with stunning views. The afternoon tea starts from 230 -530. It's also located on level 32. There is two offers $85++ for two people for the seafood and two glasses of champagne. $130++ for two people for the seafood and a bottle of champagne. My husband and I topped up the extra $45 to have the bottle of champagne. We were really impressed with the service, food and atmosphere. We would come back again.

title: Excellent Bay View Rooms
desc: For those business travelers who need to release their tensions and enjoy the ocean sea views, Bay View Rooms are excellent for them. The corner floor-to ceiling windows offer the grand views of the Marina Bay areas. If you want to pamper and show your loved ones, the Junior or Executive Suites are just some of the ways to exhibit your tender, loving & care. The plush sofa and the spacious sitting area is the place to wind down and have a comfortable time with the big screen 42' - 47" HDTV is something you can look out for. There is also the Westin Club Lounge that you can relax and have a good chat with your loved ones with the great views.

title: AMAZING customer service
desc: First off let me start by saying that the room and bathroom was extremely clean and everything about the room was great. What set this hotel apart was the customer service; I have never been to a hotel before where every single employee went above and beyond every expectation, but that's exactly what happened at this hotel. From the front desk employees to the cafe workers to the restaurant workers to room-service, you name it they were all spectacular! My mother and I visited Singapore from August 1- August 6 for the first time and the Westin Singapore helped make it an unforgettable trip. When I decide to return to Singapore, this will definitely be the place I stay at. Hands down the best hotel I have ever stayed at.

title: Wow! 5 Star +
desc: Modern, outstanding service and the rooms are very well appointed. Business or pleasure this is a brilliant hotel. Central to the Marina Bay area, over looks the port (you can spend hours watching the colossal amount of ships coming and going) Reception is on the 32nd floor so thats a wow factor from the start. It has a swimming pool and gym and all the bells and whistles. I'd definitely stay here again

title: Not as good as what I expected
desc: Stayed at Westin for three nights for business. Very close to the CBD which is a huge advantage. Very close to the metro station as well (Downtown Station) which allows you to get around pretty easily. They gave me a disable room which is quite spacious, however the bathroom light wasnt working on the second day so I requested them to come to my room and fix it while I was out. Eventually they came at night while I was here and trying to fix it till 11pm. They eventually requested me to change my room. There were communication issue between staff as well and I have to chase multiple times, repeating the issue to a few staff before getting it solved.

title: They pulled this one off.
desc: I checked into the Westin which I had stayed in last year. I was impressed with the room upgrade I got and settled in letting them know my preferences for things like turn down service, ice, etc. I did not feel they heard me and things were not going as I expected. When I return to a hotel I expect them to know me from my previous stays. I returned from a loss at the casino and went to the club lounge for evening snack and drink. I was disappointed with the options including the brand of vodka they had and choice of snacks. As I had other options I decided to ask the front desk what penalties there won be if I checked out early. I met with and assistant manager and we sat down to a nice talk. He listened to my concerns and honestly asked me to give them a chance to make

title: 01st birthday after marriage in westin hotel singaore by bonzo premium cards
desc: Dis was the first tym me and my hubby visited Singapore and we chosen to stayed in The Westin Sinagpore for my 01st birthday after my marriage.It was an lovely surprise given by my hubby.He booked our vacations from Bonzo premium cards.we got the full package with 02 nighter of malaca cruise and 03 nights in westin Singapore with the fair discounted prices of tickets.After staying in the property we visited safari world,sinagpore flyer,night safari,sentosa island tour and at last day we went for universal studio.Hotel is good,hotel staff is very friendly and helpful.The driver who picked up us everyday for our sightseens and all transportation is good.Fab stay thanks to my husband who contacted real service provider bonzo premium cards.

title: Just what you expect
desc: This is not the best hotel in Sigapour, But for the price it is perfect. 2 bad points : Internet is not free in the room and the position ideal for business but not for tourist. Good point : The bar, the breakfast A very good point : The swimming pool

title: Excellant location and service
desc: This is NOT just another hotel but one that stands apart in Singapore it has luxury throughout and its staff are exceptional. The food is excellent as is the room and all of its amenities I look forward to visiting this hotel every time I come to Singapore

title: Great newcomer ro rhw Hotel scene
desc: All new and beight , rhis new vomer isperfect for all business travellers and tourists visiting HK. Hotel staff are very polite and friendly . Rooms are spacious very functional, good batheooms with a good overal view. gym and pool v pleasent. Restaurants all good but norhing to shout about. reconmwnd but dont over pay

title: Heavenly spa
desc: The spa was one of the best that I've been to. The facilities are new and I felt completely at ease. The therapist was great and the treatment room was spacious with hi tech treatment bed that auto inclined after the treatment. No more stumbling and struggling to get up after lying down for couple of hours! Worth the money for the treatment. Went in an hour earlier before my appointed slot to use the facilities. Great view from the changing room too!

title: Superb hotel for business travel just in the middle of business area
desc: Great location - just in the middle of business district next to Marina Bays Sands. Clean and big room with a nice view. Hotel has a nice terrace with a pool, gym, spa, nice lobby bar where a woman sings in the evenings a guy plays the piano. I really enjoyed it! ps. and I really liked a white tea soap with aloe ;)

title: Nice and efficient hotel
desc: I stayed one night at The Westin Singapore in August 2016. The hotel is located in the financial district so it's very good for those visiting for business. Room and Amenities 🌟🌟🌟🌟 Room is big for Singapore hotel size. It has a nice view of the harbor. It was dressed with necessary good quality amenities. Cleanliness 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 Breakfast 🌟🌟🌟 Selection is quite limited for a 5-star hotel Service 🌟🌟🌟🌟 Staff are friendly, not so many staff around though.

title: Conference organisation poor
desc: I attended a conference on 24 August and food and beverage standards were simply unacceptable. Many dishes finished before those at the back of the queue reached them and they were not replenished. Even a 15 minute wait wasn't enough and some chose to eat elsewhere at their own cost to finish lunch within the time allocated. A few dishes were resupplied just as the conference resumed after lunch, and the food was wasted as there was no one to eat it. Some vegetarian dishes were not replenished at all. Even a simple counting of the chairs supplied by the hotel would show that missing the mark by 40-50% is amateurish. Despite the organsier pre-informing about special dietary requirements, there was e.g. zero lacto vegetarian food during the afternoon tea break. No attempt

title: Great view
desc: If you'd like a good view of the city and the port, go to the hotel bar on the 32nd floor. Great view and decent drinks. They are slightly on the pricey side though. Bottles of wine are decently priced for Singapore! Good for brunch also. Hotel is clean

title: Superb Hotel in Singapore
desc: Booked 2 rooms for 2 night weekend stays for my family of 6 recently. Hotel parking entrance is at Shenton Lane. They have 2 lobbies, one on the ground floor which mainly act to greet and direct guests to the 5th floor official hotel lobby. Since we drive into the Asia Tower 2(which Westin is located), we have no problem finding parking near the hotel elevator. Customer service in Westin are TOP-NOTCH! Pleasant, Courteous and Helpful. 2 complimentary bottle water every day and may request more from front desk if necessary. They offered fruits infused ice water in a big glass jar behind the front desk and the front desk served the drinks with a glass jigger; NICE touch! Though, I am used to having self-serve infused drinks placed in the lobby in most of the hotels. I highly

title: Nice hotel, good location, OK for a couple of days
desc: This is a good business hotel in Singapore. Rooms are comfortable, well appointed and spotlessly clean. Hotel pool is a bit disappointing. A little bit soul less and sunny in the mornings, until about 15:00. Location is good for the marina and bay. Staff are polite and helpful.

title: Good experience
desc: I can raccomando this hotel , well positioned 5 min from metro station , and close to Marina Bay Area . The room was huge even if fa won inside side of the tower . Very clean and most importantly the staff was very kind and try to arrange my request all the time .

title: Nice rooms and friendly staff !
desc: I usually try to stay at the Westin when I'm visiting Singapore. The hotel is well positioned, with restaurants close by and within easy walking distance of the MRT. The rooms are well appointed and the staff is always friendly and helpful.

title: nice hotel with some disadvantages
desc: hotel is new with modern design. stayed here several nights attending a conference. Advantages: 1. rooms are spacious 2. bathrooms are big with shower and tube. 3. in the taxi stand. piorty for in house guests. (saves you 15 min waiting during peak times.) 4. spa is nice called heavenly spa Disadvantages: 1. lobby is in 32 floor 2. you need to change 2 elevators before getting to your room. 3. NO SMOKING hotel. (only across the street!) 4. non of the rooms have windows or balcony. 5. breakfast at club lounge had little variety.

title: Great Representation of Category 5 SPG Hotel
desc: Recently renovated and near the Marina Bay, this hotel is above par. The modern and very chic yet minimalist decor gives you New York high rise feels with an exclusivity that reminds you that you are in a quality 5 start hotel. As my flight arrived very early (6:15am) I had requested early check in and had requested my Your24 through SPG. Upon arrival it was noted that the request was not in the system and I would be charged for a half day. However, after much discussion, the hotel staff acknowledged my request without charge which was greatly appreciated after a very long 21.5 hour flight. However, she could not guarantee my upgrade in that moment and noted it would not be ready until 3PM, so I opted for the standard room. The standard room was more than sufficient.

title: Westin Singapore, Maybe I Had Too Much Expectation.
desc: On a short stopover in Singapore, had a chance to stay couple of nights at the Westin Singapore. As a SPG member, I was so excited that this property was added to the SPG line up. Remember the desire to stay here from the onset, but had no plans to travel to SG anytime soon. So when the time finally came, i was looking to stay at a SPG property and was debating b/w the St Regis or the Westin. Comparing SPG points, it was the same b/w the two properties. I was leaning towards St. Regis, but finally settled on Westin after doing some research and seeing the fabulous pictures. I think the hotel feels very similar to the Sheraton D Cube hotel in Seoul or the Westin in Times Square. But we didn't enjoy it. It was too much of a business hotel, perhaps that was the issue. The

title: Great Hotel For Business Or Vacation
desc: I stayed at the Westin Singapore on business for a few days this week, I think it's the first time that I've checked into a hotel on the 32nd floor ! Super happy I was upgraded and my room was fantastic, a bath right up against the window on the 43rd floor was something to see. The room was spotless, the breakfast was amazing with such massive choice across traditional continental, cooked and even curry if you wanted it. Would highly recommend staying here for business or pleasure.

title: Perfect stay
desc: The location is near to Marina Bay and Garden by the bay. The hotel is situated on Asia Square tower 2 which is close to Lau Pa Sat for all day dining. We chose not to have breakfast at the hotel and found Lau Pa Sat to be great to find Singaporean style breakfast such as dim sum, laksa, etc. However, if you plan to be on Orchard road, it would be a 10-15 minute taxi ride. We got a bay view corner room on the 36th floor which have views of the bay on one side and the hotel swimming pool on the other. The room was large and modern. Our 5 and 3 year old sons love the view so much they request the next time we are in Singapore again, we would have to stay in this room again. The bed was super comfy and big enough for us. The bathroom was modern with an ensuite bathtub and separate

title: Wonderful week stay
desc: My review is a little too late since we stayed on the last week of September. Location: very good. Walking distance to MRT station. Room: well kept and clean. The toilet is huge!!! We love the bathtub. It can even almost fit 2 people. Pool: we love the water massage on the side. Too bad the view is blocked by construction. Concierge: Polite, warm and friendly. However, we would recommend informing the guests when booking an on-call taxi about the surcharge. Tourists may not be aware of it and it could also be costly. Club Lounge: I would like to commend the Chinese guy who remembered my drink preference. He was so welcoming without over doing it. The food here is also nice for breakfast and cocktail hour. Restaurant (Seasonal Tastes): I love the restaurant furniture, view and

title: Nice hotel - modern and good service
desc: Really liked this hotel, much better than the Westin in Sydney which I also stayed in around the same time. This hotel is modern, my room was spacious and a gorgeous bathroom. Staff were friendly and efficient. Infinity pool small but nice - on the downside there is a huge construction site in front of the hotel which you can hear inside and it totally obscures any view from the infinity pool (which they photoshop out of the pics on their website). Location good for Chinatown and walking to Merlion and Marina Bay also possible. Would stay again.

title: Very good hotel
desc: The Westin is easily one of the best hotels in town. It's close to the cbd and train station. The Room is nice. Gym opens 24 hours (as with SPG hotels, for some reasons, they don't have many machines for legs). The foods at the restaurants are nice. I booked my room thru the SPG & didn't realise the Breakfat is not included (additional $45 per person).

title: Enjoyable staycation
desc: Entering the hotel building (Asia square tower 2) on level 1, there was a Daily Treats cafe and the concierge. Check in was on lev 32. We were welcomed by Miguel (front desk manager). Our check in was quick, seamless and it was nice to get upgraded to a premier sea view when we originally booked a double sea view room. As one of us is an SPG (Starwood preferred guest) we received free wifi and dining discounts. Fret not, anyone can sign up and receive the same perks anyway. The lobby was very nice, spacious and elegant with high ceiling and tasteful decor. From the lobby, the views of the marina Bay Area was amazing and the lobby lounge was ideal for guests to laze and enjoy the scenery. There was also a heavenly spa, gym and pool located on lev 35. Unfortunately though they had

title: Terrific business hotel
desc: Ultra smart hotel. Well located close to the CBD. Smooth, slick operation with excellent and helpful staff. Nice big spacious rooms, modern and very clean. Nice pool. Great rooftop bar. Expensive, but worth the money.

title: Plush Hotel in the heart of the business district
desc: My family of 2 adults and 2 kids spent a one night staycation in this hotel in early September. The hotel reception is located on the 32nd floor. Very modern with an amazing view of the port area outside. There is a very posh bar/cafe on the same level, and was quite empty when I was there. Good place for business meetings. There is a lovely fragrance in the hotel as you enter. The room was well laid out. Two very comfortable beds (I was tempted to buy the Westin Heavenly Bed!), a small sitting area, . Spacious room. Free wi-fi in room. Separate shower and bath. Nice toiletries. We had a view over the pool and the surrounding office buildings, with the sea peeking at us in the distance between two buildings. There is a huge building being constructed just across from the

title: At the center of it all
desc: I stayed at the Marina Bay Westin during a business trip. The hotel is new and well kept. Everything you would expect of a Westin. There was some construction going on in nearby buildings with some noise. But not enough to disturb sleep. I got a chance to see the FormulaOne race, which was also being promoted by the hotel. Over all a good hotel experience.

title: The best
desc: Our all time favorite hotel in Singapore, not only for business, also for leisure travel. Service is first class, concierge, front desk staff, restaurant staff, lounge staff. Rooms are modern and offer great views of the city, Marina Bay or the Container Port/Ocean. Similar views from the pool on the 35th floor. For restaurants, we have only tried breakfast (very good). Location: Two MRT stations (subway) are within easy walking distance, so is the Marina Bay Sands complex with plenty of dining and shopping.

title: Relaxing hotel
desc: This is the second time I am staying in the Westin for business reasons. It's a heaven of peace and quiet, especially in the evening after a day of hard work. I appreciated very much the health club that I have been using every day. Breakfast is substantial. For the price, about 50SGD, it is only worth when you have time and can stay long at the table, otherwise you won't have time to try the wonderful choice they have. The hotel is beautifully located, you've got sea view, and you're couple of blocks away from Marina Bay, which is practical if you wanna go jogging or spend time there. Closest subway is Downtown. There is a taxi service at the entrance of the hotel so also very practical.

title: Good location but disappointing room
desc: This Westin was in a good location for us as we were here primarily for the Singapore F1 night race but the area is like a ghost town at night as it is in the financial district. The hotel floors effectively start on the 32nd floor above a financial building; so not very easy to spot when we arrived via the MRT. Once you know the best exit from the Downtown MRT station, yes it is easy! On arrival we were told we had been “upgraded” to a Premier room which initially seemed fine. However, another person travelling with us was also put into a Premier Room which made much better use of the space and had slightly more privacy in the bathroom as it was to one side of the bedroom. In our room the bathroom almost seemed like a corridor between the bedroom and the main door and was

title: LOVED ❤️👌🏽👌🏽👌🏽✨
desc: Located in the middle of the financial district and not so touristy as say... Marina Bay Sands .. This is my favourite hotel ... fantastic sea views and an amazing pool ... I will definitely be back. The concierges were so friendly and helpful and the hotel staff very knowledgeable regarding my coeliac requirements... Service was impeccable 👌🏽

title: Quiet, luxury suitable for family
desc: Pleasantly surprised at suitability for small family. Beautiful bathrooms, well appointed accessories and sizeable rooms. Beds are incredibly comfortable. The hotel is very private and quiet hallways and rooms make this hotel serene in a busy business district. It is an easy 10-15 minute walk to Marina Bay Sands with plenty of shopping and restaurants. A large hawker style food court is very well priced and located very close to the hotel. Not much open on the weekends during the business district. Very close to the train station for transport and concierge terrific in organising taxis quickly. The checkin was very nice providing our two young children with Westin kids packs which was just what we needed after a long day of travelling to settle the kids down! I would recommend

title: Good business hotel
desc: Everything is brand new at Westin Singapore. Location is very good at Marina Bay Financial centre with CBD/Chinatown a short walk away. Only issue is that there is still construction going on next door, so it will take a year or 2 before the sorroundings are really nice. The entrance is a bit odd as there is no reception at the ground floor, which I think is a mistake. Since the lobby is at 30th floor the view is stunning, but you wouldnt really care about that when you want to check-in conveniently. Instead, they should have let the guests check in in at the ground floor. Rooms are very modern and cleaned to perfection. The gym is small and not up to the standard for a new 5-star hotel. All in all a good business hotel. Very high-tech but lack of charm. It works but there are

title: Nice location but frustrating too
desc: Room and amenities were great however attention to detail was severely lacking. 1. Requested more hair conditioner and received 3 bottles of hand lotion 2. Requested one wake up call and received 4 calls which was a huge pain running to Answer phone while getting ready for work 3. Used a Starwood friend rate which wasn't that much different from regular rates but was told I wouldn't get any points at check out and wasn't allowed to talk to manager when requested The physical room and most of the staff were wonderful. The points above took it all down a few notches . Not super happy overall.

title: Centrally located in the financial district
desc: The Westin hotel is a new hotel in the Singapore financial district offering convenience and the usual Westin standard. We found the hotel expensive for what is on offer compared to what is offered by other hotels. The hotel also has a false lobby where you enter and then have to catch a lift to the 32nd floor before being able to check-in and proceed to your room. While the furnishings and everything are all to a Westin standard, we also found the rooms to be smaller than we would normally expect. Finally, while the executive lounge offered the usual offerings, we were disappointed with the level of service. It was to the highest standard but you frequently had to wait for drinks with only one person working during the busiest times.

title: Quiet, clean and comfortable
desc: Peaceful and quiet weekend hideout. Room was clean, and the bed was SUPER comfortable. Excellent location with plenty of food places around and 3mins away from the downtown station. Facilities are complete and well maintained.

title: Great Hotel
desc: It's a nice business hotel right in the business district. The rooms are spacious and luxurious. Unfortunately, the views will soon be blocked with new buildings coming up around the Asia Square complex.

title: Outstanding Service at the Westin from Harvindran,Taufik and Andree
desc: My partner and I visited Singapore for a few days as part of a business trip. The Westin Singapore is worthy of its 5 star rating. The hotel is super-clean and has all the amenities that one would expect from a 5 star hotel. The rooms are well appointed and are spacious, with an awesome shower. I have never posted on this site before and what compels me to do so is the outstanding service received from Harvindran, Taufik and Andree. These 3 staff members are an absolute asset to the Westin group of hotels. I have travelled to many countries and stayed in many 5 star establishments and we have NEVER received such wonderful sterling service EVER. They went out of their way at all times, repeated directions over and over, were kind and caring and made us feel so welcome and

title: DO NOT book this hotel if you are a light sleeper.
desc: My fiance and I have booked this hotel for a one-night staycation to celebrate our engagement. Not the fault of the hotel at all, but the building construction noise at the plot of land next to hotel goes throughout the night. I'm typing this at 4am and the knocking noise is really unbearable. I really wish I could head home now to get a good sleep. Please do not book this hotel if you are sensitive to noise, not at least until the adjacent tower's construction is completed.

title: A restful staycation
desc: I rested at the Westin for a night. The front desk staff, especially Joy, were very helpful. The heavenly bed was a treat for the senses and the bathroom was elegant and lovely. I would stay here again in a heartbeat for my next break. 6 stars for the Westin.

title: Very good location for business trip
desc: The hotel is situated right in the center of business area. Hotel has all the necessary amenities for a leisure hotel, however it is business one. The SPA zone with magnificent views and the infinity pool gives you a touch of Asian exotic relaxation. The services provided in hotel, especially in room check in were perfect. I've been staying in hotel twice, and will be coming there more in case of a trip to Singapore.

title: Tricky Location, Fantastic Staff
desc: What a lovely hotel. The hotel is located on top of Asia Square, so the location either works for you or it doesn't, but that also means that there are numerous coffee shops and bars in the same complex. It is easy to get a cab too, if not from the hotel, from the Asia Square taxi rank. The staff were absolutely delightful. From check-in, the room was not immediately ready, but the young lady at check-in invited me to the club house to change into work clothes. By the time I was done the room was ready. The room was 4523, and the view is essentially infinite, weather permitting. The room is great, I like the location of the safe which is quite big, but missing a power connection. There is plenty of storage, and even a place in the closet to 'hide' the suitcase so it does

title: Couldn't have asked for more
desc: We only stayed at the Westin for a stop over on our way to Phuket. Standard of the hotel and staff are superb. The heavenly bed to die for ! Breakfast has a great selection of foods from all over the world. Good location for accessing the rest of Singapore. Recommend using Uber rather than taxis. Just around the corner from hotel is Satay street - great atmosphere and street food.

title: Not good at all
desc: The staff services dose not match the hotel. Arrived at the hotel with not assistant to our 2 bags and 2 small bags. We had to handle them to check in level and on to our room. When we arrived to our room. The shower had over flow. It was 2am the plumber came 20mins took him 30 mins to get it fix and another 40 for the house keeping to clean it. So my wife could not get to sleep till 5:30. The toilet always have a strong smell. The staff not willing to do anything(maybe is the weekend). Had not been a great experience. Buffet breakfast is not value for money either. Also i spend 120mins in the spa. The staff was horrible they made enough noise so we could not relax and i had book the spa on sat afternoon the hotel still manage to do a lot of drilling right on the of us. Worst

title: Stunning
desc: We only stayed here for 1 night as a stop over. But what a hotel! Over 30 floor up to the lobby and what views. The concierge who heled us with our bags out of the taxi was so nice. When he brought the bags to the room he asked to come in and gave us a complete overview of our room and explained everything to how to operate the blinds to the lights and to what the hotel has to offer. The reception lady was very friendly, upgraded our room, as we joined the loyalty program. As we were only here for 1 night we got a late checkout as we weren't flying out till the next night, so te extra few hours were appreciated. Lucky for us we arrived on a night where the restaurant had a seafood buffet, what a buffet. Seafood of all sorts and the fresh lobster was great, along with

title: Great hotel, but the development right infront of it is blocking the beautiful view!
desc: My sister booked a 4D3N stay for me at Westin Singapore for my birthday last Oct. (30 Sep to 03 Oct 2016) The hotel is centrally located, nearest MRT is the Downtown station (Blue Line). Usually people who comes here for business trip would stay in this hotel as it is in our CBD area. By the way its within Asia Square premises. We have been provided 1 complimentary carpark coupon, which covers 1 entry. (this mean we need to park the car there from Day 1 till the day we check out, weird. But you could try asking for another coupon) We love the hotel room, clean, spacious and comfortable, modern and luxury. The toilet has both standing shower and bathtub. We utilise the facilities in the hotel (Pool & Gym). The pool view would have been perfect if not for the development right

title: The staff is kindfull
desc: I was very happy when stayed in this hotel. The FO Staff, Joy Yao is very antusiated and welcome us in great manner. She give us an exception which help us so much. The room is nice as well. Hope we could come back there soon. Very recommended..!!!

title: Amazing views and great club lounge and pool
desc: I visited here when I was in Singapore visiting my best friend and I loved it. We stayed in a club room and the rooms were spacious and the beds so comfortable. We stayed on level 43. The club was a relaxing place to chill and have some drinks and food. Also mention worthy is the pool - wow what amazing views. Would definitely be back.

title: One of the best in Singapore
desc: It is one of the best given the line up of old hotels and this in contrast being a new hotel. The lobby on 32nd has great impressive views. Rooms are spacious with a lot of natural lighting and bathrooms are huge. The service is excellent. The hotel has a great gym and a large pool. Room service is efficient.

title: Totally modernistic hotel room/bathroom with a nice view
desc: High quality hotel with space rooms and futuristic bathroom having floor to ceiling windows (not sure if people could look in) but the view is the best I hav experienced from any shower. The food at breakfast was very complete and totally over the top from any European standard.

title: Great hotel to stay at!
desc: This sublime hotel is a bit tucked away but nonetheless in a good location. Would highly recommend anyone to stay there if they are visiting singapore. Good service and very clean rooms! I stayed there for a few days during my asia trip and was not disappointed.

title: Great hotel with great facilities
desc: As a business stayer in this hotel I am always well looked after. They have a great gym, outdoor infinity pool and generally very good facilities. The restaurant and bar are nice albeit expensive (such is Singapore) and the staff are always friendly.

title: Good location hotel
desc: Good location, centrally located in CBD, the hotel well decorated room and very comfortable, good reception service upon arrival as most needs were well taken care. The restaurant serve good and decent breakfast. Suitable for both leisure and business.

title: Not as expected
desc: Stayed during a citytrip for 4 days. Location is perfect and the design is beautiful, I loved the spacious room and bathroom. The restaurants are very stylish. Amenities, room directory and small add-on's such as a jogging map are a nice touch. However, I was disappointed by the level of service. I was requested to pay an extremely high deposit for 'incidental charges', and as I stayed only 3 nights I found it excessive. Additionally, where in this world in 2016 do you have to pay extra for wifi? Honestly, I believe as a 5-star hotel this is very outdated. Also, I expected a turndown service in the evening, which this hotel only does for VIP guests, and at the poolside there is no attendant or lifeguard, only a receptionist who doesn't move from her desk, which results in

title: High quality hotel
desc: The Westin in Singapore is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. It is perfect if you are on a business trip as the rooms are spacious allowing plenty of space for a study area and it is located a 5 minute walk from the central business area. I stayed at the Sofitel, round the corner, recently to try a new place, but was very much disappointed as it cost almost as much as the Westin but didn't come close to the quality of the Westin. The rooftop pool at the Westin is great. The gym is small but sufficient. They have free guided running guides 2/3 times a week. They used to have a free yoga class, which unfortunately has been discontinued. The lobby area is spacious and tastefully decorated. There is a grand piano, which is played every evening, creating a wonderful

title: Westin Hotel Singapore was excellent...
desc: After a very ordinary previous stay at a high profile hotel in Singapore, we decided to use the Westin Hotel in Marina View on our most recent trip - business/leisure. The cleanliness of the hotel and the preparedness of all staff to make our stay a pleasure stood out amongst other hotels we have stayed at in Singapore. We will definitely stay there again. We actually encouraged another couple to join us on this trip from Perth, Western Australia. When businesses work out how the multiplier effect works, it is amazing! We have already told a number of people they should try the Westin and I am sure they will give it a go. By the way, we do not like paying large sums for buffet breakfasts - try and keep fit. On the ground floor of the hotel building is a café where you can have a

title: Excellent hotel near the marina & collyer quay
desc: Work frequently takes me to Singapore, and the Westin has become my go-to hotel. When possible i stay loyal to SPG properties, and have tried all four in Singapore (Westin, W, St Regis, and Sheraton Towers). I prefer the Westin because it is very new and modern, while also located in the Marina area which is where my office and all the action is. The hotel itself is on the upper floors of a new building in Asia Square. This area is being developed quickly, but I never noticed any noise or inconvenience due to nearby construction. I've stayed at the Westin 5 or 6 times and each time have had a spacious modern room with excellent views given the height of the hotel. Some rooms have showers with one wall being a window to the outside (no one can see in). The breakfast buffet in

title: Comfortable Weekend Stay
desc: It was nice to stay in a different area of Singapore, quiet & relaxing on a weekend with very comfortable beds and good sized bath & rooms with great views. The bar, pool and spa areas are lovely. Easy to get a taxi or metro anywhere, plenty of restaurants & cafes nearby. Construction site nearby not a bother. Enjoyed the Makan Tail with Miss Tam Chiak, a small & interesting taste of China Town.

title: Excellent
desc: All I can say is the room and the view. I got a special rate from Starwood and it was amazing. Amazing room, great food at the bar and room service. Great service. Had a massage at the Spa, the massage therapist was very good, The only downsize is the spa has no waiting room so you are sort of loitering around the bathroom while waiting for your massage. Great coffee downstairs in the cafe as well. Loved the decor of the whole place. Gym was fully equiped as well. Pool was on the edge of the oasis.

title: Not a leisure hotel. Business only here.
desc: I am a current guest at the Westin. I am a SPG Gold member and booked this hotel using the cash and points option. 10,000 points plus $189 a night. I just arrived and I am here for five nights. When I checked in the front desk clerk was very efficient in processing passports, verifying credit card (I have a SPG Amex) and providing my key cards. That was it. No "thank you for being a SPG member" or intro to the hotel. I asked if I had access to the executive lounge and was told "no". After wandering around trying to figure out the hotel (the lobby is on the 33 floor so it is confusing) I went back to another clerk and asked for an introduction to the hotel. She asked for my room number, looked up my reservation and then told me the gym and pool are on 35 and she provided

title: Average
desc: Good location for the business district. Limited in-hotel dining options but close to a food centre and Marina Bay for other options. Room is basic, no amenities (eg shampoo, shower gel etc ) which is strange for a business hotel. Was expecting better having stayed at other SPG hotels previously.

title: Good and luxurious hotel
desc: Last Saturday was my second time staying in Westin Singapore. It is a very good hotel in a CBD area with within walkable distance to Lau Pa Sat and downtown line mrt station. Knowing that this was my second stay, Ms. Li Ling from Westin Experience Specialist sent me an email to check on anything she could do to help me improve my stay few days before the stay. She was really helpful and arranged for all the requests I have asked for. I want to thank her for that. As a SPG gold member, check in was seamless but no upgrade was given probably due to hotel was fully booked at that point of time. My first stay as SPG preferred guest, I was given a 2 category upgrade. Room was big, clean and spotless with a great view. Bathtub was lovely. As I booked a club room this time round, I

title: The Westin Singapore
desc: The Westin Singapore is a beautiful property that is centrally located with an amazing rooftop pool with great views. The rooms are modern, spacious and beautifually designed. The hotel is centrally located. Not to far from the airport but still within walking distance of the financial center of downtown and many of the points of interest from a tourist point of view including: Merlion Park, The Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Gardens among many other sights. The hotel is also within walking distance of the Metro. The restaurant in the hotel offers an amazing buffet that is totally worth trying. The staff at the Westin Singapore was helpful, personable and made my stay memorable.

title: Slick....
desc: Wonderfully designed and constructed hotel. Great service and a really warm and inviting environment. Nice bar area and wicked cocktails (bit pricey, but you don't do it everyday!). Location is excellent and walking distance to Raffles Place/Quay and most of the business/financial district. Close to the MRT and some lovely views over the docks etc.

title: Quick Trip to Singapore
desc: Westin Singapore is a beautiful property situated in the Marina Bay area. The rooms were spacious and very well maintained. We were on the 41st floor and the views were spectacular. The only complaint i have is that I had booked for an early check-in but they did not have the rooms ready, I understand that it is only available when the rooms are available but when the room was ready we were not informed until I had to go and ask the front desk. Other than this minor issue our stay was pleasurable.

title: Beautiful Hotel
desc: Been staying here for years. Very clean and modern hotel. Staff is nice and helpful. The food is very good and so is room service. The pool has a nice view of the Singapore harbor. Ask for a view of the city or the harbor. If you are a SPG member you can get a free breakfast depending on the room you book.

title: Great all round hotel!!
desc: Had a very comfortable and enjoyable experience at the Westin. We stayed on the 45th floor, had a great view of the Harbour, loved the breakfast, loved the room service even more. The Pool is huge and the service is impeccable. The Mango blueberry and Very berry smoothies are a MUST try! As a Pastry Chef my one criticism was when I tried the Panna Cotta. The flavours were nice but there was way too much gelatine in the Panna Cotta which made it almost inedible. other than that the food from the room service was fantastic! The hotel is also close to Lau Pa Sat, a hawker centre with fantastic food. Further more, in the evenings the road adjacent to Lau Pa Sat closes to become a Satay Street with a dozen stalls selling delicious satay. I would stay here again if I visited

title: Wow
desc: Spent 3 days here on stopover back to UK from Oz used SPG points to book room. Best welcome and check in we have ever had at a Westin. Amazing room with floor to ceiling windows, huge bathroom. Lovely bar and excellent coffee shop on ground floor where we ate breakfast very reasonably priced and good quality. IN financial area but not far to MRT or walk to Marina Bay Sands or Amoy st area.

title: Incredible bang for your buck!
desc: This hotel is a fantastic addition to the Starwood inventory in Singapore. I am a very loyal SPG member and I think for me personally this hotel is the best bang for your buck in all of Singapore. The staff were kind and helpful, the resort boasts some amazing views and the amenities are 5 star. I don't have a single complain and I applaud the hotel management and designers on a job well done!

title: Good new hotel with excellent service
desc: Everything was very nice! Delicious breakfast, nice room with excellent views, beautiful spa, infinity pool with luxurious views of the city, high service and hospitable staff. Thank you so much! I'll be back again!

title: Nice hotel that lacks perks featured in lesser hotels
desc: I don't travel often, but I have stayed in hotels ranging from penny pinching to 5-star properties. And invariably, it seems that it's the pricey properties that offer the fewest 'perks'. The Westin Singapore is a beautiful hotel, located centrally in downtown Singapore. Large and beautiful lobby, professional and attentive front desk staff, and a grand piano. Our room was spacious and modern, with floor-to-ceiling windows that gave a glorious view of the downtown towers. Plaudits aside, it's the little things that we *didn't* get that we will remember most: We were a bit miffed that they declined to give us Internet access just because we had a 'special room rate' from a friend. We had to go to the lobby for free internet. Also unlike many other pricey properties, breakfast

title: Smart hotel with large and well equipped guest rooms
desc: I stayed at the hotel for three nights this week. To access a room you have to catch two lifts, one to the lobby on the 23rd and then a second one to your room. for the first two nights i stayed on the 46th floor in an executive room because it was very busy. On my last night i stayed in a much cheaper standard room which seemed identical. Breakfast is pretty good but is expensive at just over $50. Very nice and relaxing feature bar space and often with a live pianist. On Wednesday evening i fancied a walk and the concierge was very helpful - planning my route to cover some key waterfront sides and even gave me a bottle of water for my journey. I would definitely stay at this hotel again - highly recommended.

title: Exceptional stay
desc: Singapore Westin definitely did not fail it's name! Clean, modern, and friendly staff! We had no problems at check in or check out. The hotel is not over crowded like many other hotels. And it definitely maintains its' Westin Starwood Preferred standards. The hotel provides separate mens and womens spas and saunas which is very convenient for families with islamic and conservative values! Breakfast was bountiful and delicious, with pleasant views! Housekeeping did their job well, as rooms and bathrooms were always cleaned and maintained properly. Westin Singapore is definitely a must stay! Thank you!

title: My favourite SPG property in Singapore
desc: Westin Singapore is one of my most favourite SPG property in Singapore because it is modern, chic and feels new-ish. The lobby was gorgeous with plenty of plush sitting. The high ceilings and panoramic views was a sight to behold. It over looked the port of Singapore, which was just stunning. My room was very well appointed and the earthly colour scheme of the room made the room very soothing. It also boasted views of the city and one could see all the way to Chinatown and even Queenstown. Overall the stay was great, elite recognition was good, staffs were friendly and price was reasonable.

title: Quality Business Hotel
desc: This hotel is a great business hotel. Friendly staffs , clean & nice room with high ceiling lounge ... But most of the marina bay view is being blocked by surrounding high rise buildings. It's our annual family celebration for new year count down & wedding anniversary but was disappointed due to fireworks display was not able to watch "directly" as we were only able to see the reflection from the buildings mirror image walls... Good quality cold seafood for buffet but recommend to improve on the varieties to include nice authentic local food ...

title: Smaller room this trip
desc: Second stay here. My room (3341) this trip is smaller and more stuffy than the last. Long and dark corridor to get to the room. Service with a smile at all times. Still think the gym is a bit small for a business hotel. Pool is great.

title: Discreet and conveniently located
desc: Taxi fare from the airport was around S$20, and about 20 minutes transit time... Not bad. The bellhop was expedient and helpful, and the receptionist at check-in was very friendly (Ann Varghese, I believe was her name... Shout out to her). Our room was on the 43rd floor with great view towards Chinatown. The in-room amenities were excellent, and conveniently situated/organized. The Executive Lounge was a great add-on and worth the expense. The drink and food selection was adequate, but the room was rather small. We had no problem due to low census at the hotel, but I can see that the lounge may be crowded during peak season. Hotel was conveniently located in the Marina District, close to multiple MRT lines, which is great for both business travelers and tourists. A lot of

title: Would be back for more!!
desc: Beautiful business hotel. Friendly and professional staff. The room was modern and clean, even though unfortunately the bathtub wasn't easy to operate. The bed was nice and big, very comfortable. Breakfast could have been better. Very busy hotel and well deserved. Love the running concierge and fitness ideas!!

title: Below Average
desc: Property is great for corporate trips. Located close to Marina May Sands, however it failed to impress us. We visited Singapore for Christmas Holidays, and must add, this hotel has been poor choice for a holiday. Shrewd Staff, one of the managers actually warned us that she would call the security if I was seen in Bathroom Slippers at Breakfast Area. This place lacks the warmth and vibe for a family holiday, and will not book again unless a corporate visit planned.

title: Westin should be hospital ...they lack hospitality ;(
desc: We had booked two executive rooms for our vacation at the full price from 21st dec till 25th .first two surprise on arrival one room was offered at 9.30 despite arrival at 6am n other room at 1.30 pm. .second big shock was the disparity between the rooms .one with queen bed n other with two separate beds one room to small n other looks ok .i always feel hospitality is by default is extending love n care n courtsey to their guest as their own family . We were shocked with negative attitude of foods n beverage manager. Ms Anne. I guess who is rude arrogant n didturbed lady . No manners no respect to her guest . Tody morning when my daughter was having breakfast was wearing slippers due to a problem in her feet , she was rudely asked to leave the restaurant or she will call the

title: Excellent property but no SPG Gold Service
desc: I've dined at this SPG property in Singpore countless times and always loved how nice the property seems and how impeccable everything seems. The location itself (32nd floor lobby!), the not-crowded buffets (SPG points!), and seemingly romantic lobby lounge (where I get to order my fav avocado ice cream too). All these add up to a certain level of expectation for the rooms itself. I almost managed to stay back in 2014 but some family thingy happened and we cancelled the staycation. Bummer. Fast forward to this year, lucky me chanced upon their flash sale (see below) and booked for 1 night. Was super excited about it - finally!! PRICE - $285++ for an Executive Sea View King Room (40-50 SqM) booked during their 3rd Anniversary Flash Sale in November = $335.44. Supposed a 30%

title: Exceptionally remarkable!
desc: We had this rare opportunity of putting up at The Westin last week, and the stay was amazing. Upon check-in, we were greeted with a live piano performance at the lobby - the melody of the piano tracks filled the lobby with a romantic touch. There were pieces of contemporary art all over the hotels. Each room had a painting and a wall art installation. The room was spectacular for our standards. It was spacious and offered a view of Chinatown from way above. The bathroom segregates the shower, bathtub and the toilets into individual spaces. I loved the rain shower! The toiletries were not quite as expected - shampoo was a little dry. Beds were huge and pillows were fluffy! The built-in mahogany wardrobe had sufficient hangers and there were countless of drawers everywhere.

title: Rooms and service are top shelf!!
desc: I recently stayed at the Westin hotel Singapore in Asia Square Tower for business and the room was fantastic. The bathroom was high end as per expectation. Many hotels in Singapore are old and run down, for the money you are paying for them you would think you were in NY. This hotel was excellently priced and the service was top shelf. I would highly recommend going back there for business especially if you are in financial markets.

title: does the business
desc: Easy access from the airport. All highway. Location is out of the shopping district, close to the CBD. This makes the Westin a good business choice. On the doorstep of Chinatown where some very good restaurants are situated in a cool historic setting. The Gym is the only real letdown. very limited weight equipment. Executive lounge very good, main buffet outstanding. So if you're in a hurry, want a Heavenly Bed and dont mind getting fat, this is the place for you.

title: Relaxing stay - dining options can be improved
desc: This was a staycation which was supposed to be done in November. But because my 4.5 month old son was down with pneumonia, the wife and I had to postpone it till December. We got in touch with the reservations manager as soon as we knew we had to postpone the stay. The team got back to us saying that the rate which we booked was not changeable or refundable, but because of my situation, they were willing to make am exception (thankfully...). And when the day to check in came round, we got to the check-in counter and the check-in staff (Wong Li Ling) was ultra-friendly and even asked if my son was ok. She even upgraded us to the premier room which overlooked the port and sea. We got to the room but the electricity was down so they got a electrician to fix it rather quickly.

title: Upclass hotel in Marina Bay area
desc: Stayed for business for 2 nights. As SPG gold member, were upgraded to corner room with a good view of the port and coast. The room is very well appointed - comes with a very nice tub, lots of places to hang your towels and clothes. The bed is also very comfortable. The pool is very nice. With a good length but the water is a bit chilly. The lobby lounge is chic and cool. A drink here is a perfect way to pass time and relax.

title: Very nice hotel, centrally located
desc: I'm staying here for work, and using it as my base for a weekend excursion. My room, which I understand is an upgrade, has a great harbour view. Service is solid, the buffet breakfast is very good, and the pool is stunning.

title: 2nd visit
desc: Visited Westin for a staycation with my newborn earlier and had a good experience. Thus, decided to return for a 2nd staycation. Had booked a deluxe city-view room, and was upgraded to a sea-view room, due to my SPG Gold status. Sea-view was nothing to shout about as the view was obstructed by the surrounding construction. The service failed to live up to the expectations, which I had from my first visit. We had arrived earlier, and was informed that the hotel was full and that our room was not ready. Thus, we headed out for breakfast and walked around in the vicinity. Upon return to the hotel, was informed that the room was still not ready, so I decided to wait at the lobby lounge, which was a nice place to chill. The front office staff advised that they would come over and

title: Great new hotel
desc: All things new are great. Located in the CBD area, would be excellent for business travellers. Club access always a plus with unobstructed view through the external glazing. Limited space in the mini bar for personal use. All charges in the minibar are automated, 15 secs that's all you have before it is charged into your account. Excellent shower with views available through a full height back external glass panel, two way views if you prefer. Prefer to use the blinds.

title: Very convenient location to attraction
desc: The hotel is nicely located in financial district , we are surrounded by splendid buildings , great architectural piece of art . The Garden by the Bay only 15 minutes away and the China town , plus all attractions along Marina way Must visit their infinity pool on 35th floor !! Please vote for me if you find review helpful

title: Reception on 35th floor
desc: I particularly like tall buildings, so having a corner room on the 40 something floor was a thing that I have truly appreciated. Rooms are large, bathrooms are insane, personnel very helpful, nice infinity pool. For me the stay was spot-on - the construction site nearby was a little noisy during morning hours, but it is not Westin fault (and they did apologized).

title: Love the lobby at level 32 and the room was spacious
desc: Stayed for 2 nights for a staycation over the Christmas weekend in Dec 2016. We received a wedding cake to celebrate our anniversary with a personalised card. It adds that little touch to their hospitality. The bedroom is considered big in local context for a standard room. The amenities are great, bar items that will be charged are marked clearly. The room we stayed faced the sea and a building under construction. The night view from our room is great. The bed is very comfortable. 4 of us (2 adults and 2 children age 11 and 4) slept on the king sized bed and it was not squeezed at all. We actually booked for twin double but was not given. Luckily the kingsized bed is already acceptable. The tap for the bathtub was faulty and we could not really enjoy the bathtub. That was a

title: A nice place to get-away in the concrete jungle of Singapore
desc: We stayed in the Westin to make our Christmas day more special. The deluxe room (there is no lower category than that in the Westin) was very nice, with a gorgeous big bathroom divided into sections, ending with a shower and bathtub and a floor-to-ceiling window viewing over the pool. Clearly that's lovely, but unfortunately not enjoyable unless you wish to give everyone at the pool a good run for their money. The bed, proclaimed to be "the best in the world" by one of my friends who was eager to hear my thoughts on it, seemed to soft at the start. I struggle with a lot of backache when sleeping on mattresses too soft. Somehow it however absorbed my body and provided sufficient support for no pain to arise whatsoever after the initial slight discomfort. Slept like a baby. The

title: Nice place
desc: Nice hotel and clean. Good location! Nearby is an MRT and food court. The rooms are spacious, clean and service is like the Ritz, but less expensive! One negative about it is that most taxis are not familiar by its location. It's relatively new hotel.

title: Leaves you wanting more
desc: Unfamiliar with the geography of Singapore, took a chance and booked the Westin to be pleasantly placed in the middle of Orchard and Marina Bay, perhaps closer to the Marina Bay area, off peak a cab there costs SGD 5.00? and to orchard SGD 14. In walking distance to the MRT station and the stop is called Downtown. However there is no direct line to the Marina Bay Sands despite the short distance. The Westin is in Singapore's CBD so you are pretty isolated from the mass amount of tourist which was a plus to me. There was a minor hiccup w the bed booking as I was sharing a room with my brother and even though in my booking records showed i had booked a twin bed room upon arrival they had told me that only king bed rooms were available but was informed they , all in all it was big

title: Great option for families at the Westin Singapore
desc: We spent a few days over the holidays at the Westin Singapore and were impressed. The service is excellent and never fails and the state of the rooms and public areas was impeccable. The rooms were large by Asian or European standards and had impressive bathrooms with a tub, stall shower and separate WC. The gym was very nice and the rooftop pool is spectacular and should be a real draw for families as well as anyone who loves the water. The location feels slightly isolated and dead on the weekends with a number of buildings around it under construction.
