However, the MRT is only a block away and it's a quick walk to the Marina Bay Sands and the Gardens by the Bay. In short, I wouldn't hesitate to book here again. While we used SPG points, the room rates seem more than fair

title: Great spot, amazing pool
desc: New property with beautiful rooms and bathrooms including a stunning stand alone bathtub with views over the city. Modern decor and nice ambience overall. The infinity pool on the 35th floor is truly amazing. Good selection of food/room service options although not really tried many of this. The location however makes it shine - close to Downtown MRT station, walking distance to Marina Bay Sands shopping and entertainment area, walking distance to the foodcourt at the Old Market and Chinatown. Very convenient for all types of travellers and had a lovely stay. Staff generally helpful and friendly and drain issues in the bathroom were swiftly and completely resolved. I can't fault this place.

title: Elegant, modern, comfortable, great location, service, restaurants, pool and spa!
desc: Stayed in this magnificent hotel for two nights. I was astonished at the awesome quality of the building, its design, finishes and amenities. The rooms were astoundingly comfortable, well laid out with huge bathrooms. Unlike the current trend to make rooms smaller, this hotel delivers a high degree of quality and luxury without the stuffiness. It has a really nice bar, a beautiful restaurant in the mezzanine above the lobby, a grand infinity pool with ample spaces to relax, a private full service spa with Japanese tubs, saunas, where guests can use even if they didn't book a service. It has a great gym, and a very nice restaurant bar at the very top. Moreover this hotel is in a building complex that adjoins a huge corporate center with a small mall full of bars and

title: Fabulous Hotel
desc: This a great hotel in an excellent position for exploring the sights and sounds of the city. The staff are very attentive and polite and nothing is too much trouble. High floors give tremendous views of the city and the Executive lounge does great breakfast, all day coffee and soft drinks and cocktails etc., 6-8. Recommended.

title: Very good, very professional
desc: Stayed for 5 nights in January. I've stayed at this hotel a number of times over the past year - good value (by Singapore standards!) and a very seamless experience. Rooms are good sized, comfortable bed, good shower pressure and well-set out. Enough space to work efficiently and stretch out at the end of the day. Gym is new, but small and relatively basic. There's dumbbells and a few cardio and fixed weight machines, but expanding this would be a highly desirable. Rooftop pool worth a swim in. Breakfast - relatively standard. The Exec Lounge is pretty quite, which makes things easier. The bar downstairs (Cook & Brew) - really good food (try the steak) and a huge range of local and imported beers. Close to everything. Will be back.

title: Great Location but Disappointing Views
desc: We were upgraded to an Executive room on the 46th floor. Our room was certainly large enough for two people, but the view we had was less than spectacular - a view of the commercial cargo shipping terminal. The staff were all wonderful and we really didn't have any problems but the logistics were odd. First, you enter the hotel on the ground floor but you then have to ride one set of elevators to the 32nd floor where the hotel lobby is located. From there, you have to take another set of elevators to reach your floor. I have to say however that the elevators were quite efficient and we rarely had to wait for an elevator. I'm not sure who designed the bathrooms but there are both cosmetic and safety issues. First, the floor is marble (slippery when wet). In addition, the

title: Great Business Hotel
desc: I have read other reviews on this hotel and do not understand . This is a fantastic 5 Star Hotel, I have stayed here on many occasions and find the service and staff to be wonderful. The rooms are modern and clean, the in room and public wifi works a treat. Great lobby bar with view over the water, pool, gym and spa on 35th floor are all good. Club Lounge is good for evening cocktails and they offer a limited breakfast. Room service is quality, served hot for a nice change. This is definitely a business style hotel located in the finance area of Singapore. Easy walk to subway and a little longer walk to Marina Bay. They do have a design issue with the shower door and water leaking onto the bathroom floor but on my last stay it seemed to be OK. For the first time guest just angle

title: bathing in the window of 41st floor!
desc: this hotel offered most of what a traveler wants. A great bathroom with a choice for shower or bath. In my case with room 4122 (in think) it was simply perfect that the bath was in the window overlooking the city. The rest of the hotel was also fantastic with attentive staff and a brilliant breakfast spread. We had a conference in the hotel and once again the service and amenities were top notch. The hotel is also within walking distance from a food market and it was easy to go to meetings from here. Next time I might want to book the executive lounge at it will make for a great one on one meeting place. The lobby did have ample comfortable seating available. the bed was simply wonderful and it was especially nice to have 3 layers to choose from. A sheet, a very light duvet

title: Outstanding Hotel: Modern, Clean, Sound Proof, Outstanding Service
desc: This is my top hotel to stay in Singapore. The rooms are very modern, spacious, sound proof and very clean. As a SPG platinum member, my upgrades are the best. The club lounge has the best service and food. The only downside to the hotel is that there are no restaurants near it and can get quiet on the weekends.

title: Five star service at a great location
desc: We made a last minute booking directly with the based on my good experience at The Westin in Cape Town . We spent 5 nights at The Westin Singapore. The hotel is new , it's located in the financial district right next to the Downtown MRT (Train Station). Originally designed to cater for the business market , it works works perfectly for family holidays as well. The service was fantastic overall regardless of who you dealt with. The facilities are immaculate. The property is first class in terms of room sizes, gym, spa facilities, swimming, restaurant, two bars. There are plenty of things to do around the hotel or just a walk from the hotel. There's food garden at its door step, Where you can choose from Korean , Mexican, Malay, Singaporean , Western cuisines. Chinatown is a 10

title: Financial district luxury hotel
desc: This is a 5* modern hotel in the financial district. It feels a bit impersonal but the facilities are good. The bedroom and bathroom was spacious, quiet, and the bed, pillows and bed linen are probably the most comfortable I have ever slept in! Arriving at 1am after a very long journey, I was a bit irritated that I couldn't immediately find the kettle and tea which most hotels have nowadays. Everything was 'hidden' away amongst the many drawers and wardrobes. My room overlooked a dock area and some construction - not the best - but I expect there won't be a view in a few months! WiFi was available, but the selection of TV channels wasnt great. There were some YouTube programmes but they seemed to be quite old. My main gripe was the cost of food - had it been exceptional, it

title: good for business travel
desc: I have no complaint about the hotel. it is a very functional business hotel in a convenient location. The room is good sized and the bathroom is huge, with a tub nice facing the window. My only suggestion is its breakfast. Given the price tag for the breakfast, I would have expected a lot more. The selections were rather strange and taste was mediocre at best. I would be happy to return to the hotel again but I won't pay extra for its breakfast.

title: OK hotel with disgusting customers and poor responses to complaints
desc: I am actually staying at the Westin right as I write this review and I felt compelled to share my experience. We were recommended by local friends to stay here whereas I was leaning more towards the Ritz-Carlton. I was not wrong. The lobby and restaurants at Westin are way way too crowded and there isn't enough staff to deal with the number of guests the hotel is hosting and its service very much lacks in finesse compared to the hotels that I have stayed in SGP. Moreover one of the main reasons my girlfriend and I decided to stay here this time was the swimming pool. It looked pretty decent in the photos and the facility itself is actually pretty nice. HOWEVER, yesterday as we were resting by the pool side and deciding whether to go into the pool... a male guest (I don't want

title: Awesome
desc: Luxury hotel with excellent service. Greet by polite staff, and I was surprise to get complimentary room upgrade. The room is spacious with separate bathtub and shower room. The pool situated at lvl 35 with given awesome night view. Overall a thumb up for this property

title: Modern luxe
desc: The Westin hotels rarely disappoint, and this was the case at this hotel. Checkin is on the 30 something floor, however there is help to get luggage up to the room directly. Rooms are exceptional, the views spectacular & the heavenly beds are perfect. The pool area is awesome and the infinity pool long enough to do a few laps in the morning. Food was delicious, loved the option to grab a coffee & pastry in the lobby before a day sightseeing. Less busy than the Marina Bay Area hotels, which is a nice respite considering the crowds to contend with. Highly recommend.

title: Modern Hotel
desc: We stayed at the Westin, New Year's Eve for 4 days. The hotel is situated in the business district. The hotel is very modern looking and the room was spacious too. Internet was not free as part of our booking which is silly considering most hotels provide free wifi to guests. But if you become an SPG member (which is free to do) ahead of time, you can then get free wifi in the hotel. In addition to this, as a member we received 15% off to use at the bar and restaurant which was useful seeing that the drink prices are pretty expensive in Singapore. Location: Although this hotel is downtown it is conveniently close to most places. We pretty must walked everywhere but If you're not one for walking there is an MTR that is very close to the hotel too. There's a really good

title: Lovely hotel. Panoramic views now not so Panoramic!!
desc: Good hotel close to CBD. You have to join the SPG member service to get the free WiFi. This is free to sign up. The "Panoramic views of Marina Bay" photo from the pool needs to be updated on the website. It is now misleading to to say that this is the view you get. This is mainly due to a new building now blocking the one part of the view. Shame!

title: LUXURY!!!
desc: This is by far one of the nicest hotel experiences I've ever had! From the moment you walk in there is always a friendly smile, and the staff always accommodating. The foyer of the hotel is impressive, very well done and the piano player is a nice touch too. We stayed on the 37th floor in a basic room, and we were amazed with the level of quality that our room had considering it was just a basic room. It was so modern and spacious, and the waterfront bathtub was divine. I was feeling sick during my stay, and they even brought me a pot of honey and lemon water to help my throat which it did. The complimentary bottles of water were a nice touch too! Definitely recommend

title: Marina view in a lovely hotel with exceptional customer service!
desc: Located in the Marina area and across the street from the subway ... Convenient to restaurants, hawkers (street food vendors), Marina building food court, and area attractions. Beautiful views of the marina from the spacious rooms. Exceptional customer service from everyone at this location. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

title: Business hotel
desc: Not too suitable for family with kids,it is located in the business district as well. Service is good, but sadly if you pay for an ala carte breakfast and ask for an extra piece of toast or two..they charge you!!! Unacceptable . The rooms and the bathrooms are spacious and clean . But they should remember it's Asia and Asian weather and people, so we expect tap/water near the WC !! Extremely inconvenient.

title: High level service
desc: Pardon my pun. The hotel starts at the 32nd floor and goes up from there. But no pun intended about the service. It started with the bell man. Who knowing we would be staying for 10 days, took one look at our view of the marina and called down to the front desk and got us a room on a higher floor with a better view! We were welcomed everywhere and always by name. Feeling special! Always feel like we are the most important people in the hotel, (we are still here). So many little things being done, like the people making up our room noticing how much decaffeinated coffee my wife drinks and adding more the next day, upping the number of packets. Don't have the space for all the details. Just know for us a great time.

title: Sleek modern rooms, first in class for its health focused lifestyle offered to travellers
desc: We enjoyed the modern and sleek rooms. The feel is more of a business hotel, and its close proximity to the local food court for local fare and some restaurants and bars is a plus. Staff are really friendly and always eager to meet our needs, and remember requests for the usual favourite room. The Westin is really impressive with its focus on health and wellness, down to their tailored menus for nutritious meals and educating guests on getting an antioxidant boost in their food. Other efforts include colouring pencils/activity to wind down and increase creativity. Certainly a great plus for guests. The location does not attract flows of taxis but the hotel is well equipped and happy to help book one for guests through the local taxi apps. The subway station is a god ten

title: Nice New Hotel
desc: Stayed only for 2017 new year eve after finishing the project in Singapore. It is really nice new modern hotel. Eventhought was not valued as Platinum SPG member as i stayed at other SPG Hotel (no upgrade and standard view). I was hoping slightly upgrade or at least standard room with good view. But anyway, i satisfy with the room quality (really comfort bed).

title: Magnificent
desc: The Westin was the accommodation during a DreamTrip and it was amazing. From the style and layout of the room, to the service and above and beyond hospitality of the staff to the grand selection for the (included) buffet breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel

title: Good hotel in CBD
desc: Stayed here for 2 nights. Location and property very new and modern. Check in was smooth. I requested high floor but as they were full they only gave me Level 36 keeping inmind reception was at L32 and the pool at L35. When i entered my room first reaction was wow nice view of the sea. After checking the other window i wanted to change room. My side floor to cealing windows was looking into the pool area. Where people laid down for sun bath. They could see into my whole room. Also my TV was not working. I called reception and they came up and showed me another room on the same floor. Which was much better did not look into the pool. had a view of the city and the shipping ports. We accepted the room and changed. The room was good size and felt very new. But the sheets had

title: Best hotel in Singapore
desc: I have been to all the main hotels in Singapore such as MB Sands (too big), Mandarin (needs better rooms), Fullerton Bay (too expensive) and in my opinion the Westin is the best. It is modern in style which may not be to everyone's taste but the rooms are large and luxurious with great views. Service is great throughout and has a good location. Food is only average though so eat elsewhere. Recommended.

title: Room at the top
desc: The Westin is well located for the Financial and Marina districts of Singapore city and is a short walk from one of the city's famed Lau Paa Sat hawker's street food hall. Check in was at 1500 however we arrived on an early flight and rocked up at the Westin at 0830. Our intention was to dump our luggage at the hotel and hit the city but to our surprise and appreciation they gave us rooms there and then without any extra cost or fuss! Nice gesture. Don't be put off this hotel by the nearby construction as it does not interfere in any way. We had a large, extremely clean and well appointed room.Very good A/c, Wi-Fi, huge TV, minibar, iron/board, tea/coffee, hairdryer and easy access safe. The bathroom is excellent with a luxurious shower, plenty of towels and toiletries. The bed

title: High Rise Westin Singapore Luxury
desc: A week for work in mid February this year found me at The Westin on Marina View, just on the edge of the Downtown business district and a convenient walk to wherever you wanted to go. The hotel is luxurious, newly fitted out and sparklingly clean. The staff were very friendly and always helpful. My club room on level 45 had commanding views over the marina. The bed was to die for and perfect sleep was had. The bathroom was as big as you could imagine with great rain forest shower. The club lounge open all day, served excellent breakfasts and coffee during the day, to be taken inside in the cool or outside in the steamy air by the pool. The pool was a delight for that early morning or late evening swim. The MRT was but a 5 min walk away so you are connected to everything in

title: A very good business hotel
desc: Spent five nights there with the family. The hotel is rather a business facility as a family hotel, but we have enjoyed our stay. A modern hotel with large rooms and a nice pool. The lounge is good, offering a variety of foods and beverages. Children under 16 are not allowed to access the lounge. The lobby bar is nice, the staff very friendly. Near to everything, plenty of cabs at the hotel available. Very good for a business visit.

title: An Unreal Experience
desc: I almost do not know what to say. My fiancee and I booked only one night at the Westin due to a long layover. The impeccable service we received from Ann at the Front Desk was only the beginning of our stellar experience. Our room (I believe we were upgraded to a suite) was phenomenal with an outstanding view of the city. But it gets better, the day we were due to leave to the airport we even were able to shower at the spa area after enjoying a day on Sentosa Island. When we come back to Singapore this Westin will be our first choice when choosing our accommodation. Thank you so much for having us!

title: good business hotel
desc: we stayed here for a recent business trip to Singapore. good service overall throughout the hotel. VERY expensive room service. reasonable prices and quality in the main restaurant. VERY expensive bar/coffee shop. good location for my office and little shops and restaurants nearby in the area. construction happening on one side of hotel. we had decent view of the city--- and on 32nd floor, which was nice day or night. but be careful with windows--- esp in bathroom-- -that look into other tall buildings very nearby.

title: Little Disappointment This Time
desc: This is my second staycation back to this hotel. I came once and was very relaxed ... and they have a great wellness theme going on so if I ever feel stressed out, I thought I would always come back. The first time I came was fantastic. Check in was a breeze. I was served welcome drink upon checking in. The room was great. It was really good. But this time, the experience was a little different. Although I did not queue at the SPG row (it had a patron there) and was immediately served by a lady, the check in process was extremely Long. Took about 10-15 minutes. And the patrons beside me were served the welcome drink and I wasn't served any while waiting. For 15 minutes, I was just waiting for the receptionist to wait for the system and tried to work with my debit credit card.

title: Disappointed with the hotel staff's rude attitude
desc: I am here to visit my Friends and we are going to have dinner buffet in Westin hotel. Other hotel staff been advised me to smoke just outside of hotel will do. While me and my friends getting down to first floor then we ask the first floor staff about where to smoke while they also said that I can actually smoke at the side of hotel. Therefore we start to smoke at the side of main entrance while this staff from security he came out then directly shout at us for not to smoke at this place. We was so shocked. He never tell us properly that this place not to smoke but just directly shout at us and chase us out of that place. You can actually tell us nicely which you representing your hotel if you noticed about this. We feel so disappointed and sad for the services of the hotel

title: Well-located, Great service
desc: We loved our stay at the Westin Singapore. The room was very comfortable and the staff were exceptionally professional. I enjoyed the nice view from the room and we found it very easy to explore Singapore from this centrally located property. The only downside was that the club lounge (which has a great selection of drinks and food) was off limits to our six year old daughter per the hotel's policy. Although the hotel did accommodate us and another family with a child the same age as our daughter outside near the pool, it would have been nice to be able to enjoy the inside of the lounge, especially when it rains (as it often does during the time of year we visited). I would definitely consider the Westin the next time I visit Singapore and recommend it to those who seek a

title: Disappointing
desc: This upmarket Westin Hotel in the business district does not live to expectations. My main issue is with the ground floor foyer & the 32nd floor lobby. Interior spaces seem cold & disjointed, notwithstanding the fine views. The music at the lobby bar seemed uncomfortably loud. It's a quiet fringe location at nights, with hardly any amenities in the vicinity On a positive note: one of front office staff Erin was exceptionally pleasant & helpful

title: Classic Westin - didn't disappoint!
desc: My room was large and the bathroom had a great view from the freestanding bath. Concierge and service was great, one of the largest pools in Singapore with jets. I can only fault the changing of lifts from reception to your room which is only minor. Downtown location was also handy for Taxis and meetings.

title: Great Stay
desc: This is definitely a business hotel located near the business district, Marina Bay Finance District. Checked in on a Sunday and was amazed that the surroundings was very quiet as it was located in the financial district. Thankfully, the food court - Lao Pa Sat where there is a variety of local street food are being served are within walking distance. Coming back to Westin, the rooms are great and comfortable. The toilets were great, with nice powerful showers for those who like it and a bath tub for those who want to enjoy a soak after a day out in Singapore. Buffet breakfast has a amazing good spread of choices of local and western choices and I like the variety of fruit juices that they offered. Good hotel to stay if you want to be near the financial district!

title: Huge, beautiful room! Great staff!
desc: The room is amazing, comfy bed, desk is huge, bathroom is beautiful!!! Property has everything you need. Concierge lounge attendants are awesome. Great service, attentive but never felt like they were "hovering". Big fan!

title: Excellent Business Hotel in Great Location
desc: This is an excellent business hotels that ticks all the boxes in terms of quality and service. Location is very good with lots of walking distance options to eat from food courts, hawker markets, and fine dining. Close by RMT station also a plus. Would return and recommend.

title: A truly wonderful hotel
desc: I had the pleasure of organizing a group event at the Westin in Singapore when it first opened. We were actually the hotel's first Group booking. I started communicating with group sales staff many months prior to their opening, and they were fantastic to work with. I flew in a few days ahead of our group's week (+) stay. I met with the sales staff, was toured around the hotel, met the chefs, saw the locations we were going to be using, etc. Our group had a welcome reception on the Sunday evening prior to our meetings in their lobby lounge area. The space was gorgeous, with a fantastic view. The catering was absolutely wonderful. The team breakfasted in the restaurant every morning before heading out to meetings. The first morning I went down early, one by one the team

title: Great Hotel Option
desc: My husband and I stayed four nights here. It is located in the financial district but is well situated for the tourist. We very much enjoyed our stay here. The concierge staff we wonderful in helping with luggage and getting us oriented to our room and to the area. We were greeted at check in with a nice cool welcome drink. The pool was a great place to relax with wonderful views of the bay and sea. The staff at the pool were very attentive. We really enjoyed having cocktails in the main lobby lounge which has wonderful views. We finished our stay with the Sunday Decadent Brunch. I've never seen so many offerings at a brunch, it was wonderful.

title: Modern and Comfortable
desc: Likes the hotel a lot, large room, big bathroom, very comfortable bed, Soft pillow and towel, good size swimming pool on 32nd floor to chill out in the afternoon sun and heat, love the convinient of its location, walking distance to Marina Bay Sand for shopping, evening music show at Garden by the Bay, Old Market for hawker food and satay, 2 MRT stops to Chinatown. Just perfect for our 3 days stay in Singapore.

title: Nothing special + expensive services
desc: Stayed at Westin for 4 nights for a business trip. Pro's - Clean + spacious room with very nice bathroom (we had euro tub with a city view) - OK view of the city but not much view of the Marina Bay since newly constructed high rise blocks most of the view. - Pool isn't bad, but not super big and view is OK (bit of city, bit of marina, and bit of high rise construction) Con's - Breakfast buffet was around $55 SGD for 1 person and it wasn't all that great to be honest. Yes, it's convenient that it's in the hotel, but price is pretty ridiculous - it's breakfast food and shouldn't cost that much. - Laundry is ungodly expensive - needed to some laundry but cost is more expensive than some of clothes themselves are worth - Location is OK, but not the greatest. You will need

title: I can't wait to return to the Westin Singapore
desc: We stayed at the Westin for 8 nights and loved every minute. We felt so taken care of. The hotel starts on the 32nd floor so the views are fabulous, especially in the infinity pool! Every day consisted of 8 am to noon by the infinity pool. We dined in the restaurant and enjoyed the buffets several times and the buffets are the best we have experienced! Staff are fabulous and we can't wait to return. Everything at this hotel exceeds expectations. We cannot wait to return in 2018. Every night when I went to sleep I thought "this is the best bed ever and I wish i had this at home"

title: Good Business Hotel
desc: I stay at Westins frequently around the world and this particular hotel is as good as any. Rooms are airy, fresh and clean with good showering facilities. Gym facilities are excellent with good views over the water as you train. Hotel is located in the business district and as such you are a little outside the city centre which I personally like and it is close to Marina Bay Sands and its attractions. Travel time from the airport was around 20 minutes. F & B options are good with prices as per other hotels of the same standard. Overall I would recommend the hotel for business travelers.

title: Good as usual
desc: It's my second time to be here in Westin Singapore, nice property as it used to be, convenient location, clean and well-maintained room and nice sea view. I stayed there during my birthday, and they hotel arranged a room upgrade and a cake for me. Though I spent just a little time in the hotel but I truly enjoyed it. Thank you Westin Singapore and I would love to be back again in the future.

title: Wonderful experience and extremely friendly service
desc: The staff for the entire 10 days I was there were beautiful people and really assisted us in all aspects of reservations, getting around, and making the most of our time in Singapore. The rooms were exactly what we wanted and the pool/view from the pool was incredible. If you are tossing up between hotels and you are considering the Westin, I highly recommend it.

title: The best hotel in Singapore I've stayed in
desc: Rooms are the best. Each room has a sizeable table so that can work productively. The bathroom is big with nice smelling bath accoutrements. One can rent a complete gym outfit for a very minimal amount, SGD10 I think. Their service is professional and courteous. Unfortunately, my schedule is always packed and I'm out most of the time. I see the nice pool which I don't have time to enjoy. Our regional office is just at the next tower and so I can leave my room 10-15 minutes before a meeting, giving time for the elevators and the registration at the office lobby. After my meetings, I usually go directly to the airport. The hotel books a cab for me and when I walk over to the hotel lobby, the cab is usually waiting with my bags inside. I just get inside and I'm off to

title: Great hotel and Service
desc: The hotel is great, staff are friendly and giving good service. The food are wonderful and especially the front office thanks for your service it's was excellent. Someday I'll visit this hotel again with my family

title: Relaxing oasis in the middle of CBD. Incredible service!
desc: I've stayed at the Westin quite a few times, most recently for a month. The views from the hotel are beautiful, and the service is everything you'd expect from a top Westin property - attentive, kind and professional. The team at the club lounge really made my time there, however. They were always positive, smiling, accommodating. Their cheerful presence really made my stay - thank you, Westin team!

title: Really good business hotel
desc: Beautiful hotel and great service. Check in desk was very helpful when I needed to rearrange the days of my stay. Rooms are really comfortable and new. All amenities are good in particular the gym and the pool. The club offers choices with food and decent wine.

title: Contemporary Offer
desc: In the business district, but near many attractions, this was a very comfortable stay. Pleasant and efficient welcome with SPG upgrade. Last night of a long special holiday which was acknowledged by staff with a lovely cake and cookies, thankyou, and late checkout. Great bed, linens, toiletries. Spacious room for a city hotel, with all amenities you could ask for. Club lounge is excellent with great variety of food and drink. Breakfast option in main restaurant or Club: great selection of food. Beautifully furnished with great views. Concierge very helpful. Staff throughout very pleasant. Lots of restaurants around the hotel.

title: great hotel
desc: Stayed here for a few days on business. Food choices at breakfast and lunch buffet are excellent. Have healthy options as well. Drinks at the hotel bar are expensive but that is to be expected. The service is courteous and attentive. There is some construction across the road but not too much of an inconvenience. No indoor pool but the outdoor pool and gym are great. Very good location near Marina Bay Sands.

title: Friendly Staff, amazing views ...... but expensive
desc: Located at the top of the tower from level 32 upwards this modern, beautifully decorated hotel offers stunning views when the weather is clear. Staff are helpful and efficient. Rooms are very good with an expansive bathroom and incredibly comfortable beds. There is also a decent workstation for the business traveller although the described lamp does not exactly illuminate the desk if you are working at night on paper documents (I wear reading glasses so this if more a but bear for me). The bathroom is really stunning as would be expected in a top flight hotel in Singapore (as is the high tariff). A very large walk in shower and a free standing bath (with a hell of a view) is provided. The breakfast buffet is diverse and what is on offer is good quality. Cost is an issue,

title: Lazy weekend getaway
desc: We booked a stay for a weekend birthday celebration. The weekend indulgence initiative is fantastic - we didn't have to worry about sleeping till 11.30am and rushing to check out by 12 noon - a quick call to check with confirmation that we could check out at 2pm on Sunday. Breakfast wasn't included. The pool's view is now blocked by an upcoming development, though you can still see the nearby port and islands. Room was spacious and bed comfortable. We could hear occasional noise from the port and construction sites nearby, but it was quite muffled and more of a "can you hear that?" Would return for another lazy weekend, when there are good rates. And a room facing away from the construction and port.

title: There's something WRONG with their spa prices; services mediocre
desc: Tried getting a deep tissue massage after a long flight. The pricing was completely incomprehensible: 30 min - SGD 80 60 min - SGD 200 (so 2.5 x the 30 min price) 90 min - SGD 260 (so 3.25 x the 30 min price) At every spa, the multiple reduces as you get longer massages. Not at this one. So either they don't want to really offer this massage or they are trying to rip us off. Either way, nothing heavenly about this "heavenly spa" at Westin.

title: Disappointing Experience at Seasonal Tastes
desc: I have stayed and dined at the Westin Singapore several times in the past. Great rooms, amazing view of the bay (particularly of the port!), but very average F&B offering. Was at their all-day dining restaurant Seasonal Tastes last night. Buffet variety and quality was very average. At 8:30pm with less than half the restaurant full, they ran out of sushi. When we asked for it, we were told that they were not going to replenish it (I have personally never experienced that in a 5-star hotel buffet before). I would have been more empathetic if it were later in the evening and if it were not a high end hotel. Food was also not warm. Teaspoons were nowhere to be found for ice cream. 2 of my dinner companions had an upset stomach after the dinner. Given how competitive the hotel

title: Great Downtown Hotel
desc: Stayed for a combined work & family trip. Excellent hotel and staff. The location is downtown (very handy for business), about a 2 minute walk from the downtown MRT station. Lau Pa sat (Satay) is within 5 minute walk. Infinity pool on the 35th floor (I think) was fantastic, with views of the bay. The hotel is located within Asia square, the larger complex contains a food court with Pharmacy and laundry/dry cleaner. In summary, convenient for both work and family holidays.

title: Relaxing staycation
desc: Went to The Westin for a 2d1n staycation. Situated in the central business district in Singapore, it was relatively quiet during the weekends. I stayed in the premier room located at the 41 floor with view spanning across the south of Singapore. Amenities included a swimming pool although it was small compared to hotels that I have been to. Lao Pa Sat Food Center was across the street which provide easy access to food. It was definitely worth the trip if you are seeking for a quiet and relaxed stay around Singapore.

title: Underwhelming experience
desc: Knowing that the Westin Singapore has a panoramic view at the hotel lobby and also Seasonal Taste which I decide to dine in and give it a try. Was kind of upset that the buffet varieties and quality wasn't what I expected prior to visiting the restaurant itself. After having my starter at the entrance area , i decided to have some oysters whereby I stood and wondering why the presentation of the sushi and oysters doesn't appetite me. As a worldwide hotel the oysters were placed on melted ice and only pieces of oyster around and I struggle to look for plate when the restaurant is not even full of guests. I asked one of the chef ( he doesn't look like a Chinese to me) and he tells me they are running out of sushi which is ridiculous and I need to wait for the oysters to be

title: Great Ambience with Marvellous Service
desc: We love seafood and cold platter in cook and brew!! Especially the oysters, lobsters fried behoon with pork belly. The young Handsome manager (Chandra ) who services above beyond expectation with excellent knowledge. Fantastic and absolutely great dinner with business partners over excellent restaurant.

title: Business or pleasure
desc: Westin Singapore is a perfect hotel for business, but also a welcoming and pleasant place to stay for any reason. Well located, professional staff, all amenities, great breakfast, great club and consistently great service. They treat SPG members well. We will be back-- and are looking forward to it.

title: Nice central business hotel
desc: Ok I don't like the way you need to get into 2 elevators to get out and charging $20 for internet is just not good enough. Westin need to fix this is they want me to stay in their hotels. I don't like signing up for loyalty programs. Otherwise a nice hotel with friendly well trained staff.

title: Spectacular hotel
desc: Everything about this hotel was on par with what you might expect from a hotel like this. The staff (front desk, concierge, waiters) was very friendly and helpful. The location is good if you wish to explore Singapore and you should definitely pay a visit to Lau Pa Sat and the restaurants there. The room was large (especially by city hotel standards), tastefully and comfortably furbished and in great condition. We had nice views over parts of the banking district and Chinatown. The infinity pool on the 35th floor is as impressive as in the pictures. The breakfast was varied and really tasty. All in all, a great experience and I'd love to go back!

title: Infinity Pool, Great buffet and sea view
desc: Was staying on 42 floor at Westin Singapore. The bathtub overlooks city skyline ;-) Their heavenly bed is super comfy. The breakfast spread is amazing. There's a MRT station within 2 minutes of walking distance. With Lau Paa Sat and Food Republic around, there's no worry about food. Worth a visit

title: Perfectly Nice -- Not Luxury, but a Great Choice
desc: I strongly recommend the Singapore Westin. I tend to hold my five star reviews for genuinely luxury properties (for instance the St. Regis in Singapore is just incredible), but for a business trip, the Westin is a great option. First, the rooms are of very high quality. Spacious -- and even as the hotel has aged, remains modern and very clean. The bath was also very modern and had better amenities that most Westins do globally. As an SPG Platinum member I had a welcome gift of cookies and was treated to complementary breakfast. Breakfast buffet was very, very good with a wide variety of both Western and Chinese/Singaporean dishes. A welcome surprise and certainly adds to the value. I'd be happy to return and strongly recommend.

title: Excellent hotel at great location
desc: Stayed here for two nights on a business trip. 5 minutes walk to the MRT Downtown line where you can get easily get to MBS within 6 minutes and Orchard in less than 15 minutes. From the hotel, it is walking distance to the Financial district and great restaurants and bars. I walked to both the great Lau Pa Sat and Maxwell Hawker place where they served delightful local cuisines. The room is very spacious as I was upgraded to the Premium room. Only drawback in the room is the lack of electric plugs for your gadgets.

title: Back again
desc: A bit aside but close anyway, nice rooms and a fantastic pool on the 35th floor, nice and friendly staff and great restaurant fro Breakfast, Excecutive lounge is big and spacious and lot off space. my second time here so i am very satisfied with this hotel.

title: An excellent business hotel
desc: I have used the Westin Hotel in Singapore for business trips many times. This hotel is located in a very convenient location close to the Marina Bay Financial Center and is within easy walking distance. This new hotel is very efficient with excellent. Functional rooms and facilities. I was a little surprised on my last visit that the hotel does not have a business centers however my needs were taken care of by the front desk staff free of charge and with no fuss. This is a great hotel for a business trip. I am not sure I would stay as a tourist, but it remains a very good hotel regardless

title: Good business hotel
desc: This hotel is on top of office buildings (the lobby itself is on ~20th story, if I remember it correctly). Has pretty much everything I expect from a Westin - a decent lounge, big rooms with the 'Westin' decor and helpful staff. The infinity pool and the views of the sea from the lounge are added bonus

title: Disappointing experience Seasonal Taste
desc: Decided to try their buffet lunch at promotional rate of $32++(normal $48++). Our drinking glass was dirty with stains. Seafood selection: prawn, crab claw, crayfish, mussels, lobsters. Seafood was not fresh and you can't even taste the basic sweetness that a normal seafood should have; The flesh is tough. Food selection is rather limited for 5 stars hotel. Sushi and sashimi were not fresh. The salmon was left almost untouched which is not the norm during buffets. Satay was not bad and chicken rice was good too. Sautéed beef was good too. Can't find any prata or nan for the Indian selection. Dessert was not too bad. Service was average. There was not enough saucer though it was only 40mins into the buffet. When patrons asked the servers behind the sushi counter, his reply

title: Faultless
desc: They say you get what you pay for spending a little extra to enjoy this resort whilst in Singapore was well worth it. Everything was quality from reception to the rooms to the infinity pool. We all had a great time. And what great views. Awesome in every way. Reception and concierge particularly helpful. Thanks also to Angela for the personalised welcome that set the tone for the rest of the stay and indicated that we had arrived somewhere special. Rarely do you stay at a hotel and cannot fault anything. This was the case with the Westin Singapore. Apologies for the late post.

title: Better suited for the business traveler
desc: I did not find the front desk staff to be friendly and inviting – their demeanor came across as stiff professional with a touch of curtness. I suppose they cater mostly to business travelers, we were there on a family holiday. Staff in the restaurant, bar, and the bell hops were much more friendly. The rooms spacious, very nice and well-appointed with toiletries and coffee/tea amenities. Beds are comfortable, the bathroom had a big soaking tub, with separated toilet and shower stalls. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Downtown MRT station and about a 15 minute walk to Marina Bay Sands. I would not recommend to families, but for business travel you will likely enjoy it.

title: My home in Singapore
desc: I come to Singapore anywhere from once to five times a year. My office is nearby. The hotel is very professional and nice. As the area develops, there is more and more to do in the area. It's not in the most hip area, but the area is evolving. I love watching the port. If you have business in the marina Bay Area, a great choice. Oh, and I like the juice store downstairs.

title: Good rate!
desc: My husband was offered a good rate by Westin. He took the offer and I am glad he did. Unlike other hotels, the main lobby of this hotel is on the 32nd floor. Nothing fancy about the place. The ambiance is business-like. What particularly caught my attention in the receiving area is the piano sitting in the middle of the room. Every night, a pianist plays lovely music to help guests relax after a long day from work or tour. The hotel is accessible. The taxi drivers know where Westin is. Always say Westin-Asia Square. It is very near the Downtown line MRT. Merlion, Marina Bay, Waterfront Promenade, Lau Pa Sat, Gardens by the Bay, Makansutra and Suntec are just stone throw away from the hotel. Breakfast is served at the lounge (35 th floor) or at the 32nd floor for non SPG

title: little disappointed
desc: Our first day to stay in Singapore, we booked one night only and almost 5pm to check in. The weather is still sunshine and we decided to go swimming for relaxing. So after we took the room card, we went to the room and lay down the luggage. After 10-15 mins around, we intend to change the swimwear in the bathroom. Suddenly, 2 men, wearing black polo shirt (seems they are house keeping crew) use their card to open my room door and prepare to enter. Lucky, my girlfriend was in the bathroom and I was near the door and taking swimwear at that time. I closed the door right away and we scared a little bit. Then, I open the door again and one of the men said because last customer lost his phone, so come to check is it leaving here. So he enter in and take a glance at the floor under

title: Average modern hotel for Singapore
desc: Modern hotel, good views from most areas. Well equipped gym and pool area. Clean room with standard layout. Average to low end room amenities. Well designed executive lounge with great views and food and lounge staff. As an intended long term guest was required to sign contract... Disappointing customer service from some very impressionable hotel positions... in summary, not a hotel I would recommend for business guests and positioned at very bottom of down town with lots of construction occurring close to hotel, not a great location for families.

title: Above and beyond a typical Westin
desc: This property occupies the top floors of an office tower right in the Business District of Singapore. From the software to the hardware, everything about my stay was perfect. The rooms are beautifully designed, the lobby is very grand, the general facilities are amazing. Rest assured, if you travel frequent enough and have experienced several Westin properties, I guarantee this is not an ordinary Westin. It far exceeds the brand standards and in fact I was told by some industry friends it is a regional flagship for the brand. I would like to personally thank Ms. Fiona Zeng (the Front Desk / Executive Club Manager) who went far beyond her duties to make sure I was comfortable, which made my stay an absolute delight.

title: First time in Singapore
desc: From the moment I arrived, my stay here was outstanding, and this has to be the best Westin property that I have ever seen. They upgraded me to an incredible room on the 46th floor with free executive club access, which had the most amazing breakfast offerings and an impressive happy hour offering as well. It felt like the property was brand new, my room was impeccable and the location is fantastic, just steps away from the Downtown MTR station and a delicious hawkers market. I will definitely return to this great property the next time I return to Singapore.

title: Be aware of thieves
desc: Poor experience. On the day of checking out from hotel was found out that money that were kept in a purse gone missing. The claim to the manager was raised and so called internal investigation took place, that expectingly didn't bring any results and the only advice was to raise a claim at police station, that wasn't possible due to short time gap prior plane. Didn't expect such a thing to happen in Singapore and especially in such hotel. Be aware of that fact.

title: Outstanding hotel in financial district
desc: The Westin Singapore is located in the financial district. It was an easy walk from the hotel to Gardens by the Bay, as well as, Chinatown. There is a subway station nearby. We arrived at the hotel at 8:30 AM and by 9:00 AM we were in our room. The room was spacious and had floor to ceiling windows that looked out at Marina Bay. We could see our cruise ship in the morning. The bathroom was huge and had the bathtub next to the window. The bed was very comfortable. We also had free WiFi. Our taxi driver suggested that we eat at Lau Pa Sat (festive market) which was just down the street. We had the very best chocolate croissants there. Right next to the hotel is the Food Garden. A great food court with outstanding local food. We found the staff to be very

title: Relaxing staycation
desc: Stayed in one of the rooms on the 39 floor. View was spectacular as it overlooks the CBD area and Singapore skyline. Room is spacious, and really cozy. Not to forget that they have a bathtub to end the tiring day. All staff are very polite and helpful. The Swimming pool is amazing, with a view facing the sea. Really enjoyed my stay and felt very relaxed. I would say this is a highly recommended hotel for business travellers though. Thank you Westin Singapore for the amazing staycation!

title: Nice hotel with great service!
desc: The Westin - Seasonal Tastes @ 32nd Floor Buffet was great, nice spread, great view, great & attentive service 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻. Seafood are fresh and pastries are delicious. Will sure to come back for more.

title: Immaculate and attentive service by hotel staff
desc: Dear Westin Singapore, With my recent stay on the 1st of April 2017 to the 2nd of April 2017, I wish to express my sincere gratitude and compliments to the service staff of the attentive service for a job well done at the Westin Singapore. I would like to point out several staff for the outstanding service rendered to me during the stay at the hotel. Li Ling from the experience desk, For reaching out to me and understanding my needs prior to my arrival and making sure my requests is well taken care of even though my request was difficult, you have delivered my request exceeding my expectation. Thank you for your service (although It wasn’t my birthday last week, there is a slight mistake there but hey, there can never be too many birthday celebrations in a year! Thank you for

title: Relaxing in the hustle and bustle of Singapore
desc: To be honest my husband is SPG member but we haven't not stayed at the Westin for quite some time. Only because I do the bookings and I belong to another rewards program. However when returning to Singapore to visit after two years we decided to try the Westin. We generally stay at the Fairmont because of the location. We were advised by 'locals' that this hotel was far from everything and better to stay closer to good hawker centres. Well in a nice way I would like to say the 'locals' were wrong. This is a great place to stay! A 24 hour hawker centre less than 5 minutes walking distance away (lau pa sat) and food court less than 3 minutes away and breakfast cafes that open at 8am!!! Let me tell you it is not easy to find a cafe that opens at 8am in Singapore. It was a restful

title: Typical Westin
desc: Typical Westin - immaculate service, attention to detail and excellent sleeping on the Heavenly Bed. My only negative comments would be that hotel was somewhat difficult to find for our driver due to some construction works happening around the building at Asia Square Tower 2. But this is only temporary. Also, the way the shower door opens does not allow space for a foot towel to remain at the base (minor but significant design flaw!). The addition of Shenton Way station (MRT) will be a bonus, even though Downtown station is currently only 5 mins away as well. The infinity pool on level 33 is fantastic.

title: Perfect Hotel For Business
desc: I was stayed Singapore for business and this hotel fit the need quite well. The room was large, the bed was comfortable and the views from the room were great. The bathroom was good with a lighted makeup mirror, separate tub and shower.The room was very nice and the bed was so comfortable! We had a great time at this high rise hotel! Good Service.

title: Decent location average service
desc: This hotel is well located for business travelers. The rooms and amenities are decent. I don't recommend it for leisure travelers as the services are very average consistent with Singapore standards. For example on arrival they don't have staff to greet or assist with baggage. They don't recognize SPG status for upgrades etc. I've stayed here around 20 times and never received one. And they are reluctant to resolve issues that may arise. Overall I do recommend for business travelers and who need a decent place to stay and good location.

title: Business rather than Tourist Destination
desc: The hotel itself was very good - the room was very nice and had a very comfortable bed. Food and drink was expensive. The location was away from the main transport choices of Hop-On Hop-Off and underground.

title: A special occasion
desc: After about 2 years, we have returned for a special stay. What's great about Westin Singapore. - Great staff and service - Nice rooms - Good lounge - Good restaurant What's not so good - The once amazing pool view is now relegated to a distant fond memory - Inconsistent breakfast policy - Strict no-child policy at lounge but family can sit at the pool area. So, the family was back for a special stay. Off from the start, property was very active in engaging me about my stay. On arrival, we were told that we scored an upgrade in view of the occasion. I suspect being a returning Plat might have helped some but regardless, the FD team and manager were top-notch. (THANK YOU). The suite was beautiful and the personal touches in the room were very sweet and heart warming. The wet

title: Nice hotel for a little pampering
desc: Overall, it was a very pleasant stay for us. There is currently a lot of construction work going on, so the while the location is near a lot of attractions, it's not exactly accessible. This also greatly affects the view the hotel has to offer — our room was at level 44 which potentially could have given us a fantastic view across the CBD if it weren't half blocked by a tall incomplete building. The service was impeccable, with little surprises planned for us after knowing we were celebrating our anniversary. We checked out slightly late and the staff were very forgiving for it. Our room was huge and very comfortable, with plenty of amenities provided. The gym was clean, and the pool was pretty. The pool was slightly crowded however, since it was the weekend, and that

title: Typical Westin experience
desc: As a business traveller, the Westin is centrally appointed to the city. All amenities are catered for, including a well equipped gym. Breakfast is overpriced in my opinion, and a quick walk through opens up plentiful local and cheaper options. Top tip: In room dining for breakfast is cheaper than the breakfast in the restaurant!

title: location is a bit difficult to find and the service from in room dining is very poor
desc: hotel itself is quite ok with good deal. location a bit difficult to find. the only complain from me is we ordered the in room dining and we find the food and dishes was placed outside the corridor until the late evening very return to the hotel. it doesn't look good and it will create hygiene problem. it is scary!

title: Great hotel that is more suited for business travellers
desc: We stayed in this hotel in May 2017 and below is an account of what we liked and not like: What we like: - The room is spacious and comfortable and comes with a comfortable lounge area - The room is also very clean - The view is not bad if you like sea view but still prefer the views from South Beach and MBS - The hotel's high tea is a must - love the lobster! What we did not like: - If you stay here over the weekend, this part of town is really quiet with not much to do because it is within the CBD but you can get some good local delights from Lau Pa Sat - Pool was cold and unfortunately not much of a view

title: Luxurious
desc: I stayed three nights at the Westin in May on a business trip and was very satisfied with the visit. It was easy to access from the Downtown MRT station, which will doubtless be even easier when some of the building in the area completes. The room was very spacious, with a great view across to Marina Bay. The in-room mobile phone was a great idea , as was the opportunity to hire running gear. I used the infinity pool on one of the mornings, which was a refreshing start to the day. The Staff were very professional and attentive, and it was easy to get a taxi to get to my meetings. The one criticism I had was the cost of breakfast – SG$52 is a lot of money, even if the selection is extremely extensive – you can only eat so much! Accordingly, I ate at the ground floor café on

title: Wonderful stay
desc: Stayed there for two nights on vacation. Was worried a bit as some review comments were not nice but I had a wonderful stay. Still relatively new so local people may misunderstand the location with the previous one. Good for a morning run around the bay and there's a hawker center in a walking distance too. The hotel upgraded my room and got a view. Potty I could not swim at the pool due to rain but want to come back with friends for it and try the restaurants.

title: Fabulous, sleek business hotel
desc: Stayed here for the first time on a quick trip to Singapore. My perfectly equipped room had a glorious view from the top floor (46). Even my bathtub had a view! The executive lounge is beautiful and they lay out a delicious buffet and a la carte breakfast. The location on Marina View is very convenient to much of what Singapore has to offer. Great gym. Impeccable service.

title: Would like to stay again
desc: Booked for 1 room via agoda and requested for 2 double beds thinking that there were 4 of us and 1 room with 2 double beds can fit us all. Arrived at 10.30 pm, a friendly staff at the entrance was really helpful with our suitcases. When we're checking in, the lady at the front desk told us that we cannot have only 1 room as the law said max. 3 people in 1 room, so we had to book 1 more room. Quite disappointing because I asked agoda days before and they said it can fit 4 people, but it was late and we thought okay that's fine, probably it was our fault for not asking the hotel directly. However, great room, clean, comfortable and quite large compared to other hotels that we had booked before. Wonderful toiletries and amenities. And the hotel is quite close to Downtown station.

title: A lovely stay
desc: We stayed for a week at the end of May this year as a birthday treat. A stunning hotel in the financial district of Singapore. We stayed on a RO basis but the hotel was directly next door to a food court where we ate breakfast most mornings as the hotel breakfast was very expensive - £6 for x1 bowl of cereal!!! I know Singapore is expensive but thought this was far too expensive for a bowl of coco pops. Was very close to Hawker centre where we ate most evenings- this place is a little gem. Very tasty food and very reasonable prices. The room was beautiful, overlooking the pool. Everything you needed, clean bedding/ linens everyday. Whilst we were there my little boy had an accident where we ended up having to go to hospital for stitches. The staff were helpful and gave him a

title: One of the best business hotels
desc: My place of choice in Singapore when on business. This was my 5th trip here in the last couple of years and would come again. The location is great as it's right next to most of the financial businesses in Asia Square and easily connected via MRT. The hotel is one of the most contemporary and feels new and swank. Rooms are very well decorated and excellent facilities including mini bar, wifi, TV, etc. Bathrooms feel luxurious with both a bath tub and a walk In shower. Clean and plentiful towels and toiletries provided. My room overlooked the container port and the bay providing a sea view. The breakfast is one of the best I have had across the world. Huge variety of cuisines are available to choose from including Singaporean, Chinese, Indian, continental and traditional

title: Dinning with A View
desc: Celebrated our 28th anniversary with my family at the Seasonal Tastes in Westin. We enjoyed a good view of Marina Bay from the restaurant on level 32. The buffet dinner is decent & of good value with credit card promotion. The management moved some kitchen staff to help with service for the Wesak Day weekend crowd.

title: Great area
desc: Our room was large,comfortable with views over the port. There are many choices of food within walking distance and the MRT rail just a few minutes from the hotel. We went to Gardens by the Bay a wonderful experience specially the light show at night and the flower conservatory. We also caught the MRT to a large up market shopping mall just 1 stop near the Marina Bay Sands hotel very easy.

title: Impressed by superb service to surpass my last visit !!
desc: I wrote in about my dissatisfactory experience at the executive lounge at my last visit over the festive period last year. They've invited me for another visit for an opportunity to change my perception. Their sheer determination to change my impression of them through attentive service provided by their staff totally bought me over! I had a nice cozy short staycation celebrating Mother's Day with my mum and I have the amazing staff at Westin to thank :)

title: Staying at the Westin Singapore
desc: The Westin is a very neat and modern hotel, It is however not a tourist or holiday venue. The hotel is however well suited for the business traveler, who want a posh place to stay. The rooms are spacious and very neat and luxurious. The staff is very efficient almost robot like, single syllable answers. The breakfast corner is the total opposite with interactive staff and very pleasant. There is no smoking facilities, except the restaurant , which is only available in the evenings. if you are a business traveler highly recommended but not for a holiday destination the hotel is well situated for exploring or shopping on foot.

title: Close to perfect
desc: If the location is convenient for you, I wouldn't recommend staying anywhere else in Singapore. The Westin is modern, clean, and has friendly staff. The rooms are well laid out and thought through (things are exactly where you would expect them to be), the bed is huge and super-comfy, the shower is hot with good water pressure, the room service food is good, and the workout clothes rental was better than expected. Bottom line, I will definitely stay here again the next time I'm in Singapore.

title: South East Asia Sojourn 2017
desc: We had an amazing stay at Westin Singapore. We expected to be modern and clean as it was NEW hotel but to our surprise, it was not only modern but very beautiful property. Love the location and convenient. Super friendly staff and excellent food. Club lounge is worth it as you can stop in and rest after the long day of touring. This property was best of several hotels we have stayed in the past. Like Intercontinental Osaka, and Andaz. I will for sure recommend it to my friends and will stay here again when I am back in Singapore. 👍🏻😎

title: Heavenly spa
desc: My second visit to this spa while is my husband's first visit. The service was still as impeccable and my husband was totally in awe by the sheer luxury and comfort of the place. we arrived an hour earlier to enjoy the spa facilities such as the whirlpool, suana and rainshower. We took the indulgence package which is a 150 mins of relaxation that includes a 30 min scrub, 90 mins full body massage, 30 mins detoxifying facial and hand spa. Will definitely head back again in future for another pampering treat!

title: 2 nights, quality all around
desc: Whilst a true business hotel in the middle of the finance/business district offers excellent rooms of high quality of comfort and style. Rooms were spacious and bathrooms clean and bright, ( although you might want to pull the shades down at night) Suggest ask for room overlooking the city as the marina area is now blocked by a giant high rise building nearing completion. Terrific breakfast with all you would want.

title: Great Staff and loaction
desc: Staff very helpful, great beds and room size. The included breakfast was a high quality. Pity that the construction of the large building in front is blocking out the view. Easy walk to Marina Bay and the gardens.

title: Excellent
desc: I can keep raving about this hotel. What can I say? simply the best. Love the room, the bath tub, the location is very centralised. The buffet breakfast is spoilt with choices and good quality food. The service was excellent from various departments (housekeeping, valet/concierge, front desk)

title: Great rooms and views
desc: Much more luxurious than some of the other Westin's I've stayed in. Large room, very clean and really nice modern big bathroom. Great views and very attentive helpful staff. Really nice outdoor pool and spa.

title: Dinner at Seasonal Tastes
desc: We have been at the Seasonal Tastes several times for dinner. Last sat again we enjoy the dinner. The seafood are fresh and wide variety of selection. Disappointed this time there was no oysters which is my favorite. Seafood should add Alaska crab legs to the menu. Desserts must try Gelato avocado and chocolate. Mango with stick rice was good. Quality of food was excellent. We had excellent food and service. Thank You!

title: 5 star Hotel in the dockland area.
desc: Stayed at the Westin for 2 nights and then again for 1 night in preparation for boarding Voyager of the Seas cruise in June 2017. It was luxury all the way. Bed like a cloud. Very clean and modern. Fabulous buffet breakfast and excellent Ala Carte meals as well. Very friendly and courteous staff. Its quite far from the Orchard Road shops but the Metro train service is within walking distance from the hotel. Several eating places around the hotel within walking distance. The staff will guide you with details.

title: Excellent location and great service
desc: The Westin at the Asia square is a very comfortable, new and spacious property. The hotel offers beautiful views of the Bay Area of Singapore. Walking distance from fine dinning and shops. The club lounge is spacious, relaxing and the staff provides excellent service. Common areas are spotless, rooms well kept and in general this hotels provides a great experience at a reasonable price. Gym is clean and efficient and roof top pool offers superb views of Singapore Kudos to the staff Would not hesitate to return to this hotel

title: One of the best SPG options in Singapore
desc: When the St Regis is costly or you would really value a club lounge, this hotel really hits the spot and fills a glaring SPG gap that previously existed for an affordable yet upmarket property from the hotel chain. The club lounge is high up in the building and offers a reasonable selection of food with the exception of afternoon tea which was probably the most scarce spread of afternoon tea I have ever seen in a club lounge - this would be my only significant area for improvement. The spa is great and the team were very good about fitting me relatively last minute. The front desk lady was very nice and accommodating. I was placed in a high room of very good size, both bed area with couch and the bathroom. The amenities were good - I wasn't lacking for anything. As with

title: Brand new hotel in the business district
desc: We spent 3 nights at this hotel and had a wonderful experience. The room was great, very clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful. The hotel is located in the business district so there's not much tourist action going around (especially on the weekend) but everything was only a 10-15 min drive so that didn't bother us. Taxis were always readily available and the closest metro station (Downtown) was a 5/7 minute walk. They have a cafe in the lobby on the ground floor which had good coffees and a small selection of snacks/breakfast items.

title: always a firm favourite.
desc: The rooms are a good size (corner rooms especially), the beds and linen ensure a good night sleep, the bathrooms are spacious and everything is clean and exactly how it should be in a hotel of this level. The staff at reception are always warm and welcoming. A special note to say that the staff in the club lounge are EXCELLENT. Always making a point to greet people, remembering names etc. The breakfast offer, and the evening cocktails are a great plus and well worth the additional cost of a club room.

title: Nice hotel with some view( partially blocked by near by high rises)
desc: Nice hotel in down town( Asia square), financial district. Great breakfast selection at the club lounge. Comfortable bed, spacious and clean room. Easy access to MRT and most near by attractions( Singapore History Museum, Peranakan Museum, China Town Museum, Gardens by the bay) are all within 20 minutes walking distance. Taxi and uber service are available. Taxi from Changi airport is around $20( 20-30 minutes depends on traffic). Public MRT cost $2.5- ( 40 minutes, requires some walking and transfer).

title: Nice hotel, professional service; good location
desc: Stayed at this hotel on two seperate visits to Singapore, and had a professional experiences both times. The hotel is relatively new with a modern feel and the lobby/reception is located on the 32nd floor. The hotel is located in the marina area with lots of bars and restaurants steps away. First visit I received a standard room with a king bed on the Club level. The room was nice but nothing special, bathroom was nice with tub view of the city. Club lounge was available for happy hour and snacks from 6 to 8pm, these times are to the minute and there is no flexibility. Breakfast is also available in the lounge, including an omlette station, local items, fresh fruit, etc.. Breakfast was very good. On my second visit I was upgraded to a junior suite which included a king

title: Surprisingly good!
desc: I never really considered staying at the Westin because its location didn't appeal for a staycation. Boy, was I silly! We booked in for 2 nights over the weekend as a treat for my son, and we got a lovely, lovely room upgrade upon check-in. I had walked up and asked to be upsold to a suite, and this great young man, Victor, told me sadly that no suites were available. Then he quite possibly saw I was about to explode with the 2 monkeys I had, and upgraded me! Thank you for that! Room 4219. Furnishings are corporate, so there's not much to say there, but the size and the layout were fantastic! I was quite sceptical because I really, really wanted a suite big enough to hide from my kids, but he said it was one of his favourite room types, and I could definitely see why. The

title: Excellent staff in luxurious setting
desc: We moved to The Westin Singapore from another 5-star property, and it was definitely a much better experience at The Westin Singapore. The Executive Club Lounge has amazing views and the staff are excellent, providing very efficient service with a smile. Food quality at breakfast and evening cocktails were exceptional for an exec lounge, and we have been to quite a few! There was a minor hiccup with a momentary loss of luggage, as our room was not ready at check in and the concierge desk held our luggage, however, the Service Express staff worked expeditiously with the bell desk, and any potential crisis was quickly averted. The "missing" piece was brought to the room in under 10 mins of the call. Bellman was at the door with a huge smile and a heartfelt apology. Wonderful

title: Great business hotel
desc: Just completed two stays at this hotel. This is probably my 6th stay since they opened and they are doing better with time. Some things of my favs: 1. Location: right in the middle of the business district, it is right next to the Downtown subway that gets you all over the island. Quite a number of good eats within walking distance so popping out for a quick bite is easy. 2. Lovely lounge with awesome views: nice happy hour with good wine and cheese selections, charming staff, and tasty snacks. The staff remember me from my last visits and help me check out from the lounge directly. I appreciate this spg platinum perk. Fiona the duty manager was a standout. For a business hotel, it has a warm and classy vibe - unwinding after a long day is a pleasure - I feel right at

title: Excellent business hotel
desc: If you're looking to stay with family I don't recommend this hotel. The area is part of the newer business district and so doesn't have much going on during non-business hours. Plenty of good restaurants and bars around the area but they aren't open on weekends. The hotel itself is very good, rooms are well equipped and modern with lovely bathrooms and views. Could do with a bigger gym area but you can always head out for a run or walk around the marina Bay Area which is very close. The pool area is inviting with a nice infinity pool but it lacks a bit in service and amenities although it's not designed like a resort so that's not unexpected. Restaurants and bars are nice with a good selection. Service is fast and friendly.

title: A paradox of awesome and good in singapore
desc: I will frame this as a business trip, and to an area I have travelled several times, but first at this hotel. A beautiful property, easy to get to FROM the airport (more on this later). amazing view as you go up to lobby on 32nd floor! Issue one for timing, is that you must change elevators at lobby to get to rooms on the floors above the lobby. so advanced planning is needed. Room is sizable and beautiful- i had pool view and it is a nice pool/pool area. nice bathroom with handheld shower head and rain shower. that is a nice touch. marble everywhere. incredible beds and pillows (yeah!) and quiet. The view is obstructed due to construction on nearby building (this will surely end at some point). Buffet is way over priced as i did not choose room that had breakfast

title: Great views and Service
desc: I stay here frequently for business. Because of my status I am always upgrade to an awesome suite with great views. The suite has a nice living room with min bar and espresso maker. The bathroom is large with a rain shower and lovely stand alone tub. They provide water and always leave a treat with turndown service. The hotel is very clean and the staff are wonderful, especially the Executive lounge staff. Even if it is months between visits, they alway remember me and what I like to drink in the morning and at cocktails. Only downside is sometimes there is a long wait for a cab.

title: Outstanding experience
desc: The Westin Singapore is a beautiful hotel in a fantastic area. The hotel lobby is up on a high floor of a tower, with the hotel rooms on the floors above. The suite was spacious with a huge, modern bathroom with tub and shower in an open area. Note that the windows are not tinted from the outside! So people can see youin the shower or tub if your don't close the blinds! The infinity pool is stunning with a great view of the marina. An easy walk to Marina Bay Sands (maybe 15 mins). I would absolutely stay here again. The only negative was that you can easily hear under the suite doors. Not soundproof in the least!

title: Great Room and Service
desc: Shout out to my friend Grace for arranging the room and Ms. Melanie Bolduan and the rest of the Westin Team for such an amazing experience and service. It is nearby Marina Bay Sands (approx. 5-7 minutes by car and approx. 30 minutes walking distance). Collect your points if you are a SPG member. Top quality.

title: Not much to complain
desc: Nothing to complain, except that it is impossible to have dinner in any of the restaurants after about 21:00, there is only room service. Breakfast buffet closes early. Room nice, reasonable size (in Singapore standards) with a real desk and seat. Too much gadgets, advertising, etc on the desk. Does one really need an hotel smartphone ? the one in my room had a very limited autonomy, not worth taking with me when going in the city. Light ok. Not central but a MRT station very close, connected by long underground 'streets' to other stations nearby.

title: Don't want to leave
desc: Westin is one of the best hotels I've stayed at in Singapore, less than 5 mins walk to MBFC and a 10 minutes walk to club street where you can find great food and bars. Received welcome drinks at the reception while checking in, got upgraded to a corner bay view room (the view was exceptional) spacious room, clean, great view, comfy bed with a small bottle of lavender essence oil placed by your bed. When we asked the lady from the checkin desk to print our universal studio tickets, she even reminded us to get express pass and gave us 2 bottles of water. Will definitely recommend this hotel to families and business travel.

title: Good business hotel
desc: Went for a business trip and Westin was the closest to Marina Bay Financial Center. Was not cheap to stay on another day on my own but I guess it is a 5 star. What i liked - located close to financial district, one MTR station close by, fairly large rooms, well kept and new. For local food, go north about 400m to Lau Pa Sat for a local food court, although its designed more for tourists these days - still not bad for local tastes and fair pricing. Downside - located in a business district meant limited food and shopping options if you stayed over the weekend like me. There is a large foodcourt next door in the mall, and the Wantan mee and Mexican food were good if not a bit expensive. The area is somewhat quiet over the weekend unless you only want to see Marina Bay Sands and

title: Convenient luxury in the heart of the city
desc: The Westin happens to be very conveniently located one block from my employer's offices in One Raffles Quay. This is an added advantage, especially, as flagging a taxi is not always successful in Singapore .The rooms are large and the furnishings comfortable and modern. One day I will make use of the bath in the beautiful and spacious bathroom. The staff are always smiley and helpful.

title: Elegant business hotel
desc: What an excellent location for a hotel right next door to Asia Finance Towers and MRT. I was impressed by the facilities and grateful for the room upgrade to the executive floor. My room was spacious, modern with beautiful views of the city. I thought getting a taxi in such a busy district would be challenging but the wonderful concierge proactively book taxis in advance for hotel guests waiting in the queue. The executive lounge was average and I was hoping for a better wine and snack selection during happy hour. I was surprised at how small it was considering it is a hotel catering to mostly business travelers. Overall, it was a wonderful stay and I hope to return again the next time I'm in Singapore.

title: It's not the best Westin that's for sure.
desc: All pretty ordinary really, just another big hotel but nothing that sets it apart which it needs to given its location would not be ideal for many.
