Service is very underwhelming particularly in the Club lounge, perhaps staff should spend some time at the Westin in Jakarta to understand service in a Club. Food offering in the Club is also under whelming when I compare it to others in Singapore or other Westins. Gym is adequate but always a shame when key equipment like bikes are broken and ridiculous drinking vessels that you can't possibly use while on the treadmill probably make the gym and OHS issue. Pool area is ok and the pool itself is perfect if you want to do laps. Would love to have had a massage but at that price it is impossible to justify. So just another hotel,

title: Weak management. Not coming back in short.
desc: Stayed here for 2 nights during weekend. Upon check-in, I was informed by the check-in staff that she would give me a higher floor room, however, it has a slightly 'narrower' windows. I was thinking, well, it is fine if it is just a little bit different. Unfortunately, the room was a inner-corner room, there is a windows (or i should use 'gap') with around 1 foot (or max 2) wide, with a curtain. Due to the limited size of the "window", the curtain actually not really movable and there is no other window in the bedroom, except the windows in bathroom and the corridor going to bathroom. In other hotel, it would be generally considered as "limited view" room. It was quite annoying, and the hotel manager was offering a room swap in the late 2nd day, but he did not really get the

title: Beautiful
desc: Very friendly checkin. The rooms here are one of the best. Modern and super clean. Really enjoyed relaxing in the pool and spa. Breakfast buffet in their cafe was great. Location is good. Will defiantly be back.

title: Top hotel in the business district.
desc: Brand new, with very efficiently designed room. Good service and fast checking. A bit far off nice dining options but nothing is far. Highly recommended for a business trip if matters to deal with in the area. Nice view from room too.

title: Room service needs improvement
desc: Great heavenly bed. Nice sleep. Spacious and quiet room. The drainage of the sink needs improvement. What disappointed me was the quality of the room service: I ordered room service twice during my stay. While not impolite, the persons who answered my calls could have been more helpful instead of voicing cold responses. E.g 1) I wanted to order for breakfast the dish that the hotel showed as image on the cover of the breakfast order form hung on the door handle (see attached photo). The response was: 'we don't have that, the picture is for illustration only'. - could the staff be more helpful and try to help me mix and match to come up with the dish? - to hotel management: pls remove this picture. You lure me into ordering the dish but you are not prepared to offer such 2) I

title: Great stay in the westin!!!
desc: The westin is very new hotel so all facilities are fancy. They have a great infinity pool so you could enjoy swimming with a nice view. Check in experience was good and comcenter was very helpful. We ordered breakfast in the morning. Food was good and fresh. Room service staff was very nice and assisted us to correct our discount bill. I will definitely stay in the westin again!!!

title: Good but not great
desc: Excellent location if you want to be close to financial district for work. Brand new in just developing central business district. Nice view of Marina Bay. Rooms a bit low in quality but then again I consider this as a business hotel. However price is not business hotel and on a bit high side - mostly due to its location near by Business district. Overall pleasant property but my personal preference is to stay at non business district since you can easily travel within Singapore.

title: Very good hotel for both leisure and business
desc: I stayed in the hotel for a few weeks for business, very pleasant stay. Staff are professional and efficient, I do laundry almost everyday, for those days that I didn't sent, they actually double checked if I need the service. Hotel is well located not only for business travel and also for leisure. The pool is very nice, but can get crowded when the weather is nice. Poolside service is very good also. Breakfast has a good variety. They do change the hot dish from time to time.

title: cold cold cold service
desc: was there for a staycation with my family, wonderful views and cosy room. however, none of the staff greeted us during our whole stay. we felt that most of them were unhappy, overworked or simply cannot be bothered to spend effort on locals? the male staff in jacket at the club lounge (8 Jul 2017 @1800hrs) was spending most of his time in front of the computer, did not greet and did not even offer to hold the door when my hands were full. chit chatting in chinese with his colleague seemed to be his favourite thing to do. poolside staff appeared to be unhappy with their job and they did not smile at all even when i was communicating or ordering food from them. staff serving breakfast were fine except for the lady who brought us to our table (9 jul 2017 @0845hrs) who make a

title: excellent business hotel
desc: For the business person this is an excellent hotel situated right in the heart of the business sector but with easy access to SMRT so visitors on holiday could stay there. Be prepared to pay for wifi. The restaurant was excellent, and the room was beautiful with fantastic views of the bay. Be careful when using the bar as it is automated and if you remove something to look at you had better put it back right away or you will be charged for it.

title: Grand hotel
desc: Facilities are good but wish the infinity pool is longer. Bed is super comfortable you'll struggle to get out of it. Wifi is free if you're a starwood preferred guest. But wifi for public (anywhere within the hotel) is good enough. The hotel is 3-5min walk from downtown line MRT, 5-10 min walk from Lau Pa Sat(local food haven). At the ground floor of the hotel is Daily Eats which serves sandwiches, muffins, cakes and coffee/drinks at reasonable prices. Outside is a food garden which is open during weekdays only. The best thing about this hotel is the staff. Cleaning staff is respectful and efficient. Special mention to Kevin Cheong who patiently showed me 3 rooms till I found what I wanted. Note though, that rooms with King beds have better view than those with 2 dbl beds as

title: Fantastic hotel - recommended
desc: I stayed at the Westin recently for just 1 night of a 5 night stay in Singapore (either side of a week in Bali). Otherwise, we had 1 night in MBS (always wanted to use the pool!) and then 3 nights in the St Regis. When I go again, I'd look to stay the whole time in the Westin. It's a modern, clean and comfortable hotel with well equipped rooms, a truly comfortable king size bed and a spectacular bathroom. The views are great as is the infinity pool. The hotel is well located for Marina Bay area. It's also very close to Lau Pa Sat and great for the street satay events. However, over and above the above, I have to single out the excellent customer service too. We arrived at the Westin after 20 hours+ travel from UK. Half way through check-in we realised that my teenage

title: Business in comfort but noise from the construction site was annoying
desc: I had a decent stay at the Westin Singapore. Note that the Westin has a really high occupancy rate throughout the year (it was overbooked for a couple of days during my stay) so you'll definitely need to queue for breakfast. SPG Platinum guests have access to the Lounge on the 35th floor. While I haven't had to queue to get in, the Lounge is pretty small and food selection is quite poor. If you'd like to enjoy your breakfast, I'd recommend going to the restaurant on the 32nd floor. Room Views - there's no sea view per se. If you'd like to face the sea, you'll get a view of the port (and Singapore's Southern Islands in the distance, which I enjoyed). However, the land parcels around the Westin are currently under construction and this can be quite noisy in the day. I stayed on

title: Not the Best but certainly one of the best
desc: We stayed here for business and for leisure. The hotel is located very close to the MRT, only about 7 mins walk to the station. The hotel is relatively new and it has a great view with sea view. There is a food court in the next office building which you can have good breakfast in case your room did not come with breakfast. Room: kept in top notch condition, very clean and very tidy. spacious enough and certainly with great amenities provided. I have stayed in many 5* or even 6* hotel, in terms of price and amenities, with what I am paying, it is well worth it. Toilet: It is very clean and state of the art hardware. water pressure is good. Bed: very comfortable and not so hard. concierge: They are all very helpful and very friendly. I was having trouble with my prepaid

title: Fantastic with good location and lovely staff
desc: First, i was greet by a lovely lady called Chris with her big smile, she was expecting me cos they had a surprised for me cos i was celebrating my wedding anniversary. Upgrade our room to premier corner room. Hotel arranged a romantic decoration. Super happy with it. Room is big and clean, heavenly bed is always so comfortable, that you don't feel like to get up every morning. Housekeeping did her job well everyday. I feel so relax.. Breakfast is excellent and lots of variety. Club lounge ladies is so caring and nice, had my teeth extraction that day, she quickly gave some ice water for my swelling, Before we went for our heavenly spa, we have our own time in the Jacuzzi hot tub with an extraordinary view. Heavenly spa therapists can be better. Food in Cook and Brew is awesome.

title: Great location & rooms, but pales in not a great deal
desc: New hotel with all the fancy controls for lighting & curtains. Lobby on the 32nd floor offers a good view. Got a corner room likely due to my Lifetime Gold SPG membership. No complaints with various services & amenities. I was offered various newspapers for the next morning at check-in, and I asked for 'Financial Times'. As soon as I got into the room, I received a call from reception asking me if I mind paying a fee for the FT, or I may choose a local paper for free. In all the 30+ years of travel, I have never encountered such an incidence, and was surprised it happened at a 5-star hotel in a place like Singapore. I certainly 'minded', and declined. The next morning, I had guests over for a working breakfast. The four buffet breakfasts costed over SGD200 (or around USD40 per

title: The great service and food
desc: My opinion to find modern high tea in Singapore , that is 1st time I had a great seafood champagne high tea at Westin Lobby lounge .They serve food by courses and the best is fresh oyster and lobster .The furnishing were luxurious and the ambiance of view is nice .we get the big Birthday surprise from service staff when they bring out the Birthday cake for us , all service staff was great and made us have a great weekend.will be back again

title: Birthday Surprise Celebration at Seasonal Taste
desc: Was moved to the proper seat by the window by Ms Nui as requested. Its a very good experience with her around giving us the best service she can. Great food and enjoyable view to have dinner here, we will recommend this place to our friends.

title: Well located with beautiful rooms
desc: Our room had a great view over the Financial district. We used the free wifi, which was great. The pool was excellent, perfect temperature. The bathroom was spectacular. For those not on business, ie on a budget, you can eat very cheaply and very well at Lau Pa Sat which is a 3 minute walk away, or at the food court next door. Both were fantastic. Don't even think about drinking wine in Singapore if you are on a budget! Prices are ridiculously expensive, 80sd for a bottle of very ordinary australian wine. It's close to an MRT station, and you can walk to Marina Bay and Gardens by the Bay, if it's not too hot. Taxis are a good option also as they are cheap and plentiful. Not a lot of shopping in the immediate vicinity, so get a taxi to Orchard Rd. Our booking.com voucher said

title: Overnight stay staging through Singapore
desc: Treat yourself to some luxury and wonderful service. Snuggle into your amazingly comfortable bed and look out over beautiful Singapore. Rooms are generous, facilities excellent and service first class. Lots of great food options as well. Don't miss a dip in the Infinity pool, it's small but the view over the harbour is beautiful. Can't recommend this hotel highly enough, we had a wonderful stay and I'll be going back again.

title: Good Room, Courteous Staff
desc: Excellent room, large, ample amenities like the infinity pool and the modern gym makes it a good place to stay.... The executive lounge serves an wide array of drinks for the evening cocktail session Swimming at the inifinity pool overlooking the office building @ 35 floor takes away all the stress. Special thanks to Candy at the Hotel Lobby lounge for her hospitality

title: Terrible experience
desc: The hotel location is easy access for banking sector.except this I can't say a single good thing about this hotel.from the ground level if you want to access your room you have change 2 lifts it takes 5 min to reach your room.the service is very worst.i have requested for a extra bed called them for 5 times every time waited for 5 min no one was there to respond finally I got a msg that duty manager will call you for a room change and extra bed why be wants to call a guest.at the end I didn't got my room changed.they gave a reply that we were waiting for your call up I didn't call us I said yes that's my mistake at least send me a blanket I can lie on the floor even that they didn't gave me.i requested the house keeping guy to bring me a blanket very good service never expected

title: Great family hotel.
desc: We stayed at the Westin for 6 nights and it was one of the best hotels we've stayed in as a family. Great location, with the food garden right next door and easy walk to the MRT and Marina Bay, which we did most days. Hotel Room was big and of a very high standard. Staff were wonderful, very attentive and helpful with all aspects of our stay. My 6 year old son enjoyed the wonderful roof top pool, and my husband and I enjoyed relaxing with a cocktail, as he happily played! The bar - Cook and Brew is child friendly and made us welcome. A wonderful holiday made so, not only by being in wonderful Singapore, but the hotel experience too. We will definitely return!

title: Great stay, but more suited to business stays
desc: Rooms/hotel were impeccably clean and roomy- especially as we had a baby with us. The room was very quiet and air con was great. Relatively easy to access from the MRT and hawker centre/shops close by. We ate breakfast at the hotel and the staff were absolutely lovely and accommodating of our small babe. Room service was average and very expensive. The pool was a massive let down, especially after reading it is one of the best in Singapore. I'd say the Park Royal on Pickering is still the best pool apart from Marina Bay sands in Singapore. I found checking in and out a little impersonal- especially as this was a family Holiday not a business trip. Overall it was a lovey stay, and would stay here for business but would opt for someone else for another family trip.

title: Excellent property and service
desc: I stay at many Starwood properties, and I want to give special credit to the front desk staff and the Executive Lounge staff for making my stay enjoyable and pleasant. In particular, the front desk accommodated my very early check-in and I was upgraded to a lovely harbor view room, and the staff in the lounge (along with food and drink) were really top notch and attentive. I would recommend this as a business hotel in particular, although I was there on holiday and it is quite convenient to MBS and to the MRT Downtown station, as well as many restaurants and bars.

title: Spare me for this but the review is on the spa only
desc: The Spalicious spa is the heaven of the Westin, sadly it is quite small with a Jacuzzi and a "rainbath" (that has not much of an impact) but its massage service is professional and good. The healthy meal provided in my package at its club is the bonus! Its resting area should have better beds design for resting or lying straight instead

title: Fantastic Stay
desc: Just completed a 3-night stay at the Westin. I don't like to use the word "typical" in a review, except perhaps when writing that our stay was marked by the typical excellence of a Westin. Outstanding service coupled matched to lovely rooms are the hallmark of every Westin, and the Westin Singapore did not disappoint. Located in a business district, the vibe of the hotel is considerably quieter on the weekend than on a weekday, with many of the co-located eateries closed for the weekend. Not to worry, however, as the onsite restaurant and room service are outstanding, and the property is an easy walk to many restaurants, major sites, and two MRT stops. Tip: book a rate that includes breakfast, as the buffet is ample and diverse, but pricey (it is a Westin, and it is in

title: Comfortable hotel in Singapore
desc: I stayed two nights at The Westin during my business trip to Singapore. It is conveniently located within a 15-20 minute drive from the airport and within the financial/business district of Singapore. I was booked in a room in the executive floor of the hotel which offered a separate lounge for guests on that floor with complimentary breakfast. The rooms are spacious and the bed was really comfortable. The bathrooms have all the usual amenities and have both a bathtub and a shower room. I also visited the spa for a massage which was very enjoyable and the pool on the 35th floor was nice. Overall a comfortable hotel to stay in in Singapore and would not hesitate to come back.

title: Modern, Breathtaking and Top-Notch Hospitality
desc: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights in August and had a wonderful time. The rooms are new and have breathtaking views with floor to ceiling windows and even a awesome tub placed right up against these windows in the bathroom. They thought of a lot of great details when putting together these rooms and it shows. The big bonus was that on our last day, we had to check out at noon but our flight was not until midnight. I spoke with the hotel at checkout and was told we could return for our bags, take a shower, even take a dip in the infinity pool before heading to the airport. When we arrived later to do so, we not only took a dip but were given access to the spa area even though wee had checked out hours before. What a perfect way to get on a plane from hot Singapore.

title: Stopover in Singapore
desc: Beautiful room and great service. Unfortunately one member of our family became very ill with food poisoning shortly after eating brunch in the main restaurant. Check-in and bag delivery was a little slower than expected but the staff was very apologetic.

title: Quick stay at the Westin
desc: We had a 2 night stopover in Singapore before heading back home to Canada. After looking at all the hotels, I decided on the Westin (also because I am a SPG enthusiast). Check-in was great but the only issue was that I would not be earning points due to booking via a third party site. The room was great, clean and modern - amazing bathroom! The hotel is located in the CBD and located close to MBS.

title: Amazing hotel
desc: Amazing hotel. Quiet surroundings, a very warm and friendly front desk associates. Very refreshing welcome drinks. Our room has a great city view and the size is awesome for the 3 of us. Love the bed!!!

title: Nice modern clean hotel
desc: Westin is a relatively new hotel in Singapore terms. Rooms are clean and fresh still. Standard rooms are average size. Location is a bit out of the way for holiday stays, ok for business. Value lets it down as it is fairly expensive compared to other good offerings in Singapore.

title: Ideal location for a city break
desc: We were impressed with the Westin in Dubai so we thought we'd try this one and were not disappointed. The accommodation is very comfortable and the staff are excellent as you would expect. One note of caution we checked in late at night and were persuaded to sign up for the executive lounge as an extra. Being tired I must have misheard the price quoted because I was a little shocked when we came to check out. In fairness they did offer a discount but it was a somewhat embarrassing episode. The lounge is very good (service slow when we were there) but rather expensive if all you want is breakfast. Not to end on a negative note, my wife and I would recommend this hotel.

title: Lovely stay
desc: Stayed at The Westin for an overnight stopover coming home from Europe to Australia. We arrived late in the evening with very helpful staff making check in easy after a long flight. The rooms we great, very comfortable and spacious. Had the order room service as there was really nothing around the hotel open at that time as the hotel is in a business district. Breakfast the follow day was okay, choices are not the best I've ever had but the omelettes are nice. The pool area is on the roof, even though it's small it had a great view of the Bay and cityscape. It was lovely and quiet the day we were there so great for us. Overall it was a nice stay for a quick stop over or business, but if you want to go to Singapore for holiday perhaps try somewhere else.

title: Staycation
desc: Nice hotel with Excellent View which located at strategic area. The room is big, varieties of dining options which I will recommend the Cook & Brew!! nice atmosphere with the lounge in front follow by the spacious dining hall.

title: Terrific Hotel
desc: I stayed at the Westin Singapore in September 2017 while speaking at the Asia Pacific Fixed Income Leader's Summit. Westin, Singapore is a wonderful hotel, especially for the business traveler. The staff of the hotel were very helpful and courteous. In particular, Fiona Weng (I hope I got the name right) of the Reception went out of her way to help me get a room of my choice. # 3903 is a superb room with very pleasant views of the Singapore Marina and sea port. It helped me relax and think while preparing for my talk at the Conference. Truly great experience. Strongly recommended to anyone travelling to Singapore for business. Ask for Rooms ending in 03 or 05 if you like water views.

title: Great base for the F1
desc: I stayed in a club room for 5 nights with a friend for the Grand Prix. The room itself was lovely, large, spotlessly clean with an amazing bathroom. The view from the bath was unbelievable. The service in the club lounge was great. A good selection of food and drink in the evening and I thought the breakfast choice was quite extensive in comparison to other lounges I have previously used (The breakfast in the main restaurant was very good). All of the staff were polite and attentive. The pool area was nice but we didn’t have much time to use it. Only downside here was that the drinks service was a little slow. If you are visiting for the F1, it was a short walk to gain access to the circuit and a good base. There is a MRT station very close by and it was a pleasant walk

title: Great Property Excellent Business Stay
desc: The room was fantastic. I admit to enjoying SPG benefits but this time they did spoil me with an upgrade to a corner room. The property is new so all the amenities in the bedroom, bathroom, toilet and lounge room were in order, good condition and functioning. If you had a busy day and just wanted to relax and rest without the hassle of messing around with malfunctioning equipment, this appears to be a great place. I hope this would have been the case even without the upgrade. The lobby is on the 42nd floor and offers good security. It's nicely laid out with the check-in reception to the right and a comfortable bar to the left. There is also a seating area shaded from the elevators. I did not have time to try-out the restaurant but did have breakfast at the Seasons restaurant.

title: Singapore Stay
desc: We stayed at the Westin for a few days leading up to the Grand Prix, so Singapore was extremely busy. In spite of the hotel being fully booked the staff and service was outstanding. Nothing was too much trouble. Room was very clean, comfortable and spacious. Breakfasts were outstanding. There was so much choice and staff were there to help and please. We can't say enough about this hotel.

title: Mind Blowing! Faultless!
desc: Unfortunately for us, we ended up here by accident and not design. The staff - particularly at Check-in were nothing less than BRILLIANT! He was friendly and efficient and had excellent local knowledge. As he had "inconvenienced" us by keeping us waiting for 30 minutes for our room, he upgraded our room - WOWSERS! I've stayed in some very impressive hotels but this was just something else! Beautifully appointed, amazing fixtures and remarkable attention to detail (like the complimentary lavender oil on our bed to help us get a good relax!). The Check-in staff brought our key up to the pool to us with a smile on his face and truly made us feel that nothing was any issue, even walking us to the life. A true asset to the Westin. We had a leisurely midday checkout and we

title: Outstanding Servive
desc: A big shout out to Patrick from the Executive Club Lounge and Darmen from the Seasonal Taste restaurant Level 32 - Both gentleman were outstanding in their capacity to engage, tell a story or two about the local area and ensure outstanding dining experiences. Thanks guys and keep up the great work Simon @ Anick Bradstock Sydney, Australia

title: Excellent stay
desc: Stayed here in the business district for a conference at Marina Bay. Close to everything, friendly staff, easy to get around. Transport system literally just outside. Great local food less than 5 minute walk

title: Stunning
desc: This is a beautiful hotel. We stayed two nights for the grand prix. The room was a nice size and king bed very comfy. Our son slept in a roll away. The view from the room was stunning. It also was from the lobby bar on level 32. We ate both days from the Seasonal Taste restaurant also on 32. Good value for a sensational buffet. Definitely try eating here. Great views from the infinity pool and very relaxing. It deserves the 5 rating. Only downside was that I didn't receive any SPG points as I booked through Expedia. It was $200 per night cheaper than booking as a member and so I couldn't walk past it. Spent well over $2000 for two nights to not earn points isn't really fair in my opinion.

title: Corporate Private Lunch
desc: Went to a corporate presentation, where a Chinese lunch was served. The facilities are commendable - sober décor, good acoustics and lightings. The food is not great, but above average for a corporate event at a 5* hotel. Service is a bit haphazard, especially since it was not a huge affair (8 tables with 60+ pax): some waiters are forgetful of requests, refilling of tea is slow. Convenient location for corporate lunches in the CBD.

title: High tea at the lobby lounge
desc: It was my first time having high tea at the lobby lounge. Overall, I'll give 5* for the food, ambiance and customer service. Our compliments go to ms. Silvia who has been a great service crew. She is attentive and helpful with our request especially we dine with 3 young kids.

title: Restful Staycation
desc: My brood of 3 young kids spent a pleasant and restful weekend at The Westin. Check in and out were a breeze thanks to effective, efficient, warm and sincere staff, an increasingly rare find in Singapore. Rooms were tastefully decorated and the unfettered view of the port area was refreshing. Buffet dinner at Seasonal Taste was excellent and relatively inexpensive because of ongoing promotions. My wife and I enjoyed late night drinks at Cook and Brew. A pre- check out quick dip in the infinity pool on the 35th floor was memorable, especially for the kids. Carpark charges, although complimentary, were just over $5 for overnight parking!

title: Exceptional service
desc: We stayed here for a long weekend to attend the Grand Prix. This hotel exceeded all expectation, from the oversized rooms and bathrooms with floor to ceiling windows and thoughtful electric privacy shades to the impressive 35th floor infinity pool. The club lounge was comfortable and held a wide variety of snacks and drinks; well worth the price! The location is fantastic; in the Marina area and close to the Downtown subway station. The AC cranks (and you will need it and use it!). What really stood out was the sincerity of every employee we came into contact with. Each and every person was genuinely hospitable and went out of their way to greet us warmly. Every request was met with a gracious smile. Even more impressive was that they were sold out for the weekend with

title: No Complimentary Car Parking and Wifi for Hotel Guest
desc: The reason we booked this hotel because recommended by Singapore office staff said just across the street is the new office. We drove from KL, Malaysia, when upon checked in the hotel and asked the staff then only shocked to found out there was no free car park and wifi for hotel guests. And the parking rate was SGD7/- per HOUR. It was too bad we alr parked the car at L5 @ hotel parking and my husband alr started his meeting and I couldn't move his car because car key with him. By the time he finished his meeting already almost 5pm, total it costed us SGD43. We do not hv enough cash inside the cash card. The hotel staff also given us wrong information said can top up cash at L5 hotel parking. Unfortunately the machine only can use Spore's ATM card or Singapore Citibank credit

title: Superb Hotel
desc: Fabulous stay at the Westin .. loved every minute! Bedrooms and bathrooms lovely and spacious.. fab bed and pillows (we didn't want to get up!) .. we ate in the restaurant a couple of times and weren't disappointed with the food .. prices fairly typical of a 5* hotel .. breakfast was good .. plenty of choice no matter what nationality .. all the hotel staff were extremely polite and courteous and nothing was too much trouble .. a special mention to Candy Lee in the Lobby Lounge for looking after us so well!

title: Immaculate Service, Luxury & Relaxation
desc: I have taken a few weeks to reflect on my recent stay at The Westin Singapore, as it was so impressive! I travelled to Singapore for a week (with my 2 children who are 7 and 8 yrs old) for their first overseas trip. We stayed in a different (inferior) 5 star hotel for the first 2 nights and then at the Westin for the last 3 nights. Suffice to say, I was so very glad I had booked the Westin for those 3 nights! From the check-in experience through to the General Manager seeing us off on our departure, the service and experience at the Hotel was faultless. My kids continue to speak about the hotel (and the service) and how it was (in my son's words) - "Double Time Luxury". The check-in process in the gorgeous Lobby area was relaxing from the moment we walked in. We were

title: Weekend with my family
desc: We spent the week end at this hotel couple of weeks ago. Big rooms, nice views, and very nice food. It was very relaxing. Our daughter loved the bed! And we had a great time and enjoy a lot! Will come back again.

title: Grand Prix visit
desc: Ok. It's a pretty classic international brand hotel. Clean and tidy as you would expect. Instructions on how to use the lifts would help. Very helpful staff to be fair. One small hiccup with room make up that was sorted out but not good to cone back to at midnight. A simple check on the room List should have told them there was a problem looming. Good side room and great facilities on offer we did not use. All staff were really helpful.

title: Great hotel with great additional services - definitely use the Run Concierge
desc: Stayed at the Westin for a week on business recently and can't recommend highly enough. Great staff, nice pool, gym does the job, in-room dining super fast to deliver. The absolute standout, however, is the Running Concierge - a guided run twice mid-week plus an 8am Saturday. Eddie was perfect to run with, pointing out landmarks, giving tips and generally helping me run a great deal further than I would have on my own. Will definitely stay again.

title: We had a brilliant stay
desc: We stayed at the Hotel for the F1 and our 10th Anniversary. The Hotel is in a good location near to Marina Bay. It is close the the MRT which has excellent connections throughout Singapore. All the staff were very friendly and welcoming and made our stay special with extra little treats. The staff in the Cook and Brew Restaurant are particularly friendly and helpful especially our Waiter Hun. The food is excellent - we can definitely recommend the Rib Eye Steak, the cocktails are also particularly good. Our room was very clean and the bed was especially comfortable. We would definitely recommend this Hotel for a stay and look forward to a return visit. Ron and Susan Hession

title: Superb Hotel
desc: Hard to think of anything negative to say about this hotel. Service was first class, the buffet style restaurant food was excellent and it has a nice informal bar. Also a very good location. It was very busy as F1 in town, so a late check out was not possible, but you can use the Spa to get a pre flight shower. Not exactly cheap, but felt like value for money

title: Fantastic new Westin in Singapore
desc: This hotel wasn't open last time I was in Singapore, but I wish it was. Hotel is very modern, amenities are fantastic, top notch service and a great location. The outdoor pool has a great view of the city. Kid friendly. The club lounge has a fantastic breakfast as well as drinks and appetizers from 6-8 with complimentary alcohol. Overall it is one of the best Westin Properties I have stayed at.

title: Great customer service, amazing bed and pillows
desc: Great view with amazing bed and pillows. Shoutout to Ann Varghese who attended to us at the front desk with stellar service and a beautiful smile. Executive club lounge spread was amazing, with free flow cocktails and alcohol in the evening. Service was also fantastic at the lounge. Thank you for the amazing getaway, would love to come back again.

title: Buffet @ Seasonal Taste,The Westin
desc: Made the reservation online and the staff called back almost immediately to confirm. Requested for a window seat, though it was not guaranteed, was pleasantly surprised by the seat given. Spectacular view from level 32. Wide choice of food attentive and friendly waiters/waitresses.

title: Great Hotel in a good location
desc: This was our first trip with friends to Singapore and The Westin didn't disappoint. It's location is good in the financial business sector (Asia Square). The hotel is spotless, the service is impeccable and we were given a room upgrade upon check in. The Infinity pool was great to cool off and unwind. Asia Square also has a good selection of restaurants and bars and was lively in the evening when people had finished work. The rooms are well appointed, and quiet, we had a Club Room and room service was very prompt and efficient. All the staff go out of their way to please you. We had tickets to the F1, and Marina Bay isn't far. In fact we walked lots and all the tourist attractions are easy to reach, including the numerous bars and restaurants. Singapore is the cleanest

title: Stunning luxurious hotel
desc: This hotel has the nicest lobby ever: very high ceilings, classy bar/café and amazing views. We booked a premium room which had a very beautiful bathroom with a view over the skyline of the city. I also loved their big gym and their nice infinity pool. We checked out very early in the morning and we were helped by an outstanding Indian lady. She was extremely professional, kind and friendly. Thumbs up to her.

title: Very good and value for money
desc: Celebrated my mother's 80th birthday here. The buffet is very good for the price. The selection was extensive enough, the staff helpful and the view superb. There's even a children's play area where the kids can eat and have fun whilst their parents relax and enjoy their meals. Loved the crayfish, crab, prawn and salmon sashimi selection. My parents preferred the cooked food like the chicken rice, roast and delicious soups. The buffet catered to the tastes of 3 generations. We were so relaxed that we did not feel the passing of the 3 hours (almost) that we spent there.

title: Cook & Brew restaurant at Westin SG
desc: Blown away by the great selection on the menu. Got a few dishes to share between us. The portions were huge and really really tasty. The waiter was kind enough to get us a seat at the window to admire the Marina Bay view. 5/5 overall dining experience!

title: QUIET STAY IN THE CBD AREA
desc: We had a one night staycation through a credit card redemption. As usual, Westin hotels' high standards ensured a luxurious stay. This particular hotel is located in the business district which means the immediate surroundings were more or less dead quiet on a weekend. We had a premier room which was very spacious. The Heavenly beds were just that! We used the gym which had treadmills, crosstrainers and stationary bikes facing the glass walls with nice city skyline views. This was followed by a swim in the 25m pool. It was an infinity pool but unfortunately most of the views were blocked by adjacent buildings. The Seasonal Tastes dinner buffet had nice ambience and an above average spread. Breakfast buffet at the same restaurant was pleasant with the usual international spread.

title: Beautiful hotel in a great location!
desc: The hotel is an absolute beauty from the moment you step into the lobby: gorgeously decorated and with phenomenal panoramic views of Singapore. The rooms are modern, super comfortable and have been designed with the international traveller in mind: multiplugs, USB ports etc. The infinity pool offers endless views of Singapore as does the gym. The Club lounge is also one of the best I've seen and with a great selection of food both at breakfast and during cocktail hour. I will definitely be back!

title: Great Hotel in the Marina Area
desc: A very nice, modern hotel that is close to the Gardens by the Bay. The hotel staff was very helpful and professional whenever we needed their assistance. The room was very nice and the bed was so comfortable! We had a great time at this high rise hotel!

title: 5 star hotel with 3 star service
desc: I booked a Club Room for a staycation to treat a friend visiting from Perth. We stayed in the Junior Suite which had an impressive large bathroom and impressive views with comfortable beds and great amenities including Nescafe machine and Handy mobile telephone with unlimited calls! The facilities are modern and clean and we really enjoyed the infinity pool and convenient location (I imagine this hotel would be ideal location for corporate travelers working in downtown/asia square area). Where this hotel fails to deliver is on customer service and general ambience. 1. We booked the Club Room for the additional benefits including evening "cocktails" however these were actually just a limited selection of spirits (vodka, rum, gin) with beer or wine. This is false advertising as

title: Unfriendly hotel
desc: From the moment we stepped in the hotel, the staff we met barely had a smile on their face. The guy at the reception who checked us in had his eyes fixated at the computer the whole time while he was checking us in, dismissing the human touch and welcoming service we ought to receive. It felt almost like we were checking in via a robot/computer system. The only person worth mentioning who made us feel like he genuinely cared for our stay was Tong Ri, who did our check out. At least we could see he smiled from his heart and genuinely wished us well.

title: Fabulous Rooms, Great Chinese Food!
desc: My family and I are frequent diners at Seasonal Tastes in Westin Singapore and we absolutely love the food there! The ingredients they use are always fresh, and there is a vast and never-ending selection of food items to choose from (both Western and Asian). I also sincerely appreciate the fact that the chefs behind the counter are always willing to accommodate our special requests, especially for my daughter who loves tomato spaghetti. Lastly, a special shout out to Chef Yeo who has incredible touch and manages to whip out amazing Cantonese style cuisine! And did I mention that the view is absolutely stunning? The Westin Singapore also has spacious rooms with well-designed interiors, which gives real meaning to the phrase "home away from home". Under GM Lance’s strong

title: Nice hotel, conveniently located
desc: The hotel is very new therefore all facilities are very good in shape. The receptionist who checked us in the night was very friendly and gave us lots of information regarding the hotel. Housekeeping in this Hotel is very good and they really respect the privacy and personal goods in a room. The pool boy is not of any use as he is not doing any service, not attentive at all. He never ask us for any drinks which I think I would not like as the management to loose out on revenue...(3 days in a row) The Westin Singapore is a great stay for a city trip as it is a typical business hotel.

title: My Taiwan friends having good time in seasonal taste
desc: This is the first time having lunch with my overseas friends in Westin Hotel Seasonal Taste. The food there was good many of choice.The staffs is very friendly too... The assistance managers Nui so impress by my friends for preparing a nice birthday cake... thank you Miss Nui so much...

title: The Worst food at Daily Treats
desc: As I am writing on behalf of my colleague, We Just bought some fruits, sandwiches, wraps with hot items for a lunch meetings to bring to our room. We have been here for private meetings in your room before. As most comes with coral salads, tomatoes were slice paper thin. Plus most comes with pickles which was disgusting that did not compliment some of the sandwiches and wraps. 1. The roast beef sandwich was also a disaster as the quality of the beef felt like rubber while chewing and smelled like a wet carpet. The sandwich garnishes was poor, ciabatta was tough to bike after it was toasted. 2. Sizes of meatballs was too small. 3. Grandma triangle sandwiches did not taste good while the pickles have spoiled the truffle flavor. 4. Cut cube fruits sizes was too small and the

title: Great Location for Business and Pleasure
desc: I stayed in the Westin Singapore for 6 nights while on business. Hotel reception is located on the 32nd floor, on arrival I was warmly greated by the reception team and given a cool drink, before being shown to the lifts which access the rooms. My room was on the 38th floor and overlooked the swimming pool and part of the bay, so I could see the cruise ship dock. Rooms are large, spotlessly clean and nicely decorated, with very comfortable beds and bedding. The company I was working with was using the business facilities on the 3rd floor and we had a young staff member, Mei Ling allocated to our meeting room. Mei Ling could not have done enought to help us and despite the long days, she remained ethusiatic, cheerful and helpful ensuring that we had constant supplies of

title: Fabulous Experience!
desc: First Impression: From the moment I stepped out of the cab, I was greeted warmly by the concierge guys. They greeted me warmly and directed me to the lift where I had to go up to Level 32. The boys looked really young but I am VERY impressed with their level of attention to service. WELL DONE! Cos of them, I know that I was already off to a good start at The Westin. Having been in the service industry for the past 13 years, I am very particular abt first impression. :) Check-In / Check-Out: Both experiences were smooth and staffs on duty were amazingly polite. My check-in was exceptionally special. I was attended by Tong Ri. I can just feel that he was serving me sincerely and he was so polite. He made small talks with me and had asked what brought me to The Westin. Its those

title: Good hotel for short stay.
desc: Stayed here for about a week this month. Comfortable rooms. Service was excellent as usual with staff trying to please yet not intrude. Did’nt get a chance to dine at the restaurants, but word from colleagues was that the fare was good. The connectivity was good and working on VPN was easy. May not be the top, but sure is among the top few in Singapore. Would I stay there again, think so.

title: Excellent staff, comfortable room
desc: All the staff were very helpful and charming, and this made the stay in what was already a very pleasant hotel even better. The Executive Lounge is small, but the staff there in particular were excellent, remembering my name and my preferences from day to day. Good for breakfast or even a light supper, with complementary wine and beer. Generally an excellent experience: the room (on the 40th floor) had an interesting view, and was spacious. The bathroom included a bath and shower.

title: Weekend Indulgence in Singapore
desc: Westin Singapore has always been my choice accomodation esp. on weekend as it is quiet and you get free parking (only Fri evening to Sunday).Enjoyed the quiet surrounding and a nice 20 minutes walk to Marina Bay and 10 mins to the train stations. With Grab and Uber, the location is easily accessible and affordable charges. I notice lots new faces and this trip I must give credit to the Executive Lounge staff for their prompt, efficient and friendly services. Special mention to the lounge staff Patrick Chong for his superb PR and attend to the customer needs effectively. His friendly disposition and vibrant personality helps to brighten our evening on Saturday nite when we drop by the lounge for coffee. My daughter and myself just finished dinner at Morton's and being in the

title: Excellent Service with staff for Weekend Indulgence
desc: Extremely enjoyable dining place at Westin - Seasonal Taste for the spread of buffet. Would like to Thank Nui Paphatchon (Assistant Manager at Seasonal Tastes) for her big warm and welcoming hospitality specially for her regular guests as I had dinner there 3 nights in a row. Pleasant experience with Nui for her friendly-self as she approaches guest to introduce herself and make guests feel welcome and at ease. Highly recommended for dinner to impress your date. I will definitely be going back regularly.

title: Great stay
desc: Beautiful hotel, clean, spacious rooms and awesome service. It's not very new, but in very good condition. Better than some of the newer hotels I have stayed in. All the staff I met are very welcoming and helpful. Definitely my top choice if I return to Singapore.

title: Amazing Staff, Amazing Property, Amazing Service
desc: Date: Oct 28 - 29 (One Night) Room Booked: Deluxe Room Rate: SPG Member Exclusive: Prepaid rate Status: Platinum Got into Singapore on a red-eye flight, arrived at the hotel at 6:30AM. Previously, I have emailed the hotel about my early arrival and also used the mobile check in and requested for 7AM check in. The hotel lobby is on the 32nd floor, amazing view and super high ceiling. Check in was a breeze, the agent said a room was available and also upgraded us to the Club Room on the corner with the view of Marina Bay, room number 4302. The layout of this room is amazing, when you first open the door, you have a short hallway and then a left turn before you see the bed, feels like staying at a suite with the added privacy of the hallway. Floor to ceiling windows surrounds the

title: Top notch, oddly quiet, but excellent if one wants an oasis of peace
desc: The location on top of an office on Level 32 upwards in the financial district probably makes this an excellent location for those wanting quick access to the financial district, but something cannot be right, as the hotel and its outlets were decidedly quiet when I checked in on a Sunday and out on a Tuesday. Don’t get me wrong - it suited me fine, as its rare to find a top notch property in Singapore with a completely quiet reception, lobby lounge and lobby bar - and I loved it! The Premier Room which I occupied was well furnished and well designed. As was the bathroom. A room which is comfortable to work and relax. Wifi is available throughout the hotel. Staying on Level 33 is actually great, as one sees the lobby below and can walk to Level 32 vis a staircase Buffet dinner

title: Excellent hotel and location
desc: I stayed at the Westin Singapore after 2 weeks of traveling in India & Sri Lanka. It was so nice to stay at a Westin. I knew exactly what to expect and the heavenly bed was so comfy! The guest room was well appointed and the bathroom was huge! Loved the bathtub and rain shower. My room had great views of Singapore. The staff was very friendly and helpful especially the concierge. The hotel is in a great location and its easy to walk around, join a hop on hop off bus and catch Ubers. When I return to Singapore I will definitely stay at the Westin Singapore.

title: Buffet lunch and dinner
desc: Love the Seasonal Taste Restaurant at Westin. Been there for lunch and dinner. Great selection of food. Staffs were friendly . Nice ambience. Yummy food. Take time to chill and enjoy the food. Lots of Sashimi and fresh seafood.

title: Great Stay!
desc: Room is very nice and bed was very comfortable. Pool view was great, lobby located at very high floor. Nearest MRT could be reached by 10 mins walk, however not many food nearby. Service could be improved. The other great thing is they provide a smartphone that we can carry outside with free local calls and internet.

title: An Amazing Hotel
desc: I stayed at the Westin Hotel in Singapore. The staff are so friendly. Its a bit of a strange experience when you first arrive and find the hotel check in is on the 32 floor. Everyday you are greeted by the concierge staff and they are more than happy to assist. I have status with SPG and the lounge was exceptional.

title: Fantastic stay, resort like luxury in city centre location
desc: I had a great stay at the Westin Singapore recently. The city centre location could not be better but the thing that really stood out was the way the staff in the hotel treated us. We felt pampered and looked after at every meal and in the executive lounge too. One person stands out - Malcolm Tan really made the trip memorable for us. He looked after us after check-in, explained a few things we could do around the hotel and made sure everything we needed to do was well prepared. He found out during our conversation that we were celebrating our engagement and then arranged for a surprised treat from the hotel to be sent to our room. It was a really nice touch that made us feel at home and pampered. Thank you to The Westin Singapore for a great stay - I’m sure I’ll stay

title: Great hotel - but noisy
desc: I have been coming to this hotel regularly for the past four years. It is a beautiful place, with wonderful views, comfortable rooms and a mixed and generous breakfast. But, it is surrounded by building sites that work, albeit at a reduced rate, throughout the night. If you are a sensitive sleeper like myself you will be aware of the various cranes and trucks at work below. In fairness, the staff did accommodate and tried to move us to a different room. But what can you do when there is building work on all sides? That said, the infinity pool still offers a wonderful swim.

title: Awesome exprienced
desc: Yes it was indeed a great experienced for me when i dined in at Seasonal Taste,the level of service is very delightful and good attention to details..I wanted to commend the following staff who did extra miles on their job,namely Husni, Winson and Nui not to forget Megan as well.. I will come back soon as i wanted my friends to experience also the satisfaction that i had..

title: a staycation that was regrettably too short
desc: it was such a lovely first time staying at the Westin. a big big thank you to the Front desk staff and the Executive club colleagues. i loved the swimming pool and the breakfast! the room was amazing and big, wish I had more time there.. will highly recommend the Westin (: thank you to Tong Ri, Malcolm and team! also to Roslee who is a great person to talk to in the lounge.. one side note : the reservations team should be monitored carefully, they don’t seem to know their work well and I had quite a few emails bouncing to and fro with issues regarding to my stay.. other than that everything else is really 100/100!

title: Excellent Business Hotel
desc: I was in Singapore for business and this hotel fit the need quite well. The room was large, the bed was comfortable and the views from the room were great. The bathroom was good with a lighted makeup mirror, separate tub and shower. Regarding the food options, the breakfast buffet in both the club lounge and in the regular hotel was extensive and tasty. The restaurant on the 33rd floor had an odd assortment of food and they really should redo their menu. The buffet lunch was very good with an incredible mix of options. The gym was small but ok. I would return if i had business in this part of Singapore. With so many options, i would choose based on convenience.

title: Great Hotel!
desc: Warm service at check-in, great view and wonderful breakfast. Super fast wifi and nice lounge with decent food and beverage offering. Extremely comfortable mattress and pillows. Short distance to a hawker stall center offering lots of local Chinese/Indian/Peranakan dishes.

title: Great hotel, good location and excellent service
desc: Have been visiting Singapore on business this year and stayed at Westin several times. Impressed with their service, comfort and club lounge. Recognized for being platinum and benefits offered. Food could be better. Hotel normally runs very high occupancy and hence is quite expensive.

title: Amazing Staycation at the Westin Singapore
desc: Stayed twice at The Westin Singapore and had a pleasant experience during my stay. The young guy at the reception on the first floor was very helpful and extremely friendly when I check in. I will like to give a head ups to Sarina at the front desk who assisted me during check in as I am amazed by her when she brought us up to my room and gave us a drink during check-in. The room was very clean and the items requested via email were placed in the room prior to my arrival. The best thing I love about this hotel is that it is very quiet during weekends as it is situated in the CBD district and it is less crowded in the vicinity. I definitely love the Executive Club Lounge access as I can enjoy their afternoon teas and evening drinks alongside with the spectacular view of the bay.

title: Staycation @ Westin Singapore
desc: It was the best staycation ever, the hotel staff were very friendly and welcoming it feels like coming back home. The hotel room layout is spacious and the view outside of the hotel room was stunningly awesome Sentosa Cove; Palau Brani; Sister Island; St John Island; Lazaraus Island and Kusu Island was just in front of me. The buffet lunch selection was great, I love the local cusine selection corner for the satay; curry & papadium; salad bar corner with its unique salad dressing like raspberry, mango and etc. And not forgetting dessert Gelato flavours like chocolate; avocado and vanilla were among the best I had ever tried.

title: My favorite place to stay in Singapore
desc: If possible I continue to stay in the Westin when I am in Singapore. The service and the restaurants are just outstanding. I can recommend very much the Club Lounge. The view on the harbor is stunning and the food is great.

title: Highly Recommended!
desc: I stayed at this hotel with my family recently for vacation. We were warmly greeted by Joy – the front desk. There were some issues for the reservations at the beginning but with Joy’s professional assistance problems solved without any troubles. She was so kind to offer us the same floor so that it would be more convenience for family to take care the children. The rooms were spectacular with a view of the courtyard and it’s awesome to enjoy the view at the night time. The buffet breakfast was full of variety and The lobby lounge ‘s atmosphere was great too. We did not have much time to try the swimming but it looked attractive indeed as it was an infinity pool location at 35/F. Staff were all with a friendly smile and happy to help. The location of this hotel may be more

title: Great new hotel near Marina Bay
desc: This is a beautiful high rise Westin that I highly recommend. The lobby and check-in is on 35th floor. So you walk in, and must immediately take an elevator. This makes for a check-in area that has an amazing view of the bay. The staff is very helpful, and service is outstanding here. The room was spacious, with more than enough room for king-size bed and a guest bed. The bathroom was amazing, with huge shower, and a beautiful tub which my wife had to use. The only negative is that the toilet had a glass door, and the main bathroom door still allowed one to see a silhouette , so not much in the way of privacy... so I suggest you stay here with someone you know really well! The Westin had an amazing infinity pool on a high floor. It cannot compete with the Marina Bay

title: Top stay
desc: Literally a top stay. Many floors up and great city or harbor views! The room was very comfortable and room service excellent (I worked most nights!), Staff were friendly and attentive. The hotel has an excellent gym but it can get busy at times. Overall a highly recommended hotel.

title: Very nice hotel
desc: A very nice hotel with great rooms, standard comfy beds, very clean with great views. I would have scored the hotel a 5 if it wasn’t for the construction outside, constant beeping of trucks reversing and banging. Would have been good to have know this was happening before booking.

title: Westin bad history
desc: My bad experience with this hotel: I have a weekend free to do a visit to Singapore, I find this hotel and booked a room for weekend 17-18 November this year. When arrived the hotel I found out that I have made a mistake with my reservation, I have booked the room for 2018, not 2017. I ask reception if it was possible the change the date to 2017, answer was no, I have to contact the travel agent to have them to change the date. My agent told me after checking with the hotel that nobody in the hotel can make this change before Monday.... With this negative answer from the hotel I decided not use the hotel and cancelled my booking and ask my agent to call the hotel and explain my missing and if possible to refund my booking.. after some days the answer from the hotel was NO...

title: Excellent Business Hotel in Singapore
desc: The Westin Singapore is a big and very well appointed hotel and may be the nicest Westin I’ve stayed at. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Hannah and Ann were helpful and friendly when I checked out. The “sky” lobby is some 30 odd floors up which is not my favorite type of arrangement but the views of the CBD and waterfront are amazing. My room was excellent. The bath was big and had a separate tub, rain shower, etc toilet room. While there wasn’t a nespresso machine in the room, there was a French press to make coffee in the morning. The desk area offered up many outlets for laptop or tables. Working in the room was easy due to the large desk and great wifi connection. The rooms are very quiet and it is easy to get sleep when you want to. The pool area was

title: Always want to be back again.
desc: Great location with sea view, I love the swimming pool especially as well as the SPA and Gym. Don't miss out the lounge in lobby, you can enjoy the hourbor and sea view with delighted drinks and atmosphere. By the way, the bed is amazing, try it.

title: Amazing Room and gorgeous Infinity pool!
desc: Booked a room for our anniversary celebration. I booked the bay View Room. I got to start off by saying, that my room was massive. The room even had a big walkway to enter my "actual room". My room`s bathtub was huge,and it could fit 2 people. It also featured wall to ceiling windows to those who want to shower with a view. All bay view room comes with beautiful sea view that you can wake up, I believe. Having said that , sadly there is a residential property built just in front of the bay view room. So the view is now somewhat limited, which would otherwise have been a fantastic view. The signature Westin bed was heavenly. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well. We had an issue with media system. We could not connect our macbook to the TV. the staff acted very

title: One of the best places to stay in Singapore
desc: Stayed here in a recent business trip. Everything was so perfect. First due to my status with Marriott they gave me a status upgrade for Starwoods. The front desk upgraded the room to a harbour view suite This is one of the most amazing views of the Singapore skyline and harbour. The room itself was huge - close to 1300 sq ft. The breakfast is a good spread with a great combination of local delicacies and international favourite. The staff is amazing and ready to help. The executive lounge has good selection of spirits, wines and light evening snacks. I did not get to use the pool but I looked very nice. Location is amazing. Close to MRT and all the attractions. You can literally walk to the Garden by the bay and other famous Singapore attractions. Overall great

title: Weekend Stay
desc: We stayed for two nights at this hotel just before Christmas. The hotel is beautiful and the rooftop pool is ideal. The staff were very friendly and the accommodations were spacious and spotless. We highly recommend this hotel in Singapore. We could easily walk to Marina Bay and the Gardens by the Bay. We took the subway to Orchard Road and walked back to the hotel enjoying the beauty of the city. We enjoyed the entrance level coffee/cake shop for quick breakfasts or mid-afternoon treats. I would welcome the opportunity to return to Singapore and stay in this great Westin hotel again!

title: Modern Hotel with Great Service
desc: Did a staycation there and was given a room upgrade and access to the executive lounge due to my SPG Platinum Status. The hotel is new and I found the service excellent - checking in through the entire stay. The room was clean, well maintained and well laid out. The toilet was functional, yet had a luxurious touch. I found the executive lounge well run with attentive staff and good food (both afternoon tea and evening canapés). Will definitely return.

title: Always Excellent
desc: This hotel is a firm favourite and we always stay here when we visit Singapore, which is usually a couple of times a year. Alongside the Westin in Tokyo this is one of my favourite SPG hotels. The rooms are a good size, corner rooms especially, the beds are super comfortable with nice quality linen, the bathroom toiletries are well stocked, the rooms are very clean and there is even a complimentary mobile phone to take out and about in the city. There is a pool which is big enough for laps and during the week its is almost empty... The Club lounge offers a nice breakfast and evening cocktails with snacks and there is even afternoon cakes. The staff in the lounge are exceptional. I know there have lists of their 'regular' guests, but on this occasion I was greeted by name

title: One of the best Westin Hotels
desc: I stayed for a few days in the Westin Singapore in early December 2017 and had a fantastic time there! As a Platinum member I had access to the lounge, which served a great complimentary breakfast. Staff was very helpful and friendly. As I arrived very early my suite was not ready yet, so I was provided I nice room in the meantime to freshen up. I sleep in hotel beds more then 200 nights a year, and this hotel is one of the best ones I stayed in so far!

title: Top hotel!
desc: We spent one night in MBS and moved to the Westin for the remaining two nights of our honeymoon. What a haven it was after the shambolic MBS!!! Our check-in was seamless! We were very early - 1pm but they had a room ready. The receptionist was fantastic - asked us what we enjoy doing on holidays and then circled area on a map which we would enjoy. A really lovely touch!!! Our room as immaculate. The real highlight for me was the free standing bath overlooking the city - just wow! We booked club level and from previous reviews we knew not to expect much. The entrance is impressive - swipe your key card for the glass sliding door to open. But the offering Is pretty poor both for afternoon tea and dinner time. Breakfast was good. Only a small amount of tables have a

title: Just want to stay in the room!
desc: We got a excellent view of the Singapore Straits. We can just sit at the chair whole day. The bed was equally comfortable. The room was clean. The wifi was fast and strong. The view from the pool was excellent especially at night and was windy.

title: Simply magnificent !
desc: My partner & I stayed at The Westin as part of our anniversary trip to Singapore. Our stay here was sublime. Our room was gorgeous, the views are superb & the level of luxury offered is outstanding. All the fine details made our special stay even more special. Evenings in the lobby are filled with live piano songs and all staff are efficient, immaculately groomed & personable. We travel a lot and have experienced some lovely hotels and I must say The Westin is a fierce contender. For a little more, spoil yourself! You’ll be glad you did. Thank you to your wonderful team & we shall see you in a few months.

title: Superb view and large, cosy room
desc: We enjoyed our stay thoroughly. Check-in and check-out were fast. It is one of the luxury hotels at the new financial centre. It is within walking distance from Lau Pa Sat which serves local food. The room is large and cosy. We opted for 2 double beds. The beds and pillows are comfortable. The bathroom comes with a bathtub and a separate shower area. The swimming pool is a infinity pool. As it is within the CBD area, the whole area is very quiet on weekends. Only a few cafes and restaurants are opened. No major shopping malls within the vicinity.

title: Wonderful Hotel, Excellent location, Fantastic service
desc: A brilliant experience in a great location. We stayed just three days with our young children it was a most enjoyable experience - everything at the Hotel was seamless professional service. The area although the financial district is still just great for kids being so close to the bay area and all of the attractions there. In particular, the duty manager( Tong Ri,Hegen Yuen) went out of his way to make us feel comfortable and welcome. he reflects the warm attitude of this Hotel we definitely will come back

title: Fantastic - one of the best Westin I have stayed in!!
desc: Its the software of the hotel that stands out most. From the friendly faces when you get off the car to the smiling faces you see when you enter the lobby on the 32nd Floor. Kudos to Siti Sarina from reception who took the extra effort to ensure I have a early check in. Most impressive is the turnover time it took to do up the room for one of the couples travelling with me who was also on honeymoon. Wow Wow Wow can only describe my sentiments for this hotel. Thank you everyone for making my stay so so memorable.

title: One of the nicest Westins you’ll find
desc: Stayed here with SPG points for a 6 night family vacation. The hotel is pretty spectacular with the lobby on the 32nd floor. The rooms are large and comfortable. The breakfast buffet is the largest I’ve ever seen with options for everyone, and the separate gluten free area is much appreciated as my daughter is on a GF diet. The infinity pool is beautiful and fun on the 35th floor. It is a few blocks walk to China town and there are plenty of good restaurants nearby (Oso at the Oasia Hotel was quite good). It is walkable to the Merlion area (.6 miles), though taxis are pretty cost effective in Singapore, and Uber even more so (roughly half the taxi cost). You can get almost anywhere in an Uber for <$10 usd from the Westin.

title: Great stay
desc: It was a surprised staycation for my mum for her belated birthday and I got Westin to help me prepare a bouquet of tulips which was beautifully done. Everyone was so attentive and thoughtful and polite. A great stay indeed and will definitely come back again as the beds are just so comfy too!

title: Comfortable stay
desc: Very nice place to stay, comfortable cosy big rooms along with big bathroom. Staff is very friendly and supportive. All good nothing to complain and food was also good. I can repeat my stay any time I will be back to Singapore.

title: Perfect for a Simple Staycation
desc: I had seen a few variations and stayed at least twice at Westin. I do like one particularly room that has a walkway to the bathroom and the bathroom has natural daylight with view of the outside. Not too sure which room type is that room though. Nonetheless, for this latest stay, booked a Premier Room with partial sea and the new One Marina office building view. For Westin Singapore due to its location in the CBD, I think view is not that important. Location wise, as being in CBD probably not the closest to anything, but with Singapore not being big, is easy to walk to Lau Pa Sat, Chinatown, Marina Bay etc. Wanted to have a late dinner on a Friday night but by 10pm, all the restaurants in Asia Square are slowly shutting, but not a problem, as it gives one the chance to

title: Impressed!
desc: Loved our stay at The Westin during the Xmas 2017 break. It’s a quiet hotel and close to all the shopping and tourist places. It even has a food court next door that serves really good chicken rice! All the personnel we encountered at The Westin were amazingly friendly and helpful. Gave us early check in without charge when we arrived very early as a result of our flight. Also gave us late check out without charge. We were in Singapore to celebrate our mum’s birthday. When we notified the hotel of the fact, they gave her a complimentary slice of cake nicely arranged on a dessert plate with nice sentiments on a card. We really appreciated their doing so and it certainly gave our Mum a happy surprise. Our rooms were extremely comfy and spacious. The beds very wide and bed

title: exceptional client service
desc: kudos to Harivindran from concierge. very helpful and excellent service! he is full of passion at his work and went the extra mile on making our stay a plesant and unforgettable one. keep up the good work!

title: Superb Westin Property
desc: The Westin can be a bit hit and miss - but this one truly does stand out as a top class property. All rooms start high up and my room was very upbeat, modern and had a new feel to it. Loved the bathroom - super large and had lux feel. Lobby area pretty amazing. I will definitely return. My only comment would be the main buffet / restaurant was a bit crowded / en mass for dinner (not that quiet) - and think the main al a crate restaurant is a better quiter place.

title: Marvelous view, nice interior, excellent attitude
desc: This is my first time to visit Westin SG. Their service is amazing; one lady actively approached me and introduced how to check-in while I just arrived the front door. Very impressive! All the attendants are very polite and friendly. The room was spacious and with magnificent view. The bed was still heavenly comfortable. The Westin provided runner shoes! Very creative, but could be even better if they could inform their guests while booking! This information should be provided to the costumers beforehand. The breakfast at Seasonal Taste and meeting rooms were great. There is a food court nearby, convenient. I particularly enjoyed the bathtub, though no bath salts provided. One more thing, I could not get any radio from TV, except from the radio beside the bed. All in all, this

title: Pleasant surprise
desc: This was my first time to your restaurant after hearing so much from friends & colleagues . Turn out it was really a different lunch dining experience from other restaurants I have been to. View was fantastic , food was so-so but the service was good. A special shout out to Nui ( hope I get her name right ) for her friendliness , attentiveness which made my dining that day so pleasant & enjoyable . (3/1/18) Tonight I went back again for the Thai Buffet dinner with my dad as he liked Thai food very much . Unfortunately some of the food was disappointing. The green curry chicken was very salty and the Tom Yum Kung was not sour enough . It seem that your restaurant do indeed have many friendly & attentive staff . We were been served & attended by a staff called Husni . Like Nui ,

title: Beautiful room and hotel
desc: Very clean, comfortable, and upscale. Beautiful bathtub in the room! Gorgeous views of the city from the rooms, spa, and pool. Very attentive staff at spa. Located in the business district, so the area gets quiet on the weekends. Would recommend.

title: Westin in Asia is a higher level of nice than Westin USA
desc: Amenities neatly arranged every. Large room. Large bed. Magnificent breakfast everyday included in rate. Infinity pool overlooking harbor. Had a resort feel. Staff courteous and warm when greeting. Would stay again. Staff moved me across hall when construction noise became a problem. Then send up a fruit plate to apologize for noise that was not their fault. Huge kudos.

title: A wonderful hotel
desc: Despite being a few years old, the Westin Singapore still looks brand new. Coupled with the perfect balance of hospitality, not too distant nor too in-your-face, this makes for an experience like no other. I am impressed with my first stay here, and I will be back. Congratulations Westin Singapore!

title: Favourite hotel in Singapore so far
desc: This was one of the newer properties in Singapore and it showed. The rooms, facilities were all fantastic including one of the best buffet lunches I have ever had! One must go try the curry laksa, Hainan chicken and their hokkien mee, I must have had thirds and completely stuffed myself for lunch. The swimming pool was great for an infinity pool, though I have to admit my favourite pool in the world is still at the near by Infinity pool at Marina Bay Sands. However, the hotel all around was better in my mind for roughly the same price. It also helps that there is a nearby Law Pa Sat hawker food center which is incredibly useful when one arrives to the hotel at midnight and starving! The location is also perfect if you are going to spend time in the CBD area, pretty much

title: Excellent hotel
desc: We arrived at about 9:00 am, tired after a very long flight, but the staff was able to check us in right away. Lovely, spacious, quiet room, soft bedding and pillows (I am hard to please as far as beds and bedding, since I am a very fussy sleeper), nice shower and bathroom, maybe too many light switches. Amazing breakfast buffet, with omelet/egg station, hot and cold selections, catering to both Asian and Western tastes. The locations in the business district is not ideal for tourists but is very close to the Downtown subway station, from which we could get anywhere our feet didn’t take us.

title: Nothing Terrible, Nothing Excellent
desc: We had a 5 night stay over the holidays, having previously stayed in The Regent, The Four Seasons, The Conrad and The Fullerton in Singapore. The room layout was spacious and modern, in fact the bathroom size is unnecessarily large. The service and staff were good but lacked the finesse of other 5 Star equivalent hotels. Old Room service trays left in the hallways for hours, pool attendants offering no assistance at all to guests. The lounge, reception and restaurants all lack any character and the food and drink quality was average. Probably ideal for Business trips to the CBD, but for a couples or family holiday there are better alternatives at the price point in much better locations.

title: The best SPG hotel in Singapore
desc: Westin in Asia was far superior than any Westin(s) in USA. As an example, Westin in Singapore had one of the newest/cleanest building with the friendliest staff. The infinity pool was gorgeous and the executive lounge had amazing spread. Miss Angela Fox was making sure my stay was comfortable and kindly treated the Platinum member with the best room and welcome gift. During my stay here, almost every staff (Fiona, Malcolm, and others) greeted me by my first name. In addition, I was upgraded to one of the best suite with harbor view. On my return to Westin Singapore the next three weeks, I was given the same exact room with chocolate waiting for me in the living room. The way Westin Singapore treated the SPG Platinum Member was as good as (or better than!) St Regis! Many thanks

title: One of the best hotel in Singapore for a staycation
desc: My girlfriend and I decided to spend our 3rd anniversary at The Westin and what an unforgettable experience we had. To say that it was perfect is an understatement. Upon reaching lobby, we were greeted by the wonderful interiors and friendly front desk staff,Hannah, if I am not wrong. The room overlooks the sea and port of Singapore which made us extremely peaceful as it was very therapeutic to watch it. The bed itself is also big and comfortable to sleep in. To top it off, there was a bathtub in the toilet overlooking the same view. As we were celebrating our 3rd anniversary, The Westin also surprised us with chocolate covered strawberries as a gift to us. My only qualm about The Westin is that there is no free wifi however with such a beautiful view, I think it was alright

title: Comfortable room near it all
desc: This is a great property as the reservation agents where very accommodating to our final departure the experience was top notch. The smartphone for use in the room and for touring around town was an terrific aid in finding and navigating to the local restaurants and tourist sites. Loved the views and slept like a baby in the Heavenly bed. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

title: Wonderful stay!
desc: Very comfortable with friendly and helpful service. The hotel offers amazingly easy-to-use gadgets to bring along to roam around the city fully connected to the internet. Also, free local calls and international calls (12) countries. Wow!

title: Awesome view and food
desc: The buffet restaurant has a very amazing view and the seating area is spacious and comfortable too. The food also has very good variety and are all very yummy! Especially the pumpkin soup, it’s a must try! :)

title: Birthday
desc: Love the food and ambience. The place has an amazing view. Definitely will recommend to friend and family. The staff are very friendly and they are fast as well. My family enjoyed our dinner here very much.

title: Superb Modern stay
desc: Here is a short review, but rest assured, we had a great stay. We actually felt very comfortable and "at home" here immediately upon arrival. Located in a "new" part of Singapore, this hotel is only a few years old, and thus, very modern and fresh. Comfortable rooms with good aircon.
