Note in my image attached here - your own phone/tablet in the room ready to assist as well as giving you some rebates to some of the more famous attractions in Singapore. Took some pictures, but no time to use the pool. Located at the 35th floor, its a great view however. We really liked the location. The modern business area of Singapore. A short walk to the Downtown station, and from there all the rest of Singapore reachable. Apart from food available at the hotel itself, a huge FoodGarden is

title: Service above our expectations
desc: Harry the porter went above and beyond. Harry welcomed us late with an informative overview of the room and our phone capabilities such as free calls to Australia one day it was raining and we left the hotel and we're over a block away, next thing Harry appears with three umbrellas, a lovely service gesture! moments like that are memorable and special, thanks Westin and esp Harry

title: Awesome hotel
desc: Amazing view from our room.. stayed there from 30th dec till 2 jan'18.. The service is excellent, especially the receptionist guy named Tong Ri. He helped us to get a perfect holiday by his hospitality. Definitely will come back for more ;) Very nice room.. nice bfast..nice atmosphere.. excellent hospitality

title: Great location
desc: Very friendly and helpful staff, had to pay for wifi access though, these days that should be complimentary regardless. Very close to MRT station and Marina Bay areas. Extremely comfortable beds although the rooms were a little light due to electronic devices emitting light ie TV, clock radio etc

title: great / efficient service, spacious room n nice heated jacuzzi
desc: the best hotel to book for this price range ard cbd area. helpful and efficient front desk execs who went the extra mile to smooth out the wifi issues on my second stay. nice ambience and great heated jacuzzi means can soak even at nite / when temperatures are low. great service from all @ front desk esp tong ri yuen who goes the extra mile. efficient service when u require stuff delivered to your room. would b great if menu @ lobby lounge could be more extensive though.

title: Spacious room, great view, warm hospitality and close to MRT
desc: This is the kind of hotel that could stop me from visiting all these places in Singapore for another minutes of sweet dreams. Super cozy and luxurious. Full amenities were provided (even some lavender oil to help you sleep better). Breakfast were superb, they have wide food selection including gluten free options. Our room was close to the elevator, but there was no noise at all. One time I was in the lobby for hours to call my bf, the staff was uber nice when he noticed that it had been 2 hours and gave me bottled water - true definition of hospitality. Will come back for sure!

title: A night of Beauty
desc: I just celebrated my Fiancee's Birthday by booking the junior suite for a night's stay. Upon my request for some decorations, The Westin has outdone itself by preparing a beautiful happy birthday sign decoration and a bed filled with rose petals. Their service was excellent no matter what time of the day and night. The junior suite had the VIP lounge access which had a very nice view and a beautiful spread for breakfast. We were also given a high floor on the 33rd story and the view was amazing. The view of the pool was splendid as well with their in-built water massage chairs. I would like to thank The Westin Singapore for going beyond my expectations and for the pleasurable stay we both had.

title: A lovely wedding & wedding dinner
desc: I attended a wedding here - everything was well-planned. The staff were helpful and articulate. I needed my phone charged, and the Malay guy handling the PA system at the Registrar of Marriages offered to help charge it for me. The guy who officiated the marriage was a pro and no stumbles at all (he handled the weddings of the previous three siblings before). Drinks in the lobby before dinner was good. The staff ensured our glasses were quickly refilled and even the kacang bowls were constantly refilled. The staff were attentive to our needs - and were always on hand and available despite the hundreds of guests milling around. Dinner was good - unusual & noteworthy culinary innovation was the Singapore classic "chilly crabs", but done with lobsters. One lobster per guest.

title: Perfect hotel to explore Singapore
desc: Our third stay at the Westin Singapore - very nice hotel, friendly and accommodating staff and overall very nice facilities including a rooftop pool and a very well equipped gym with harbour view. Great location to explore Singapore ... we will be back

title: Amazing stay
desc: Booked a 3 night award stay. This was a milestone celebration visit. I had emailed the property in advance and asked for a room with a good view. I had booked a Premier Room and was upgraded upon arrival a couple categories all the way up to the Executive Club room. Wow! I was also told this was the room with the best views in the whole hotel (and I believe it). And since it was a corner room it had two different views of the bay! I would sit on our bed at night and just look out the floor to ceiling windows. This room also came with the all important access to the executive lounge which was a huge benefit. Free breakfast was served in it every morning. Not only was it free, it was large with a wide variety of high quality items. If I had to guess i would say if you had to

title: The most comfortable stay ever.
desc: I checked into this hotel for one night and I had an extremely comfortable stay. Since I am an SPG Platinum Elite member, the front desk was very friendly to upgrade me to a corner premiere room. The heavenly bed is definitely feeling heaven like all The Westin hotels globally when you sleep on it. But this hotel was great in their friendly lightings. The breakfast was excellent and have many great international choices.

title: Quiet Hotel ...
desc: The hotel is located at a quieter area of Singapore but very close enough to the food court known as Lau Pa Sat. The room is spacious enough and tidy and all the rooms are above the 32nd floor. The lobby is located on the 32nd floor but some how the entrance on the ground isn't impressive and appears unwelcome...the guests will only be greeted warmly at the check in counters at the 32nd floor. The counter staff are friendly and helpful enough, with the exception of one. Part of swimming pool was under renovation at the time of our stay but swimming was still possible. The hotel policy of charging bottle of drink and/or box of mint in the room if you don't put back within certain time period is most unwelcome, even if you do not utilised...as it is deemed so and charges will be

title: Good but not impressive (if travel with young children)
desc: Stayed at W Sentosa, Ocean Suites, Shangri-la Orchard, and Westin during our 2018 CNY holiday. We traveled in a family of 4 with 2 kids under age 2 and 4. Of all Westin is the least impressive, but it also cost the least. For one there is no kids club, no kids area in the pool, and children are restricted from lounge (whereas Westin in Tokyo and Taipei accept kids, or Shangri-la Orchard accept kids before 6:30pm (if I recall correctly). Of all, I guess when traveling with kids, Westin will not be on my list. However, if traveling alone and want to enjoy the SPG benefits, Westin is great with lounge access, free breakfast, and a room upgrade. Westin is known for its heavenly mattress and healthy choices of food and drink. We ordered chicken satay for late night snack. For

title: BEST BIRTHDAY STAYCATION EVER
desc: Me and My aunt checked in on Feb 10 for my birthday staycation at The Westin Singapore, at check in we were yet to be surprised, one check in staff, Joy Yao heard it was me birthday and upgraded us to The Westin Executive Club Floor, thanks a lot. The view from the infinity pool is amazing the food by the pool is 10/10 or room’s view was 10/10 and overall it is just amazing, The Westin Singapore definitely made it an unforgettable day for Me.

title: Smart Hotel, A Bit Austere
desc: The rooms are a bit austere but very large. I like the design whereby most of the clothes storage is in the vestibule, keeping the rest of it tidy. The bathroom, with a free-standing bath in the floor to ceiling window was wonderful. The infinity pool on the 35th floor was nice and quiet but since surrounded by buildings that are higher, there isn't much of a view. On the face of it the hotel is in a bit of a non-area but actually you can walk to the bay and china town. It is well connected for the MRT

title: Overall a nice hotel but can do better
desc: Booked a last min 2 days 1 night stay for hubby's Bday celebration, the room was nice and spacious with comfy bed, hotel was nice to give a complimentary slice of cake for the Bday celebration. However, during the night in wee hours of 2am, a guest was talking loudly on the phone at the corridor and I had to call the counter to ask them to investigate... 10 mins on the guest was still talking loudly with no hotel staff in sight, no choice my hubby have to go out and confront the guest. We asked for late check out due to the disturb sleep but well was 'rejected' based on full booking, so much for the 'guarantee' late check out for weekend staycation... guess it is not so 'guarantee' after all... minus that still a nice hotel I guess?

title: Family Experience
desc: Every week, for over six months, we have been lunching at Seasonal Tastes. People asked us what was so great about the food that we continue to eat that every week. Truth be told, food is fairly standard fare, with little change week to week. So what is the glue. Its the staff. Most of them recognise us as regulars and will come and greet and chat with us. We want to highlight some of the staff, Asst Managers Suresh and Nui, whoever is on duty, never fail to make us feel welcome and comfortable. Soonam, a cheerful customer service staff, will ensure we get our regular table and that all is in order. Even the part-time help will engage us. Each time we visit the restaurant, its like having our meals at home. We often talked about trying a new place but resisted it because of

title: Great hotel and staff
desc: A very courteous and helpful welcome from the concierge and reception staff, efficient and friendly. Our room on the 39th floor overlooked the harbour and interesting docks area, and was very well-equipped and comfortable. There's a really useful free mobile phone provided for your stay, which allows you to make calls locally and internationally, and surf the net, a fantastic idea for when you're out and about. We buy a local sim when we are staying abroad for any length of time, but as we were here for only two days, en route to New Zealand, this really made life easy. Breakfast was very good and available up until 10:30, which is handy if you're catching up on sleep from a long haul flight. It was also very helpful that, even though we'd checked out, that we were able to

title: Friendly & hospitable staff at the Club Lounge!
desc: Revisited this great property and enjoyed my short weekend getaway thoroughly. The room was really very comfortable and the signature “Heavenly Bed” really lives up to its name as always. A restful night could always be guaranteed! Special mention goes out to the friendly staff, Patrick Chan and Tiffany, at the Club Lounge. They were really amazing with their service renderings as they remembered guests’ preferences and addressed guests by their names. Also, they were always seen proactively attending to guests and anticipating their needs. Their attempts to get to know guests better through casual chats certainly made guests felt very at home. In addition, both of them never failed to check on the well-being of each guest at the lounge. Definitely gems to the organisation

title: Heavenly bed and great Club Lounge staffs
desc: Always have staycation at this hotel, the heavenly bed gave me a very good sleep. The club lounge offer afternoon hi-tea and great evening cocktail for Platinum members , club room and suites room guests. The lounge staff Patrick Chan is super attentive and professional, he make sure every guests are well taken care from the hi-tea and evening cocktail hour. The hotel also offer champagne breakfast at the club lounge, Tiffany is also very attentive and great all the guests in the lounge, impressive with her positive energy in the morning. Overall I'm happy with the hotel stay with Westin Singapore.

title: Teriffic service!
desc: Third time in Singapore, but first time here. Stayed for five nights and wasn't disappointed. Great pool, lounge, room and amazing service. Only complaint was due to another customer. On our last night a rude customer invited on of the staff members (which I assume was a manager) to sit at his table in the lounge. He proceeded to make complaints (unwarranted in my opinion) with everyone listening. Very poor taste. Luckily, the staff member was very professional and kind. Everyone was pleased when he finally finished and left.

title: Hospitality Re-defined for travelers by "The Westin Singpore"
desc: The Westin Singapore - Really enjoyed five-star services experience. From Check-In to Check-out whole process is built around guest convience. Spg members can enjoy more facilities at this place and special discounts. Booked deluxe king room for a night during my business trip- honestly nothing to complaint the best i liked the quite/less noisy air con system. Room decor and interior gives to a pleasant feelings and comfortable bed not to forget. Singapore iconic location - Marina bay sands and other attractions are at walking distance. Highly recommended to business travelers and couples. would like to stay again!

title: Spectacular Hotel!
desc: The hotel lobby is located on level 32 which has contemporary decor in the glorious high ceiling floor and spectacular views of beautiful and developing Marina bay. The room was spacious with nice decoration of modern earthy color furnitures. Despite of this is the new hotel, every single parts were well maintained, clean and beautiful. Other than maintenance, there were many USB charging ports and international power converters were equipped in the desk and AV wall. Room lighting adjustment, view from bus tab, rain shower, work desk, Nespresso, heavenly bed and etc. I liked all the items, ideas and technologies in the room. Executive lounge was crowded, but they arranged enough staff over there and looked they were treated all customers very well. As the lounge was

title: What an excellent hotel!!
desc: The rooms are clean and beautiful. The location of this hotel is in the business district but taxis are at the hotel constantly the the MRT is just outside the door. The main restaurant is fabulous. Remember this hotel lobby is on the 32 floor and rooms are located above that. Most important ....the STAFF is OUTSTANDING! They will make your stay a dream come true. Thanks for being SO great!

title: Perfect Stay....Ever
desc: I stayed at this hotel for several times and this time I came back again for my friend birthday trip. The hotel location was perfect, walking 3 minuets from subway and 10 minuets to Marina Bay. The room very clean, new and comfortable. Restaurant very nice with the view and decorations. The food very testy and fresh. This is the top quality and high standard service of the best hotel in Singapore.And I would like to say thank you to Ms.Nammi for her service and helpful. She prepared us the room with the nice view by the ocean and also provided the professional service. I will be back again and again.

title: Go for the pool!
desc: Working trip.... but took a minute to check out the amazing infinity pool, high up overlooking the Singapore skyline. Very cool. The hotel is well located near the marina (lovely for a jet lag busting run around), and overall, a modern, stylist hotel. The entrance feels a bit odd (and I challenge you to find the buttons for the lifts on the ground floor...). Well worth a visit... even if just for the pool!

title: Wonderful Hotel
desc: I have stayed in Westin Hotels around the world; this Westin is a wonderful 5 Star hotel. Modern, clean, cheerful, this Westin has the perfect location to visit Singapore. Though we haven’t taken advantage of the in-house restaurants, they are available. Room service is perfect, the gym is very nice, the pool is beautiful but closed for scheduled maintenance. The Westin Singapore is a wonderful hotel.

title: Perfect Stay At An Immaculate Hotel With An Incredible Staff
desc: I recently stayed at The Westin Singapore for two nights with my girlfriend in the middle of a two week vacation. Even from before our visit they had been diligent about emailing us to ensure that all of our needs were accommodated before we stayed. Upon arriving, everything we could have imagined was taken care of, and although Singapore was an early stop on our vacation, The Westin ensured that it would be the most memorable!

title: One of the worst hotel I had - even I am a SPG Platinum
desc: I have to say this is one of the worst hotel I had in my traveller's life, albeit I am a SPG platinum member. I am not going to express my anger here, just write some fact to share: 1) A regular welcome letter and free fruit plate, but the fruit was rotten... Also, there were only one bottle of water in the room, where usually we would have two to four (the Le Meridien Jakarta even gave me 6...). I have to call the staff up to take away the rotten fruit and fill me with more water... 2) I don't care about the upgrade (usually I am entitled to), but the fun part was the receptionist welcomed me and spent 20 minutes to me on why I did not get a upgrade - because the hotel is full. Well, I even did not bother about that, but I was mad because I was tired and waiting for the

title: Fantastic Hotel
desc: My wife and I stayed here on a recent stop over and must say we wished it had been for a few more days. From the meet and greet at the airport to the drop off the next day I could not fault the whole experience. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and could not do enough to help make our stay enjoyable. As a Platinum member we we given an upgrade room with a view over the water. The rooms were quite spacious and had all the amenities that you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The club area was very nice as well with an excellent selection of food and drinks. The concierge recommended an excellent Peking Duck place right next door. The breakfast selection was varied and very fresh with eggs made to order. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to Singapore

title: Gd service
desc: Very attentive and great service provided by Sri. Sri made great effort in ensuring that my girl friends and I had an enjoyable and pleasant experience at The Westin. Sri also provided us with clear and precise information about the SPG group rewards plan. Thank you for the great service.

title: I still feel cheated -
desc: The pictures that the management of the Westin/Starwood have chosen to leave on their website no longer represent reality, I feel let down and cheated as I was sold something that just does not exist, I no longer trust the management of the Westin/Starwood; - Upon checking in we were told the pool and entire pool area are closed for a month. When we booked (mid January) there was no mention of this on their website and we received no email/call to inform us. Angela Fox their manager confirmed they tried to reach out to everyone - I just do not believe they have - I wasn't informed. Angela explained it must have been Expedia (hotels.com) that didn't pass on the message - frankly this is a poor excuse - you as the management of the Wesitin/Starwood are responsible, it's your
